column1: Connector token not saving correctly
column33:
From Andre:

App: [https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/39571|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/39571]
I created a Connector to test OpenAPI response and as it’s an authenticated request, I added the Bearer Token. It looks like an EnvVar was added to the api.js file but when trying to deploy, it failed (stack trace is the first message in the app Activity Log) because of the newly added token.

Issue with react-native-dotenv: [https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/crowdbotics-apps/andre-test-mar-27-39571/4/workflows/c8bdd4fc-a811-4993-afe7-7a610591a870/jobs/12|https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/crowdbotics-apps/andre-test-mar-27-39571/4/workflows/c8bdd4fc-a811-4993-afe7-7a610591a870/jobs/12]


Another issue is regarding the connector code generated in GitHub. When I first added the connector, and it has a token, the token was correctly added to the openAPI store, but after changing the connector detail to add a few more fields to the response and save, the token was removed from the code. I had to go back to the connector and add the token again and save, then it was added back to the connector’s store.

----

Steps to test and reproduce

# Go to Connectors page
# Create a connector with Bearer auth (can be fake information)
# Save
# Check if env var is added to the connector code like this: [https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/aline-032923-dev-73007/blob/323de66db33c0ccd349eb64c10a0bf33958c89cc/store/rapidAPICocktails/api.js#L8|https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/aline-032923-dev-73007/blob/323de66db33c0ccd349eb64c10a0bf33958c89cc/store/rapidAPICocktails/api.js#L8|smart-link] 
# Go to "Active in my project" tab
# Edit the connector (like the description or new data call) - but do not edit the auth token. Save
# Expect the Bearer header to still exist in the connector generated code.

column1: External webhook status updates
column33:
Investigate missed webhook calls from CircleCI & how to improve it. That's the root cause of the infinite loader on deployments in progress.

Websockets are great, but perhaps we also need a long polling component in case it doesn't receive a response.

Should we run a separate queue on AWS for webhook calls or something similar?

----

Unless we have 99.9xxx uptime we will miss webhooks. (GH, CircleCI, etc) so we are losing data. 

AWS SQS+Lambda is an option. → Get arch diagram about how this works. (Amazon CDK) → is there a prebuilt CDK we can use?

In general, we should treat webhooks as non-lossy which isn't true, Waiting on a webhook is OK, but for robustness we have to treat the lossy nature of webhook notifications by potentially query for status (as a backup plan)

----

Part 1: Webhook Architecture

Part 2: Dashboard Reliability & Improvements
column114:

column1: Spike - Investigate posible improvement on API call PerformanceViewSet.get
column193:
06/Apr/23 8:48 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] findings for this spike

*Issue:*

For performance issue on this endpoint, the cause was the third party API call, the Github API.

# It calls for all the commits for specific project repo from the year back. It gets list of commits from year back,
# Then, it calls all those individual commits endpoint. If the project is just beginner, then it’s fine. But for large project there are 50s or `100s of commits within the year. So, it was doing API call for these every commits so it was taking several seconds(more than 30 seconds). This one endpoint was contributing much more to the Github API rate limit issue we are having.


*Plan of Action:*

# We store commits in the database now so we can leverage that data in the database instead of the API this will improve this a lot
# On top of that, we can add cache for the endpoint data, this will improve this more, and this endpoint time will lower to < sec.
# There will be some issue with the failed {{Github Webhook}} sometime since we have  uptime issue now. We have to fix this via some logic so that the commits in the database are up to date.
# While investigating this, we are storing every commit now(for each branch) in the database. May be we should only store the commits in the master branch, since that is the actual commit that counts.

cc: [~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692] [~accountid:60b681f3994185007431bb28] [~accountid:63ecf71dd08a73e538f4305c]

column193:
03/Apr/23 10:52 PM;6218ca6e8e1bf0006932204d;*Test case:-*

1- [Verify that user is able to create data models.|https://cbtcms.herokuapp.com/case/4138/]
column194:
04/Apr/23 7:08 AM;606b37582b469c0070240ac7;Discussion: Is there any specific reason for using the cache on the data models? 
Currently, what it does is store the {{data model}} created until the modelbuilder adds it to the repository. Then it saves the object in our DB and the cache is refreshed. With this approach, we have a problem when a User adds a new model after saving because when the modelbuilder finishes adding the code, the cache is refreshed and the unsaved model is removed from the cache and the User loses his/her work. 

Could we save the {{data model}} first in our DB and then send it to the modelbuilder to add it to the Repo? We can update a meta field under the {{data model}} object to mark it as {{new_model=false}} when the modelbuilder finishes. Doing this will prevent losing the User's work, and also if the modelbuilder fails for some reason and the {{data model}} is not added/updated, we can save it again and the modelbuilder will be triggered one more time with the previous data.

column1: SPIKE - Investigate diff between the dataclip and bot coverage dashboard
column33:
h1. Rationale/Motivation and Context

There is a discrepancy between the bot coverage numbers generated from the code within the repository [https://github.com/crowdbotics/repo-coverage-tools/tree/PLAT-10472-part-1|https://github.com/crowdbotics/repo-coverage-tools/tree/PLAT-10472-part-1|smart-link] 

and the numbers pulled from the database using the SQL query

{noformat}WITH
-- Change the proper dates here
    start_date_const AS (VALUES (date '2023-01-01')),
    end_date_const AS (VALUES (date '2023-01-31'))
SELECT DISTINCT "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."id", "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."full_name", 
"crowdbotics_githubrepo"."custom_name",
COALESCE("djstripe_plan"."id", 'free') as plan,
"cb_slack_teammemberrole"."email",
COUNT("projects_commit"."id") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))) AS "commit_count",
-- Lines of code count
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const) )
and (coalesce("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'username', '') NOT LIKE 'crowdbotics-apps')
and (coalesce("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'name', '') NOT LIKE '%dependabot%')
), 0) AS "loc_human",
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))
and ("projects_commit"."data" @> '{"author":{"username": "crowdbotics-apps"}, "message": "Initial commit."}' )
), 0) AS "loc_scaffold",
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))
and (coalesce("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'username', '') LIKE 'crowdbotics-apps')
and ("projects_commit"."data"->>'message' != 'Initial commit.' )
), 0) AS "loc_non_human",
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const) )
and (UPPER("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'name') LIKE UPPER('%dependabot%'))
), 0) AS "loc_dependabot",
-- End lines of code
"crowdbotics_githubrepo"."created_on" FROM "crowdbotics_githubrepo" 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "cb_slack_teammemberrole" ON ("crowdbotics_githubrepo"."owner_id" = "cb_slack_teammemberrole"."id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "auth_user" ON ("cb_slack_teammemberrole"."django_user_id" = "auth_user"."id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "projects_commit" ON ("crowdbotics_githubrepo"."id" = "projects_commit"."project_id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "djstripe_subscription" ON ("crowdbotics_githubrepo"."subscription_id" = "djstripe_subscription"."djstripe_id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "djstripe_plan" ON ("djstripe_subscription"."plan_id" = "djstripe_plan"."djstripe_id") 
WHERE NOT (UPPER("auth_user"."email"::text) LIKE UPPER('%@crowdbotics.com%') AND "auth_user"."email" IS NOT NULL)
GROUP BY "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."id", "djstripe_plan"."id", "cb_slack_teammemberrole"."email" HAVING COUNT("projects_commit"."id") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))
-- amount of non-dependabot commits are > 0
AND (UPPER("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'name') NOT LIKE UPPER('%dependabot%'))) > 0
ORDER BY "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."created_on" DESC{noformat}

We need to understand why the SQL query is generating different numbers compared to the analysis from the GitHub repository.

h1. Description:

# Find out the exact product data clip that the SQL query is being run on, run the SQL query and get metrics from the SQL statement.
# Look into the database data and come up with the root cause of why data is different between the two and what potentially could be causing the problem.
# Report findings to SLT, and [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] and try to come up with the agreed upon approach to calculating bot coverage
column193:
03/Apr/23 1:55 PM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] 

So here are some initial observations between the two.

Project: {{github.com/crowdbotics-apps/ews-23386}}

# Within GitHub on the main branch there are 103 commits, within the DB there are 210 commits registered
# Within the DB field {{lines_of_code}} seems to be measuring additions + deletions, within GH, we can separated out addition LOC and deleted LOC, doing some simple math, GH(addition LOC + delete LOC) == DB.{{lines_of_code}}
# There are times that I’m matching date timestamps between DB and Github, the Github has different LOC additions compared to DB LOC additions



I’m going to dig more into why there are so many commits within the DB compared to GitHub, and I’m going to run my analysis across all projects that have been registered within opensearch.
column194:
04/Apr/23 10:31 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] I’ve enough analysis to come to a conclusion. Here’s the analysis of the commits (from webhooks) within the DB



*Why Things are Problematic:*

* Added lines calculates additions to the source code, there are a lot of times LOC ownership changes because lines are modified changing ownership from CB code -> custom code

* Added lines calculations sums up additions and subtractions, this over-inflates the total LOC per project

* LOC count within the DB counts all code changes for any branch, branch changes register a change, merge from branch into master also register a change

* Inspecting the `data` field within the DB doesn't populate the `remove` field, so we have no a way of adding and subtracting lines



_Take for example a project called crowdbotics-apps/eva-mazzei-cogplay-33731_

DB Total LOC = 6,526,031

Running cloc on master src = 412,674

Bot Analysis = 359,198 (could be filtering related - haven't dug into it)
column195: 04/Apr/23 10:46 AM;5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e;May I understand the conclusion here? Specifically, is the number we’re reporting from DB inaccurate or is the bot coverage number from the script inaccurate? What would be helpful is a summary that shows the difference between the script and the DB for that specific project you mention below.
column196:
04/Apr/23 11:29 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] 

Yes, my apologies for not giving a conclusion:

The source of truth is cloning the project locally and running {{cloc}}. I took a sample project  _eva-mazzei-cogplay-33731_ and the numbers are as follows

Total LOC *412,674*

The same calculations (summing up added LOC) from the *_database_* give *6,526,031*, which is *incorrect.* We should NOT use the DB LOC based on the points mentioned within the [comments below|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10815?focusedCommentId=55751]. If we were to adapt the DB implementation we would need to split out the {{line_of_code}} within the DB into *additions* and *subtractions*. We would also need to avoid double count when there is a commit into other branches other than {{master}} or {{main}}, currently, it's counting all commits in every branch. That and the summation of additions and subtraction puts the number a 10x magnitude over what the actual number is.

The Bot Coverage numbers are very close to the source of truth (Clone+cloc) at *359,198.* I haven’t analyzed why it’s 50K fewer lines of code than the clone+cloc method, but I am assuming it has to do with the additional filtering that’s currently being done.



*Conclusion:*

DO NOT use the DB summation



*Options:*

# See if we can modify production to extract the additions and subtractions from the webhook, detect if the commit is into master/main
# Use the bot coverage code from the code2infra team
# Another method, we can count commits via GitHub GraphQL API and specifically only on the default/main branch
column197: 04/Apr/23 11:31 AM;5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e;Thanks! So, are you confident that the DB-based query is over-reporting bot coverage numbers? Meaning that it’s not just total LOC that’s over-reported, but it’s also over-reporting the number of lines of code generated by the codegen engine.
column198:
04/Apr/23 1:09 PM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] 

>> So, are you confident that the DB-based query is over-reporting bot coverage numbers?

I can’t even answer that question because the base Total LOC is wrong from the DB

e.g. *Bot Coverage* = CB LOC / Total LOC, 

So my initial approach is to see if the Total LOC is accurate by recreating the Total LOC from the DB. Which it isn’t.

Any number you plugin into to CB LOC will be completely off as the Total LOC is not accurate.

column1: GitHub App for Enterprise Project Repos

Create GitHub App & cb-apps repo in Enterprise customer’s Organization’s GitHub Enterprise Account.

Essentially, we want to create the necessary functionality required to push commits to an Enterprise customer’s Organization’s GitHub repo associated with their GH Enterprise Account.

column1: Azure support
column33:
support self-managed private cloud azure deployments

# identify credentials given/permissions needed to our platform to enable this
## what type of technology are we using in Azure cloud for deployments
## identify the most secure networking security policy
### acceptable IPs
#### Ex.: no public IPs
#### Ex.: white-labeling (Cisco VPN required)
### policies going out of the server



+*How would our infra change to support other deployment targets?*+

→ terraform script to run to different destinations?

hosting in someone else’s environment will be complicated

* keep tabs on API keys for all environments for all customer projects
** have IM policy to access secret share in vault to retrieve PKs in their private cloud



django-organization as the base point to store keys?

make more modularized (scripts remain the same) hardcoded for running on Crowdbotics (one account for now).



how do they know where it will be deployed?

→ manually on the BE?

→ someone goes into the Admin panel to set this up for now, but should have this capability within the dashboard (will need to provide the customer with the option during set up)



Infrastructure setup → run teraform? or use Azure devops?

* run continuous deployments with GH Actions
* Komatsu locked into Microsoft so will use Azure devops
* Nothing on Heroku → will use Azure DB



enterprise standard → use teraform cloud



use Azure devops for simple enterprise apps



+*Questions*+

# How does this interract with GH Actions?
# How do we initiate it?
# Can we do this all through GH Actions or do we need a new API integration?



Phase 1: get it working using GH Actions



Phase 2: adding all missing features to dashboard (showing logs, etc.)



Note: if we go with Azure devops, will need to authenticate repo every time.



Azure deployment mimics GCP? Refactor to align.

column1: 'Deploy' button for customized deployment pipelines
column33:
The ‘Deploy’ buttons in Status > Build Status only trigger CircleCI pipeline. If a customer asks a Service team developer to customize their deployment pipeline by adding the requisite .yaml file to the project repo, then the ‘Deploy’ button will not work as intended.

 

→ We would need to make the ‘Deploy’ buttons configurable based on a technical user editing their project repo to use Azure devops pipeline instead.

column1: Handle GPT API call timeout
column33:
The call to GPT Api needs to be async. We have to find a way to handle in case there is a big response in time.



backend will wait to hear from frontend, send a “I received” response, send request to chatgpt, then send a response to the frontend through a websocket

Frontend will send off the response to the server and wait for a response in a websocket response

h3. Conversation Details

# Call Heroku Endpoint
## Heroku endpoint responds that the request has been received (202 ACCEPTED)
## Calls Celery Worker

{code:javascript}// Note: this pseudocode is not syntactically accurate.

const data = {appName: “foo”, appType: “ride-sharing”, description: “asdfadfadfs”}

chain(
 createPRDPrompt(data) // returns prompt, 
 callGPT(gptPrompt), // return gptResponse
 processResponse(gptResponse), // return prdResponse 
 storeResponseInDatabase(prdResponse) // return prdResponse
 sendPRDResponseToSocket(prdResponse)
);{code}
column114:
The frontend sends off a request and waits for a response through our websocket implementation. 

The frontend will display a loading indicator, for feedback to the user that something is happening

When the response is received through the websocket, the page will update with the received information.

column1: Migrate all non-essential production operations on the DB to followers
column33:
h1. Rationale and Motivations:

We want to remove the load off of the production database for non-essential application functions. There have been reports that data clips, ETL processes and other non-essential operations are happening on the production database. If these operations are causing more load onto the production database or are locking the database for an extended period of time (seconds) they should be moved away from the master database.

h1. Description:

The list of steps are as follows:

* Identify possible operations that are happening on the main production database. Currently, Dataclips, ETL pipelines, and Analytical commands. There could be more, *Eng. to Discover*
* Create sub-tasks for the remediation of these operations. e.g. move them to follower DB; setup follow DB if one isn’t created
* Inform teams within Crowdbotics to change their DB endpoints to follower endpoints if they are using the main production database.
column114:
* Audit of operations on the main production database should reveal no long-running operations are being executed
* Observe downtime, quantitatively and qualitatively based upon feedback from users of the platform that things are getting better

column1: TECH-ENABLER: Enable Project Sharing per Organization
column33:
h1. Goals:

We want to enable other teams [Studio, MPOS] by providing an API endpoint to allow the following:

# For the query of projects based on the organization

h3. Out of Scope:

There will be no UI for this feature; the workflows and UX for sharing Projects is out of scope

We are to provide an API and the organization implementation (in the DB).

*For V1, we will add the django-organization and update the project model/endpoint for project sharing.* 

*For now, organization creation and user addition will be done via the django admin panel.*

h1. Description and Specification:

# Using the organization framework that was integrated based upon [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10716|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10716|smart-link]:
## There MUST be a relationship between Projects-to-Organization, the project is an organizational project if the User is a part of the Organization
# Create an API, or add to the existing API the ability to query projects based on a Project->User->Organization relationship

h1. Users/Projects and Organizational Permissions:

_Note: Leave app-level permissions as they are_

* Org-Owner has full access to all organizational apps
* Org-Owner can add/remove users from the organization
* Org-Members can access all apps
* Org-Members can NOT remove/add users to the organization

h1. Forward-Looking Statements:

The only difference between Project and Component is that we _might_ bill on the total number of projects created by an organization. In that case, an org admin might want to see all the projects their org owns - regardless of whether the creator wants the project shared.

*_Since we are de-scoping private organizational projects, please consider this statement when building the relationship._*
column114:
# Permission testing must be done so results returned do not cross organizational boundaries.
# Regression should be done so that nothing has broken, including unit testing, existing business logic, migrations, etc.

column194:
29/Mar/23 7:02 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] is there no need to have private projects or individual projects using an enterprise login?

If not I’ll refactor
column195: 29/Mar/23 7:08 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] updated Ticket based upon Charath’s comments
column196: 29/Mar/23 7:15 AM;5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e;[~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] That thought did cross my mind, but I’m thinking for an initial release we stick with making all projects in an org visible to that org, especially since the number of self-serve users will be low(er) in the next 2-3 months. If the delta effort to support this is small (say 1-2 points), I say go ahead and add in the feature.
column197:
29/Mar/23 7:19 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e] I assume that we’d follow the Components model which we are already doing within [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10716|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10716|smart-link] [~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835] to comment on complexity.

However, I’m all for less complexity 🙂 I’m going to leave it the way you mentioned Charath unless Saurav has a better recommendation
column198:
29/Mar/23 7:21 AM;5beb030baa4d662213a8f37e;The only difference between Project and Component is that we _might_ bill on total number of projects created by an organization. In that case, an org admin might want to see all the projects that their org owns - regardless of whether the creator wants the project shared or not.

Keeping complexity low(er) for now is fine. I agree that this might become a requirement in the future.

Basically, branched off the Branch of this component sharing ticket. Should we review this after the component sharing one is merged?



In terms of org permission to project, under current implementation, organization members can have admin or member access to the org project based on the slack discussion. Basically, Org owner and admins have admin access to the org project and org members have member access to the project. This should be fine for now, if you guys can do different then we can do that.

column1: SPIKE - Permissions Discussion
column33:
[~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] [~accountid:61084bde75ad9600691fd79f] 

I’m leaving this as a placeholder for the conversation that needs to take place around permissions. Everybody is familiar with what this means-- if a ticket needs to be created from this, we can use this here or create a new one. 

Particularly, this convo started around *QA* having the ability to move tasks back from *Testing* into *In Progress* as a result of QA automation.

column1: Slack Notifications
column33:
Whenever a QA event or Customer Approval event happens, we want to send a Slack notification to the *internal project channel*, to update the PM, and provide accountability/paper-trail. 



# We need to check/confirm if the *internal project channel* for Slack is listed in the admin panel. If not, this is a prerequisite for automation, and Delivery will set this up.
# After QA Event (pass/fail), send an automated Slack message to the internal project channel with the following content:
## *Description:* This is an automated message to let you know that QA just *[passed/rejected] [Task Name] (Task ID) (Timestamp)*
### If rejected: *[List Reason for Rejection]*
### If rejected: Whether FE, BE, Both, or Unsure was selected (as indicator of what needs to be fixed)
## Tag the PM
# After Customer Approval pass/rejection, send automated Slack message to internal project channel with the following content:
## *Description:* This is an automated message to let you know that QA just *[passed/rejected] [Task Name] (Task ID) (Timestamp)*
### If rejected: *[List Reason for Rejection]*



Note: we _may_ want to handle this through [Customer.io|http://Customer.io]. I please ask [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] to discuss what makes the most sense (it may likely be doing this from platform). Something to sync up on.

column1: Dummy image library
Environment Branching with GitLab Flow
column33:
h1. Rationale and Motivation

As our Engineering Organization grows, we need a better branching strategy for release management. More often than not, we run into these scenarios:

* QA needs a release branch to be frozen for 4-5 days to run regression testing. Inflight changes do sometimes break the test cases/automation runs.
* On release day, there are times when we have to cherry-pick changes, as not all merges into staging have been thoroughly tested to go to production.
* On release day, some changes are reverted from {{master/main}} so as not to be picked up by the release.
* There are times when backend changes have gone into {{master/main}} without the accompanying frontend changes. On release day, there are often questions, _“Are the BE changes in before FE changes? Does it affect existing functionality if the BE changes are in without the FE changes?”_
* There are times when we want to *hotfix* a release; in those times, we need to either pull in all of the changes from {{master/main}} to create the release or create a branch from a tag to apply the *hotfix*.

h1. Goals

We want to promote code ownership.

We want to enable our Eng teams to release.

We want to be intentional and control precisely the changes from *Develop → Staging*; and from *Staging → Production.*

We want to increase our confidence when releasing by validating all changes going to Production.

h1. Description

Enable the goals we will be moving to a GitLab flow based on environments. See the [reference link|https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/topics/gitlab_flow.html#environment-branches-with-gitlab-flow] for more details. 

The diagram doesn’t portray what we are trying to achieve. The exact definition is listed below

h4. Staging:

* Engineers work off of {{develop}} in both {{crowdbotics-slack-app}} and {{vue-dash-5104}}
* Feature branches are created and merged into {{develop}} branch to be auto-deployed to a staging Heroku instance
* PRs are evaluated by deploying a review app for _developer_ testing (*only*)

*Pre-Prod:*

* Once developers are happy with their changes, FE and BE changes are merged into the {{preprod}} branch . This signals QA to run a regression test suite against a fixed, frozen branch.
* Merging changes from {{develop}} into {{preprod}} will require a PR, a review before the merge.
* Merging code into {{preprod}} will auto-deploy to Heroku, here the database has as close to production data as possible
* Hotfixes will be applied to {{preprod}} tested by QA and backported to {{develop}}
* Additionally, other process can be applied, including security scanning (static and dynamic), weekly load testing, etc.

*Production:*

* Only when QA has signed off on all changes within {{preprod}} can the code be released
* A PR is created and reviewed by at least 2 code owners before promoting changes from {{preprod}} to {{production}} branch
column114:

column1: Differentiate Image Settings between image from Link or from Local PC
column33:
We currently do not display a filename for locally uploaded images. Right now in uploading images from the image dragged element, it does not seem like we are passing the file name of a local image when we upload it from PC. We would like to differentiate the image user experience a little better with the following:

# Differentiate on the Canvas if the image selected is from local or from a URL
# -Pass in the Filename of an image file we upload as a prop when we upload from local (onUpdateImage  pragma.tsx)-
# -Display that filename on the panel instead of a URL if the image is uploaded from local.-
# Ensure the UI is intuitive and informative to the user as he/she clicks to different elements.

column1: Unnecesary calls to update_api_spec endpoint when moving Screens around
column33:
Every time a Screen is moved under the Canvas, the endpoint is triggered. 
If the {{api_spec_storage}} is empty ( usually when the canvas hasn’t any Django Module ), it will run the job to update the api_spec of the app, which takes a lot of time to run and increases worker4’s queue.
When the {{api_spec_storage}} has some data, it will automatically return it.


!Screen Shot 2023-03-27 at 17.02.16.png|width=372,height=143!

!Screencast 2023-03-28 10_22_45.mp4|width=1660,height=1126!

Expected result: api-spec endpoint should only be called once - when studio is opened and initial data is loading

column1: Optimize DB queries < 1 sec response rate
column33:
Postgres add-on → few queries weren’t optimized (took 2 seconds instead of 2 milliseconds).

Heroku recommends 10 milliseconds per query.

Ensure all query types have an average response rate of less than one second

column1: SPIKE: DB router for read/writes within Django
column33:
h1. Rationale and Motivations:

There is an assumption that having read and write operations within the main BE application will help with production loads on the database. (*THIS IS AN ASSUMPTION*). There have been increasing reports that the production and staging system has been experiencing higher-than-normal downtimes. We assume that one of the downtime contributors is the database due to query lag.

We need to validate this assumption that separating out reads from writes into separate databases is a viable solution to the problem

h1. Description:

Activities for this task include:

# What is the typical lag between read replication to the follower database, will the user notice? *(greater than 1 second is too much)*
# What technologies/packages/libraries exist right now for Django DB routing?
# What is the effort it will take to change some high-cost queries to be moved to the follower database? Please consider Review Apps, Staging and Production (effort)

The output of this ticket is a *go,* or *no go* for read/write databases.
column114: * Investigate how we would implement a DB router for Read/writes in Django under the assumption that all queries are optimized

column1: Redesign customer Task Approval flow
column33:
Improving the flow for when customers are ready to approve tasks. 

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Figma Master: [https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-14434&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-14434&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|smart-link] 
{panel}

# Replace current “Pass / Reject” with “Needs Approval” status indicator (frame 27279 in Figma)
# Implement Customer Approval Modal (frame 27280 in Figma)
## If customer approves:
### The Task moves from “Needs Approval” to “Done”
### The customer approval event will be recorded in “Task History” modal (see linked ticket)
## If customer rejects:
### Customer will input reason (required) for rejection
### Task moves back to “In Progress” automatically 
### Automated Slack message to PM/CSM (where, TBD) notifying that customer rejected a Task, and that this Task needs attention (i.e. re-assignment by PM)
#### *This will be done in* [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10789|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10789|smart-link] 
# Permissions: only the client will see this / have access
column114:

# Implement Customer Approval Modal (frame 27280 in Figma)
## If customer approves:
### The Task moves from “Needs Approval” to “Done”
### The customer approval event will be recorded in “Task History” modal (see linked ticket)
## If customer rejects:
### Customer will input reason (required) for rejection
### Task moves back to “In Progress” automatically 
# Permissions: only the client will see this / have access
# This will be created using bootstrap, i.e. our current styling/components. We want to remain consistent with the UI of our app across the board.

column1: Redesign QA History Modal, combined with Client Approval History
column33:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Master Figma file: [https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-14434&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-14434&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|smart-link] 
{panel}

# We are combining “QA History” with “Client Approval History” into one button, called “View Task History”. (reference in Figma master, in the screenshot of Task description)
# Redesign Task History modal according to Figma designs
## Note: filters b/w QA history, Client Approval history, and All
## Note: (Status Pills) Green for passed/approved; Red for client rejected; Yellow for QA rejected
# Include the developers who were working on a Task when it goes into QA (*TBD* how we present this in QA modal, but on BE we do want to track this)
# Permissions: everybody on project can view
column114:
# In the description section for every Task, there will be a button labeled “View Task History”. 
# “View Task History” will open a modal that follows the exact specifications as seen in [https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-14434&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-14434&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|smart-link] (frame 27283)
# User will have the ability to filter between “All”, “QA”, and “Client Approval” Events
# The color-coded pills will correspond to the status of the Task Event
## Green for passed/approved; Red for client rejected; Yellow for QA rejected
# Every event recorded will show: event timestamp, event result (i.e. pass/fail), and description when applicable (i.e. “this page didn’t load on my Android device”).
# This modal will be created using bootstrap, i.e. current styling components to remain consistent with the UI across our app as a whole.

column1: new data models not showing in studio data models menu
column33:
From Evan: I've noticed that when a data model is created, and then extended, that the new fields do not show up in the data model (connector) section in the canvas left sidebar. I've also observed that if I delete the data model, that it's not removed from the data model section in canvas. Here's the project that I was using for this test. (Recipe data model was added - only title, then all additional fields, then deleted).
[https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/39529/studio|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/39529/studio]

This may relate to [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10552|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10552|smart-link] .

The bug was reported by Evan in [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1679779467394049|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1679779467394049|smart-link]

column1: Research / Fix Computed property for TaskData causing mass calculations on Proposal tab
column33:
When viewing the PRD (proposal tab) for a application, while loading the milestones/tasks/subtasks, the computed property is constantly being updated with the new data coming in. Once you hit a certain number of milestones/tasks/subtasks the page almost becomes inoperable.  

There are also other items constantly being recalculated when new data is loaded:

* Delivery dates are being recalculated
* Prices are being recalculated
* Hours are being recalculated

What needs to be done for this ticket is to check to see if the computed property for this tab is

# Necessary or can be replaced so it’s update data by calling a function when necessary instead of all the time.
# If it is necessary, how can it be refactored to be more performant. 
# If not, how can we work alongside with [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-8676|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-8676|smart-link] 

See thread: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1677769839464459|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1677769839464459|smart-link]
column193:
30/Mar/23 2:32 PM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;_My findings with regards to what needs to be done for this ticket is to check to see if the computed property for this tab is_

# _Necessary or can be replaced so it’s update data by calling a function when necessary instead of all the time._
# _If it is necessary, how can it be refactored to be more performant._



* There Is quite a lot of computation being made inside the ServicesTabNew component all of which is actually needed. However, we can re define the component in these ways;
** We need to create smaller child components to allow for separation of logic which is actually called even when the section of the component isn’t actually rendered. For example;
*** The section of the component that renders `Items with ready-made code` can be it’s own component with it’s own logic separated from the parent component `ServicesTabNew` in this case
*** All logic that relates to `InLineTextEdit`  wrapper element component could be its own self managed with in the component. That is lines 75 - 111 in the `ServicesTabNew` component would be a component of its own just like lines 132 - 44 and more.
*** Doing this will reduce the number of data props passed to the Parent component and the inner logic computations would reduce
*** I also noticed that we have many repeated HTML structs. These would have been Smaller self managed components hence further reducing the logic inside the main parent component.
** We will also need to clean up un used computed props like `hasEstimatedMilestone`
** We can refactor some computed props to methods. Technically, a computed prop is one with which we are doing some sort of computations you would use a Reduce Array function otherwise, it’s better off as a function that is only evaluated once. Hence, computed props like; `fields, fieldsWithoutFirst, any prop that returns a permission value set` can all be refactored as methods
** We can also replace all setTimeouts with the Vue `NextTick` function since it is triggered after the component has been re evaluated based on a change which is more or so what we are trying to accomplish with setTimeouts
** We can also continue to work on taking out all axios calls to vuex
* In addition to all this. We can refactor the BE to return milestones only as the initial call, then as a user collapses a milestone, we can fetch Tasks  data for the individual milestone.

column1: BE construct prompt for GPT API
column33:
Accept a User description from the FE.

Use the description with a system prompt to retrieve code.

Send the generated code to the server when it’s ready (EG use a websocket).  We will allow many screens to generate code simultaneously so each screen should be able to ‘generate code’ async.

Return the code to the browser (Studio).  Return an error message if some issue occurred, like a timeout.

h2. Prompt

The prompt includes the *System* instructions and adds the *User* input.  It returns the RN code which is then directly returned to the Studio UI.

*_System_*

* Write the code for a React Native screen component. 
* Only import from react and react-native libraries. 
* Reply with only the code, no comments. 
* Include sufficient and relevant dummy data and placeholder images. 
* Make the screen design style be modern and very eye-catching. 
* The screen design must be optimized for modern smartphones in profile mode. 
* The screen should fulfill the description provided by the user. 

*_User_*

* [User Provided Description]



*Example in GPT API playground:*

column1: View last prompt with Undo
column33:
As a user makes changes to the design the user will want to see the last prompt they committed.           

Below the screen modification input we will show the most recent prompt that was committed for this screen along with the screen code that existed before the prompt.  The previous prompt and screen version is only stored in session and does not need to persist to the server.

When a user clicks “Make Changes” as outlined in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10731|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10731|smart-link] we will save a local copy of the screen code that existed before the AI changes were sent.  We’ll refer to this screen code as “*Previous version*”.   The code returned by the AI when it is complete we will refer to as “*AI modified version*”.

The following options are available for the last change: 

* Revert - Restores the ”*Previous version*” of the screen.  When this is clicked it will re-render the screen and show a ‘strikethrough’ for the text from the last change.  A new button “Restore” will show in the “Last change” box to replace the “Revert” button.
* Restore - This restores the “*AI modified version*”.  This allows the user to effectively toggle between the two versions of the screen.
* -Retry - Re-runs the prompt.  Doing this will delete the “-*-AI modified version-*-” and retry it.  This would be the same effect as if the user typed the same prompt into the input box and clicked “Modify Screen” again.-
* Undo All Changes - reverts back to the last saved code (last commit) for a screen.  Show a confirmation modal “This will undo all changes to this screen since the last time you saved the project. Are you sure?”

If the user enters an additional change and clicks “Make Changes” it will overwrite the “Previous version” with the current screen code.

If the screen is “*New from AI*” then the last prompt will show the user description and the only option is “Retry”.

!image-20230329-170812.png|width=283,height=266!

Include a new button on the error screen ( [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10733|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10733|smart-link] ) that only shows up for alterations made from AI.

* Revert - clicking this button will function the same as Revert mentioned above, but appear on the screen.

h3. Design

The designs for this ticket can be found here:
[https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=524%3A17622&t=oyQRoMsRejCJYUkP-1|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=524%3A17622&t=oyQRoMsRejCJYUkP-1|smart-link]

column195:
26/Apr/23 11:55 AM;63fced039cba7ca02876f0a9;Hi [~accountid:621e5f214160640069c616ec] , regarding the “retry” feature…

…by “retry” you mean “reprocess a screen generation (or screen enhancements) that was failed or cancelled”?

If so, it makes a lot of sense.


From the “retry” button, we can have two possible actions: create another job with the same {{user_prompt}} and {{process_type}} as before (with base code in case of {{update}}) or we can reopen the last job from the {{job_id}} received on the socket on the last time we received a response (reopen a job is not implemented). I would vote for creating another job to keep history of executed jobs, only if resending all previous data is easy to implement.

Just to avoid rework, check this [PR|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4357]. It goes pretty much in the direction you want. I added {{process_type}} to _JobAIScreenGenerator_ model and also added a {{base_code}} (not required) to enhance some code if {{process_type=update}}. Check if it fits your needs and if you want to enhance it.
column196:
26/Apr/23 12:25 PM;621e5f214160640069c616ec;[~accountid:63fced039cba7ca02876f0a9] yes, by retrying I’m mean to re-request the AI for a screen enhancement with the same exact prompt used before.

I think that a new job_id might be better. I’ve taken a look to the PR and that is way similar to what I’m requesting haha.

A little more context info: I’ve implemented “an array of versions” for each screen+ai (saving the base code and the prompt). So the user will be able to quickly go back and forth as many version as we want to support. The idea is that if the user clicks on “retry” I’ll be sending the promp of the version the user is using at that point to get a new code base. I’ll take that new code base to replace the actual and if there are future versions of the code I will delete all of them (i.e: the user creates 4 for enhacements by asking the AI to add new things to the screen, then he click the “undo” button 2 times so the actual version will have “future” versions that the user can still access by a button “redo” to be created).

Regarding the {{process_type}} I do think that will work. Can I pass a new value like “retry” to be able to distinguish between update and retry?

Here is a brief description of what to expect. There is also a video on the PR:


* Undo functionality
* Redo functionality
* Undo All functionality (with confirmation modal)
* Retry functionality was removed from the final version as agreed with Dave
* A few visual enhancements on the right panel itself
* If you are on a middle version (i.e: you have 5 version of the screen, so you go back to the third version) and change the screen by using the modify screen functionality future version (ie: version 4 and version 5) should be removed

If any comments/doubts, please let me know

column1: BE

DESIGN
Enterprise Account Onboarding Screen
column33:
When a new Enterprise Customer signs up for an Enterprise Account Plan, we must create a one-page onboarding form that a representative from our sales team or the Enterprise account owner submits in order to establish general settings &/or default permissions around artifact/component sharing (i.e. Private Catalog / Private Modules)

Ex.: GitLab

column1: BE: Auto retry failed from AI response

column194:
27/Apr/23 8:04 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;I have been investigating this and took a closer look at the sentry logs, and except for [DatabaseError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4116637585/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=4], [ServiceUnavailableError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125324099/events/0cfe5b79122a412ba105ee8b9d034465/?project=1464665&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=previous-event&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=1], and [SynchronousOnlyOperation|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125240797/events/799e7c618c8446dbbda8d16ffb8718fa/?project=1464665&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=previous-event&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=4], all other issues are already taking 2+ minutes. +Should we really be auto-retrying those? Or maybe we should just do a better job communicating those errors on UI?+

*_Some other notes:_*

For [ServiceUnavailableError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125324099/events/0cfe5b79122a412ba105ee8b9d034465/?project=1464665&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=previous-event&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=1] we could have an auto-retry, given it fails almost instantaneously.

[DatabaseError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4116637585/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=4] and [SynchronousOnlyOperation|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125240797/events/799e7c618c8446dbbda8d16ffb8718fa/?project=1464665&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=previous-event&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=4] are issues that are happening on our side, so we could have better handling of them. Maybe even get rid of them completely.

For [Exception|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4088296399/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=0] we need to have a better description because it simply does not have enough info to debug.

[APIError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125132522/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=1], [RateLimitError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4123114081/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=2], and [Timeout|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4124901746/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=3] are all OpenAI internal issues that we can’t really resolve on our own. 



CC: [~accountid:63fced039cba7ca02876f0a9] [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] [~accountid:606b37582b469c0070240ac7]
column195:
27/Apr/23 8:07 AM;63fced039cba7ca02876f0a9;From celery worker perspective, I do not think we should “auto-retry”. If we just communicate the error, the front-end enhancements will lead the user to retry it from there. If we do it, we are going to have multiple jobs running for the same purpose, right?


{quote}[APIError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125132522/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=1], [RateLimitError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4123114081/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=2], and [Timeout|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4124901746/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=3] are all OpenAI internal issues that we can’t really resolve on our own.{quote}

Completely agree.


I have implemented a proposal to test an [approach|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4357] of providing better messages to front-end and removed “retry” completely. Check it and tell me what you think about it.
column196:
27/Apr/23 8:10 AM;63fced039cba7ca02876f0a9;{quote}[DatabaseError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4116637585/?project=1464774&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=4], [ServiceUnavailableError|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125324099/events/0cfe5b79122a412ba105ee8b9d034465/?project=1464665&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=previous-event&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=1], and [SynchronousOnlyOperation|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/issues/4125240797/events/799e7c618c8446dbbda8d16ffb8718fa/?project=1464665&query=message%3A%5Brequest_screen_generation_to_ai_worker%2C+generate_prd_from_ai%2C+suggest_change_to_existing_prd_ai_generated%5D&referrer=previous-event&statsPeriod=14d&stream_index=4]{quote}

Yes, these are the only ones, “self.retry” only for those exceptions is really the only ones.

column1: Failed screen render from AI response
column33:
PLAT-10733-B 

We need to show an error screen when there is a problem rendering the screen after code generation from AI. This may happen when the AI fails to return code in a timely manner, returns something that is not code, returns code that cannot be rendered in studio, and other issues

Acceptance Criteria

* Saved text prompt & populate text area after error to allow user to retry
* Generalized error msg (until we return more useful errors)
* aligned dropdown icons from all screen dropdowns
* styled screen according to figma
* disabled view code (enable code editor) when no code to avoid crash
* !image-20230406-190429.png|width=408,height=763!


----

-We need to show an error screen when there is a problem rendering the screen after code generation from AI. This may happen when the AI fails to return code in a timely manner, returns something that is not code, returns code that cannot be rendered in studio, and other issues.-

-We need to show an error image with the error message (if available) on the screen.  We will provide options for retry, undo, or debug with code editor.-

* -Retry - clicking this button will send the last prompt for this screen in an attempt to get an improved result.-
* -_Undo and Revert - clicking this button will delete the last prompt from history and restore the code before the AI’s update._-
* -Debug Code - clicking this button will open the code editor.-

-If the user is creating a new screen we will show the description input box and “create screen” button instead of “retry”.-

-[Mockup Needed] The attached picture is just a reference point for the closest thing we have in the master design. Or- [https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=12-2444&t=0hRVXeY9rjLZhIgp-0|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=12-2444&t=0hRVXeY9rjLZhIgp-0|smart-link]

column1: Loading Screen waiting on AI response
column33:
While waiting for the response from the AI  we will show an animation within the screen.  The response will come from a websocket pubsub.

If the screen is being generated as a new screen we will show “Creating Screen” text with the animation.  If this is a modification to an existing screen we’ll show “Making Changes”.

A cancel button at the bottom of a screen will allow the user to cancel the request and revert to the most recent code.  For a new screen it will revert back to the “description” screen to allow the user to enter/update the description.

If the screen cannot render (throws an error) we will show an error screen which is covered in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10733|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10733|smart-link]

column1: Update Screen with AI
column33:
Studio users will be able to update existing screens using AI.  Unlike creating a new screen which converts a text description into a new screen’s code; this will convert existing screen code and a text command (eg alteration) into an updated version of the screen code.

Process:

# User selects an existing screen
# User sees “Make Changes” text input in screen details panel (right panel) at the top
# User enters update in the modify panel text input and clicks “Make Changes” button.
# System prompt + user input is sent to AI.
# Screen shows “Making Changes” animation with option to cancel (same as [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10732|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10732|smart-link] but with different text).
## Cancel reverts the code back to what it was before clicking “Making Changes”.
# AI returns code
# Screen renders the code (or shows error message with options).

!image-20230329-163359.png|width=348,height=366!

column1: New Screen with AI
column33:
Option to create a screen from AI added to the screen menu dropdown (first option).

When this option is used then a screen is shown with a prompt within it.  This prompt allows the user to enter a description and sends this description to the GPT API (through our API prompt schema).

The description entered will be saved to the screen’s description.

-If the user cancels while the screen is being generated revert back to initial “Screen Description” page.-

When the screen is loaded provide the user with a “retry” option.

!image-20230324-030303.png|width=273,height=570!

Overall design: [https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=12-2444|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=12-2444|smart-link]
column114:
Accept a User description from the FE.

Use the description with a system prompt to retrieve code.

Send the generated code to the server when it’s ready (EG use a websocket).  We will allow many screens to generate code simultaneously so each screen should be able to ‘generate code’ async.

User can cancel code generation and revert to description input screen.

Return the code to the browser (Studio).  Return an error message if some issue occurred, like a timeout.

column194:
27/Mar/23 11:56 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;I updated the epic with the overall information for all the stories including the figma and notion docs.  

I would like to allow AI generation to continue even if the user leaves the page.  However, we don’t have a way to handle multiple versions (yet) so we would have to commit and overwrite the former code.  So, the solution for now would be to show a confirmation modal when saving that says “AI generation not complete, save anyway?” and show the New Screen + AI (with the description input and save the description (this description is the screen/module details description) when they return.  The same behavior would happen if the user leaves without saving (show a “new screen + AI” with description).  This is effectively the same thing as canceling while AI is generating.

We’ll need to address this in updating screens also as it’s a different workflow.  I’ll make sure to note it on that ticket.

column1: Spike: prompt engineering for screen iterating with AI
column33:
We need to be able to send a description and retrieve code.  Scott has done some research on this but we’re still uncertain which model will allow us to send the description and retrieve the code response without hitting the token limit.

Notion document for research: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/GPT-Screen-Prompt-Engineering-5967f1293ed1426faca82427c848f133|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/GPT-Screen-Prompt-Engineering-5967f1293ed1426faca82427c848f133]

Here are the things we need to accomplish:

* -MVP: New screen from AI - send a description to the GPT API and retrieve the RN code in a format that can be rendered in Studio.- this should be fairly straightforward.  We can skip researching this.
* v2: Update Screen from AI - allow the user to type a command or description and update an existing screen code.  
** _The challenge here is we have to send both the user input as well as the screen’s code and then retrieve the updated code which is even more taxing for the token count._
* v3: Handle errors and attempt to retry when we are unable to render the response from AI in Studio.
column114: A notion document with the tech details on how we can accomplish v2 and v3.

column1: GPT Studio Screen from Description
column33:
An area in the CB app that could benefit greatly from AI is screen design iterations. The goal is to be able to create a screen from scratch or alter an existing screen by telling the AI what modifications should be made as provided by the user.

Notion Doc: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Studio-GPT-Screen-Design-Automation-987f254530ec478d9ed611264498f6ad|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Studio-GPT-Screen-Design-Automation-987f254530ec478d9ed611264498f6ad]

column1: Studio Selection Behaviour is sometimes inconsistent
column33:
Sometimes select different screens and elements with mouse click does not give the user the right settings or controls that is expected. 

An example is creating and linking images, after thr image is selected/focused for the first time, click elsewhere and trying to click the image again won't have allow the image to be selected/focused again.

This type of unexpected behaviour could be a root issue with the UI mode and may be happening in numerous but isolated parts of the app.

We should see how many places this happens, what the solution is, and if each solution is unique make child tickets to divide and solve it (if it cannot be quickly solved)

Requirements took from [dave comment|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9556?focusedCommentId=54722]


# The media button at the top should now be “Image”.
# Once you click off the uploaded image and click it again you do not see the drag handles or the “upload” icon. Oddly enough the handles and icon show if I add another image and then click on the first image.
# We should change the “Media Settings” to be “Image Settings”. The top dropdown panel for “Media Settings” should be part of the parent (basically that -panel- dropdown is unnecessary”.
# We need to show if the user is using an uploaded image or a url, possibly a toggle or replace the URL with the uploaded image path.
## If the user uploaded an image we should show the name of the image in the image settings, if they are using a URL then it would show in the link input.  For this first update we could just show the image name in the "Web Image Link" input box...

column1: Investigate PROD downtime - heroku logs
column33:
Investigate the reason as to why production has been experiencing a lot of downtime as of late & determine what steps we may take in order to resolve periodic increase in downtime.

column114:
- Investigate the reason as to why production has been experiencing an increase in downtime recently.

- Determine what steps we may take in order to resolve this recent increase in production downtime.
column193:
23/Mar/23 12:09 PM;60a2b6488cbda700689ac692;There’s an increase in request throughput to platform which creating the slowness.

!image-20230323-190521.png|width=1216,height=522!

!Screenshot 2023-03-24 at 12.26.09 AM-20230323-185657.png|width=1406,height=433!



Heroku dynos exceeding the memory limit constantly (R14)

!Screenshot 2023-03-24 at 12.21.56 AM-20230323-185214.png|width=1288,height=528!

We need to do the following to investigate/optimize it further.

- Upgrade [crowdbotics.com|http://crowdbotics.com] domain to PRO plan on cloudflare ( We get more insights with PRO plan)
- Install scout APM on {{crowdbotics-slack-app}}   following  this document [https://scoutapm.com/docs/python/django|https://scoutapm.com/docs/python/django|smart-link]
column194:

[~accountid:60b681f3994185007431bb28] can you add the relevant settings to enable scout APM? It’s currently installed via addon.

column195:
18/Apr/23 6:55 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;The Subscription admin is managed by {{djstripe}} package, this 503 is kind of expected given this is the cancel action:

!image-20230418-131612.png|width=685,height=258!

And the {{subscription.cancel}} function basically calls the stripe API. When in bulk, the case represented in this video, will surpass 30s and will timeout with a 503 error.

I think the max we could do is to remove this bulk action from the admin.

column193:
11/Apr/23 2:20 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] 

As i said several times, this GCP is is because of the server restart in the middle way of the terraform run. There are several reasons the heroku dyno restarts, some time it crash and restarts, sometime when config vars etc are changed, then it restarts, sometime on deploy it restarts and sometime other cases. In one of the cases, when i tested rabbitmq connection was lost and it crashed and restarted. When i looked, rabbitmq had undergone maintainance. 
If terraform is allowed to run without these restarts, it runs fine.
If we want to fix this, the terraform setup should move out of heroku, to several service.
Or there may be something we can do, when i looked into it last time i didn’t find any solution. other than moving this out of dashboard.

The retry isn’t an option, because when terraform run is interrupted midway, the state doesn’t reflect the resource created. So, we have to manually look at the state and delete some resource that aren’t in state. Then on deploy again, it works.

Anyway, this is a pretty big ticket so this shouldn’t be in the sprint.

cc: [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] [~accountid:60b681f3994185007431bb28]
column194: 11/Apr/23 6:51 AM;5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448;[~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835] Can we have it automatically requeue the job if it fails due to shutdown?
column195: 11/Apr/23 6:54 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] Yes it does retry it. But retry isn’t an issue, the issue is on the terraform side. The thing is, if it fails on the first attempt, then have to manually fix it. It does retry, or if you trigger deploy from dashboard, it won’t work, unless we look at the state file and do some manual actions.
column196: 11/Apr/23 10:32 AM;5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448;I didn’t realize that. Do you know if there’s a there a way to gracefully cancel terraform without breaking the state?
column197: 12/Apr/23 9:18 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;Not sure. May be [~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692] has idea about this? Basically, when the server restarts cancel the running terraform, so the state correctly reflects the resources.

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Error building infrastructure for Web - Production:
b'
Error: Error locking state: Error acquiring the state lock: ConditionalCheckFailedException: The conditional request failed
Lock Info:
 ID: ddfa1593-6b68-39a7-5446-1b1f47867a8c
 Path: crowdbotics-terraform/testsbapp_40030_gcp_62008
 Operation: OperationTypeApply
 Who: u3282@9b6576fe-40e7-4b8f-bd1c-7a4cb596bb0b
 Version: 0.13.6
 Created: 2023-04-19 15:***** +0000 UTC
 Info: 


Terraform acquires a state lock to protect the state from being written
by multiple users at the same time. Please resolve the issue above and try
again. For most commands, you can disable locking with the "-lock=false"
flag, but this is not recommended.


'
{panel}

!image-20230419-160929.png|width=1790,height=1130!

----

I was under the impression that this only occurred when the server reset, but it seems all GCP deployments do not work in both staging & production environments. As such, this is a highest priority and the only issue you should concern yourself with during the current sprint. If you believe that Terraform Cloud can fix the issue, then please spend some time investigating it and we can discuss during refinement on Thursday. Thank you and apologies for misunderstanding the severity of the issue.



CC [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5]  [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692]
column200:
19/Apr/23 12:04 PM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] these state lock error are the subsequent error after the first deployment fails. Basically, if the first deployment attempt of GCP fails, we need to manually fix this for GCP. 
Yes, this first deployment failure happens/used to happen in case of server restarts, but there seems to be another issue now. I tested in staging as well, and for my conclusion now, it’s taking longer time than we allocated 1300 seconds for the GCP terraform setup. I will test increasing this time, then it will probably work so, it will be less frequent issue meaning occuring only on dyno restart.

column208:
21/Apr/23 7:22 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] I saw the timeouts occuring intermittently for the cloudsql. Basically, with our version of google provider the default timeout for the Cloudsql create is 20 mins, and seems like sometimes cloudsql takes more than that. Seems like rood cause of the GCP deployment failure was this time increase in the CloudSQL. Seems like, in the latest version of google provider, they have increased that timeout to 40 mins as stated here. [https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/sql_database_instance#timeouts|https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/sql_database_instance#timeouts|smart-link] . I will try increasing this timeout to 25 mins and see if we encounter this cloudsql timeout error.

This is the error occuring intermittently. [https://prnt.sc/XyRT40SC4Gkr|https://prnt.sc/XyRT40SC4Gkr|smart-link]

column1: TECH-ENABLER: Enable Component Sharing per Organization
column33:
h1. Goals:

We want to enable other teams [Studio, MPOS] by providing an API to allow the following:

# For the query of share-able components based on the organization
# The ability to assign share-ability values to a component, [Public, Private, Share (between organization)]
# [Optional] Work with the Studio and/or MPOS team if they require other “Components” also to be share-able [Connectors, Data-Model]

h3. Out of Scope:

No UI will be developed for this feature; the workflows and UX for sharing Components [Screens, Modules, Connectors, (optionally) Data-Model+API] is the Studio’s responsibility. We are just to provide an API and the organization implementation (in the DB).

*For V1, we will add the django-organization and update the component model/endpoint for module sharing.* 

*Organization creation and user addition will be done via the admin panel for now.*

h1. Description and Specification:

# Organizational frameworks within Django will be evaluated based on the specification below and the forward-looking statement
# Once an organization framework has been selected, integrate that framework into crowdbotics-slack-app DB Models where:
## A user should be associated with an organization (based upon some criteria - teams model, org email, something)
## There MUST be a relationship between Components-to-Organization if the Component is marked “Share” to allow for filtering of possible components against an organization.
# Create an API that enables sharing within an “organization” or “globally” of Components.
# Create an API that enables the other teams to retrieve shared artifacts that are “organization-specific” or “global.”
# Create an API so that projects can be retrieved on a “per-organization” basis.

h3. Forward-Looking Statement

Eventually, a more extensive discussion should be done for other teams regarding RBAC of users and their roles and permissions for viewing and managing organization assets, including but not limited to

* Assets [Screens, Modules, Connectors, Data-Models, API]
* Users
* Projects
* etc





{color:#97a0af}Old{color}

----

{color:#97a0af}Given the decision to pause work on {color}[https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9938|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9938|smart-link]{color:#97a0af} & {color}[https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10605|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10605|smart-link]{color:#97a0af}, we must determine how we can enable creating, saving & retrieving private artifacts (modules, connectors, etc.) to/from a private catalog & subsequently facilitate the sharing of these private artifacts locally or globally.{color}

{color:#97a0af}+*From the initial research conducted, we can either:*+ {color}

# {color:#97a0af}implement {color}[https://django-organizations.readthedocs.io/en/latest/|https://django-organizations.readthedocs.io/en/latest/|smart-link]{color:#97a0af} to enable group account functionality within the current Django scaffolding, or{color}
# {color:#97a0af}add a tenant_id column to the shared schema for tenant identification (w/ or w/o row level security policies) & subsequently perform a migration to change the schema {color}[{color:#97a0af}https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Enterprise-Accts-w-o-multi-tenancy-162e37dd8116427aa1d23ecd1ca5bb80?pvs=4{color}|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Enterprise-Accts-w-o-multi-tenancy-162e37dd8116427aa1d23ecd1ca5bb80?pvs=4]

----

{color:#97a0af}we must decide the best course of action that allows us to deliver this critical functionality within the next two sprints, in order to {color}{color:#97a0af}+*release this on April 13th (BE + FE)*+{color}

column195:
23/Mar/23 6:41 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] here are my comments, we should set up a call to talk about this more:

*Overall Comments:* 

This has too much implementations details associated with it. I want to get a better understanding of the use case, the user and the UX. 

What would you like to see from a persona perspective (e.g. who will be using this)? We can approach it top-down.

*Questions To Answer:*

# Who has control to make it a private, public, shared artifact? Is there a workflow where artifacts are cloned->modified->saved, and shared as private?
# What are the UI elements to pick, which artifact to share, and with whom?
# What are the UI elements to pick the permissions of users for editing and sharing private artifacts?
# Will there be a UI to show that artifacts are public, private, or shared? This might indicate the actions that can be applied to these artifacts.
# How will users/Crowdbotics update/edit private and shared artifacts? Are we descoping an approval process?
# Do users have access to the code for private and shared artifacts? Is this only through our Platform UI? (I assume so)
# Will users ever want to use older artifacts? should we be versioning or should there just be a master artifact and no version control is needed?

These are just some initial questions…

03/Apr/23 7:28 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;*FOR QA:*

Review App:  [https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/|https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/]

Steps:

# Add Organization and then owner from [https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/admin/enterprise/organization/|https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/admin/enterprise/organization/]
# Add organization user from [https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/admin/enterprise/organizationuser/|https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/admin/enterprise/organizationuser/]
# Create a module/component from [https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/admin/projects/component/|https://cbdash-pr-4292.herokuapp.com/admin/projects/component/]
I create some of them by copying over data for some module from staging.
# In the new component, add user you added to organization as owner and make that Private.
# Login as this user,  and form api-docs send GET request {{/api/v2/apps/{app_pk}/modules/}}`, you should be able to see modules public, private which user is owner of on response
# Login with another user (may be in diff browser or incognito), and follow same process you should be able to see public or own private components
#  Now, use endpoint `{{/api/v2/apps/{app_pk}/modules/}}{id}` to send PATCH request with payload {{{"visibility": "Shared"}}}
# Now, Follow 5 and 6 step, you should be able to see Shared Modules
# Login as the Non Org user, you should not be able to see {{Shared modules on step 5}}
# On the step 5, from the visibility section of the {{Parameters}} section, you can filter the modules with {{private,public or shared}} . You should see only those modules you filter by in the API response.

column1: Inconsistent Google Analytics Tracking for Dual-State Button
column33:
Google Analytics tags are not consistently capturing the ID of a dual-state button (deploy or cancel) on our web application. The issue appears to occur primarily when the button is in the 'deploy' state, and occasionally when it's in the 'cancel' state. This prevents us from accurately tracking user interactions with the button, which is crucial for analyzing user behavior and improving the user experience.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Go to the web page containing the dual-state button.
# Interact with the button by toggling its states (deploy and cancel).
# Monitor the Google Analytics console to observe the captured events and associated button ID.
# Notice the inconsistency in capturing the button ID when the state is set to 'deploy' or 'cancel.'

*Expected Results:*

Google Analytics should consistently capture the button ID for both 'deploy' and 'cancel' states, allowing us to track user interactions with the button accurately.

*Actual Results:*

Google Analytics tags fail to capture the button ID consistently when it's in the 'deploy' state and sometimes when it's in the 'cancel' state.

Acceptance Criteria:

# Google Analytics tags consistently capture the button ID for both 'deploy' and 'cancel' states.
# The reported events in Google Analytics accurately represent user interactions with the dual-state button.
