column1: Combine zip & .ipa build files in Deployment History
column33:
Whenever an iOS deployment is successful, two entries are created in the Manage Deployments table in order to Download either the zip or .ipa build files, respectively.

!Screenshot 2023-03-22 at 1.48.02 PM.png|width=1280,height=972!

This duplicate entry can be confusing for users and muddles the deployment history. As such, we should combine the zip & .ipa build file into one Download option
column114: * Combine the zip & .ipa build files into one Download option in order to remove the duplicate entries in the Deployment History table

column1: QA Redesign + Automation
column33:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Figma designs: [https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-4209&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=45-4209&t=oseUejvDPU3Ukvln-0|smart-link] 
{panel}

# Have QA report from *Task status* (not “report QA” button) (see screenshot)
## Dropdown-- just create a big space before the next row (for visibility).
## Permissions: Only QA will have this visibility for reporting QA. 
# Implement improved QA modal (Frame 1 in Master Design file)
## Implement flow for when QA is approved (new UI design)
### Then, task automatically moves to *needs approval* (we’re doing this already)
## Implement flow for when QA fails (new UI design, _Frame 2_ in Master Design file)
### BE: automatically re-assign FE, BE, or both developers, as indicated by QA
### BE: Task then moves back to _In Progress_ with the appropriate developers assigned to subtasks as selected by QA
# BE: Automatically send Slack notifications based on QA event (especially in the case where QA is _unsure_ who to re-assign for when QA fails). (Should this be a separate ticket?)
## Send a slack confirmation after *every* QA event



!Screen Shot 2023-03-28 at 9.06.07 AM.png|width=1084,height=391!

Note: align on permissions for QA, discuss offline
column114:
# Have QA report from *Task* status (not “report QA” button)
## Dropdown-- just create a big space before the next row (for visibility).
## Permissions: Only QA will have this visibility for reporting QA. 
# Implement improved QA modal (Frame 1 in Master Design file)
## Implement flow for when QA is approved (new UI design)
### Then, task automatically moves to *needs approval* (we’re doing this already)
## Implement flow for when QA fails (new UI design, _Frame 2_ in Master Design file)
### BE: manually re-assign FE, BE, or both developers, as indicated by QA
### BE: Task then moves back to _In Progress_ with the appropriate developers assigned to subtasks as selected by QA
# The UI for this flow will all be created using bootstrap, i.e. our current components. We do not want to deviate from our current style.

column1: Create + implement improved design specs
column33:
[~accountid:64148ced7222b08f3e718e34] just creating another ticket here for the QA we discussed. 

We _may_ want to consider adjusting the entire design for *Task Descriptions*, which is where this feature lives. Currently, we are showing a) Task Description and b) Acceptance Criteria. 

We will want to also show a) QA history (that *everybody* can see), and b) Perform QA modal (only available to QA people).. i.e. “perform QA —> opens modal where they select pass/fail, reason for rejection (if applicable), and selecting FE/BE for re-assignment)

*In Sum:*

# Show QA History (keep in mind, we may want to combine this with “customer approval history”)
# Build QA Modal (including comment box for rejection notes, if applicable, and option to select either FE, BE, or both)
# Optional: if it makes things easier, I would say feel free to reconsider the design for “Task Descriptions” in general, i.e. the layout that currently houses “description”, “acceptance criteria”, and soon to be QA info. cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] 





Reference image:

!Screen Shot 2023-03-21 at 10.49.32 PM.png|width=1209,height=257!

column1: Combine .aab & .apk build files in Deployment History
column33:

This duplicate entry can be confusing for users and muddles the deployment history. As such, we should combine the .apk & .aab build file into one Download option

column1: Spike: research search functions w/in ChatGPT API
column33:
# We are interested in a “search function”: in the next sprint, we want to ask the chat API to scan our catalog of modules and pre-built code, so that we can include that into the PRD whenever possible.
# The ideal feature will function in the following way:
## the user will ask our AI GPT tool to generate feature requirements
## On the BE, the chat API will scan our module library, identifying any pre-existing code we can use to fulfill user’s product requirements
## On the FE, our AI PRD tool will generate a PRD that includes as many of our pre-build modules as possible, which will help us boost code coverage and time to delivery.


cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7], this is the ticket intended to serve as the first step for connecting chat API w/ our catalog library/modules
column114: Research our ability to use the ChatGPT API to “search” our library of pre-built code modules, so that we can populate the PRDs with this whenever possible.

column1: Populate PRD tab as final step
column33:
When the user is ready to finalize their PRD, they will select the button “Approve PRD” (see mock up for reference). 

When the user selects “Approve PRD”, we will populate the PRD tab of the Task page with the appropriate format of features: 

# Feature Name
# Feature Description
# Acceptance Criteria.
column114:
When the user selects “Approve PRD”, we will populate the PRD tab of the Task page with the appropriate format of features: 

# Feature Name
# Feature Description
# Acceptance Criteria.

(i.e. the PRD will be formatted the same way it currently is).

column1: Create & Implement design specs
column33:
Please have a look at the screens in this Figma page for final designs:

[https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=13%3A1391&t=kxM4tvSKWF5aDGP8-1|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=13%3A1391&t=kxM4tvSKWF5aDGP8-1|smart-embed]

The designs include: 

*First time user experience*

* To begin, user is asked to enter the name of the app.
* On the second step, user is asked to describe their app in a couple sentences. 
* Then we show that the PRD is being generated. 
* Once it’s generated the buttons on the screen become clickable, and the user has the option to modify the PRD or create it.

*Returning user experience*

* when the user is in the PRD page, at the bottom of the features list, they see the options for creating a new feature with AI, from template, or from scratch. 

----

If you do not have access to figma, please [click on this link to join the team|https://www.figma.com/team_invite/redeem/UWLTnG8Kngxsk76A8ZXODf] with you @crowdbotics email.

column1: Architect Prompts + Generate PRD
column33:
This is the architecture of how we will guide users to enter prompts to generate PRDs, including hidden prompts we send on the BE to help guide this process. Here is the end-end flow for generating a PRD with prompts:

# Establish default settings:
## Keep a [temperature setting|https://platform.openai.com/docs/quickstart] of “0” (i.e. the setting that controls risk/randomness with GPT).
## Set the identity with these default prompts (back end):
### “You are helping me create the product requirements for an MVP of my app. I will provide features I want, and you will help me generate concise descriptions and acceptance criteria. Please keep the product requirements simple.”
### “First, I will tell you the name of my app and a brief description. Then, I will tell you the features I want. Please format the features as following: 1) Feature name 2) Brief feature description 3) Acceptance criteria.”
# User selects AI tool from list of options to generate a *new PRD* (page 1 in Figma Master)
## Note: the scope of this feature is currently focused on *creating new PRDs from scratch*. We will also have a flow to use the AI tool to add features to an existing PRD.
## The name of my app is Doggy Rides *[example name]*
# First prompt: User enters the name of their app (page 2 in Figma Master)
# Second prompt: user enters brief description (page 3 in Figma Master)
#* This is a ride-share app that will connect riders with dogs that can sit with them in the car while they go places. *[example description]*
# Third prompt: User enters feature list they want (page 3 in Figma master)
## Users enter features, and they appear as a list as seen in Figma doc
## Features can be removed by clicking trash can icon
## After user enters their feature list for this prompt, user clicks “Generate PRD” and moves to the next page
# When user selects “Generate PRD”, we should send the following prompt to the GPT AI:
## “The name of my app is [app name]. Here is a description of [app name]: [app description]. Here are the features I would like to include: [feature list]. Please generate a product requirements document with these features, formatted as follows: 1) Feature Name 2) Brief Feature Description 3) Acceptance Criteria. 
# As PRD is loading, incorporate the loading gif (page 4) in Figma
# Refinement step: PRD is populated, and user can adjust by communicating with AI through modify screen (page 5)
# When user selects “Create PRD”, generate PRD within PRD tab (as we always do-- same format: feature name, brief description, and acceptance criteria). 
# In addition to the text description that the user sees, we will want to also save the results as *JSON* (on the BE, I assume?) to help with converting this PRD into Studio screens, etc. 

----

*Design Specs:* 

Please have a look at the screens in this Figma page for final designs:

[https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=13%3A1391&t=kxM4tvSKWF5aDGP8-1|https://www.figma.com/file/ojLbgv8xRj1tlrUvpRlhKZ/Master-Design-File?node-id=13%3A1391&t=kxM4tvSKWF5aDGP8-1|smart-embed]

----

If you do not have access to figma, please [click on this link to join the team|https://www.figma.com/team_invite/redeem/UWLTnG8Kngxsk76A8ZXODf] with you @crowdbotics email.

column1: PRD AI
column33: The Chat GPT-powered “PRD Assist” is an AI tool intended to automate the process of generating client PRDs. This feature will function conversationally, mirroring the functionality of Chat-GPT, and can serve as a replacement or supplement to BAs who manually socialize with clients to extract and refine their PRDs.

column1: Remove/hide "Submit Bug" button before Thursday's Release
column33:
The bug feature we’ve worked on is a bit problematic-- we might scrap it (and just use QA feature to handle issues), or alter it. 

While we figure this out, we want to hide the submit bug button so that this feature is *completely disabled*.

We don’t want to go live with this feature at all until we have complete alignment.

cc: [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]
column114: Hide “submit bug” button from all users. No user will interact with “submit bug” feature in any way, until we choose to go back and make this live.

column33:

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Per Charath → GPT adds capabilities for which we don't have interfaces in Studio:

# Workflows.
# Automated connectors.
# Automated test cases.
{panel}

[https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1PJw-4bd0Q_F9AZ49QsJjGVuoi0jfHsSLJCK5ZI9n8Sc/edit?usp=sharing|https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1PJw-4bd0Q_F9AZ49QsJjGVuoi0jfHsSLJCK5ZI9n8Sc/edit?usp=sharing|smart-link]
column114:
h2. Part 1

h3. Plumbing

* In order to assist with the proposed GPT integration with Studio & PRD, it is essential that our team creates the “plumbing” by which data is copied between different parts of our platform (Studio ↔︎ PRD)  

h2. Part 2

h3. Additional use cases

* Conduct a deep-dive into the capabilities & limitations of GPT4 
* Based on this in-depth technical analysis, are there any other use cases we should consider adding to the GPT integration roadmap, specifically in terms of DevOps & Deployments?

column1: Degradation of bulk update service
column33:
Bulk updates filter doesn’t filter tasks correctly.

Bulk updates filter does not capture correct assignee status 

Example in the screenshot. When I use the QA filter below if shows all the subtasks under one task name and this is repetitive for all the other filter options such as FE dev, PM

This happens for all projects!!

----

Additional issues:

* Project where modal breaks when two filters are assigned at the same time (job type and assignee)
[https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/37017/tasks?tab=in-progress|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/37017/tasks?tab=in-progress]

21/Mar/23 7:43 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] This issue has been fixed in [This Ticket|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10258]

The reason why we see this error is that the current implementation always assumes that we have tasks returned on milestones. However, given the new API implementation, when you select to view milestones, the are no tasks returned but rather milestones. hence, once we merge the PR, it should fix this issue

column1: SPIKE: Security vulnerability scanning
column33:
Enterprise prospect requested code scanning before push commits:

{quote}“Thing that I may want to ask if you also covered. It's the security of the code. So currently we do that fairly halfway manual, halfway automated. So we run scans using their works scans and the check-in time, right? But I like to move that a little bit earlier than that so when they, when the developers are writing code, they will catch that before they even submit it. So it's a kind of a procedural kind of enhancement that I like to have.”{quote}

→ code scans via pre- or post-commit hook

----

What static/dynamic analysis or penetration testing tools should we consider using in order to address this?
column114:
* Determine which code scanning tools we can leverage in order to automate security vulnerability / pen testing before & after a PR is submitted to a customers' project repo
* How would we integrate these automated tools/services into the Delivery team’s current workflow?

column1: PLAT-10349 Screen get crashed while dropping Additional Component
Tenant-aware Webhook URLs
column33: In certain cases, e.g. Stripe webhook setup, the URL sent to Stripe is taken from {{ALLOWED_HOSTS[0]}}. This would not work as now we have multiple domains within the same instance. We need to come up with an approach to refactor this to use the correct domain dynamically for the specified tenant and domain. Stripe was the only usecase I found but I reckon there are other instances of this.

column1: create a formalized approach to monitoring updates to fastlane/App Store Connect
SPIKE: Investigate what already exists & compare against proposed requirements
column33:
Acceptance Criteria:

* Document if an env var can launch a complete backend
* What facilities are in place for CI/CD for deploying BE with a specific git hash / branch name
column193: 17/Mar/23 8:37 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] This is not clear to me.
column194:
21/Mar/23 7:11 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;*What we already have:-*

*Backend API:*

* When a PR is raised against the backend [here|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app], the PR triggers a review app on Heroku. This is not implemented by using GH actions but it’s a setting within the Heroku platform that takes care of that.
* Once the PR is merged or is dormant - No commit is pushed to the branch with that PR - for more than 5 days, the backend review app is torn down. Either a manual creation of another review is done, or opening a new PR.

*Frontend Vue-Dash:*

* No review app is created on Heroku when a PR is raised. This is because VUE-dash isn’t deployed on Heroku
* Vue-dash has review apps setup with Github actions ( Yet to be fixed )

*Comparison and thoughts*.

> The PR can also have an optional field with the description, the Github actions will be able to detect the key-value pair specifying a different backend to deploy. 

Does this mean editing the backend branch name in conjunction with front-end code changes? What happens when a backend branch is merged and deleted? How is this handled, since the frontend will have to branch to deploy?

Also, can QA keep up with the number of backed {{branch-names}} to change while they deploy and test?

When we talk about using {{master}} branch for backend review apps, why can't developers use the master backend URL that we already have? And that is set in environment variables to test their features?

Another thought would be, {{docker-compose}} was set up to help with this kind of standardization. Isn’t it not being used?

With regards to {{CB_BACKEND=<branch name>}}what would be the criteria for choosing the {{branch-name}}to deploy, should we have a standard way of naming {{branch-names }} if they are related i.e Frontend and backend tickets?
cc: [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5]
column195:
21/Mar/23 2:30 PM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:60b6618066df7900704e3a3d] answers to your questions below:

Just an overview, I believe that [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] has said that this functionality already exists within the CI/CD pipeline, can you see if we can already setup an env variable and see that things are deployed with a specific backend? or is it just deploying a staging backend with the FE PR code changes?

To answer your question directly.
_>> Does this mean editing the backend branch name in conjunction with front-end code changes?_
well, the PR within the description will contain a branch name or commit hash which will get picked up by the deployed backend.

_>> What happens when a backend branch is merged and deleted?_
Great question; because branches are ephemeral, we can also leverage the git hash, long or short version. This will never go away. There should be a cleanup process that discards the deployment after a certain time period (just like the BE CI/CD)

_>> How is this handled, since the frontend will have to branch to deploy?_
The deployment has to pick up the branch as this is what is in review. It should work exactly like the backend code when it gets deployed. In that, it deploys the frontend branch

_>> Also, can QA keep up with the number of backed branch-names to change while they deploy and test?_
I think this feature isn't for QA. Ideally, QA should be testing off of staging unless they want to ad-hoc test against a review app.
There are two use cases:

# If a frontend engineer is working with a backend engineer and they need to coordinate the two code changes across the FE and BE repos before the code goes into master.
# Charath/SLT want to demo something that is 'still in development' and they want to mix and match an experimental branch between FE and BE

_>> When we talk about using master branch for backend review apps, why can't developers use the master backend URL that we already have?_
Yes, I think that's what they are doing now, sometimes as mentioned previously, FE code changes want to be tested against a specific BE which isn't in master. I think there are frequent occurrences when FE needs to work with BE

Another thought would be, docker-compose was set up to help with this kind of standardization. Isn’t it not being used?
It can be, but docker-compose setup is a dev task and not a post-PR task.  I think the FE just wants feature parity with the BE code.

>> With regards to CB_BACKEND=<branch name>what would be the criteria for choosing the branch-nameto deploy, should we have a standard way of naming branch-names  if they are related i.e Frontend and backend tickets?
I don't think that's necessary as long as it's recognized by the CI/CD pipeline. A unified branch naming convention would be cleaner but I’m not sure if it’s a blocker to getting it working

column1: Consolidate the usage of ValidatedFormControl across Studio
column33:
Replace the following input elements with the validated input, adding the appropriate validation for them when required:

* *Screen Name* field under “*Screen properties/Details*“
!image-20230316-152539.png|width=295,height=114!
** *UI update:* Remove the “/“ at the beginning of the form
** *Validation*: name must be unique across the app; the name must not be empty; the name must contain only spaces, letters, and numbers
** *Note*: Remove the “popup” for the current validation as well
* *Name* for “Parameters“ in “*Screen Route Parameters*“
** !image-20230316-153410.png|width=284,height=90!
** *Validation*: value must not be empty; must match regex {{"^[_a-zA-Z]\\w*$"}}`
* *All Module Options fields*
* !image-20230316-153529.png|width=281,height=213!
** *UI update*: Fields must look like the {{ValidatedFormControl}} ; labels must look like other labels across studio (better spacing between inputs) and labels must be capitalized
** *Validation*: Must conform to whatever the validation is for module options today (they are dynamic)
column114: Mentioned inputs will be validated as described

column193: 21/Mar/23 10:56 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] fill in missing details
column194:
22/Mar/23 10:36 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] This ticket is for investigating the usage of Appstore Connect API Key for the ios deployments.

For 2FA we already have done the spike, and it doesn’t sound feasible/more complex.
column195:
23/Mar/23 9:27 AM;63ecf71dd08a73e538f4305c;Both App Store Connect API Key and Fastlane Session perform similar functionalities in regard to managing Ios Apps on App Store. However, there’s one distinct difference. Fastlane Session allows us to use the {{produce}} method which creates a new app on App Store Connect. This functionality is not available using App Store Connect API. Here’s a summary of the comparison

!image-20230323-162711.png|width=663,height=585!

[Investigation Doc|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Spike-Report-Apple-2FA-token-refresh-automation-8451dd351954402a9a4b880dcf9bc1e0]

App store Connect API endpoints [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appstoreconnectapi/app_store/apps|https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appstoreconnectapi/app_store/apps|smart-link]

column1: Private modules/catalog workflow
column33:
Create end-to-end user journeys for all relevant personas/internal & external stakeholders identified in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10601|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10601|smart-link] as it relates to the creation/sharing & settings/permissions of public vs private Modules + Catalog 

----

h3. Definitions

* *Master Module Template:* core module code hosted somewhere that all newly created projects will inherit
* *Project Module:* copied source from Master Module Template into a delivery project

----

h3. Assumptions[???]

*Developer would like to.:*

# modify the master module template with his/her dev tools
# submit for approval changes to master module template
# see approval process for master module template changes (optional?)
# see change history of master module template
# discover/(search for) different master module templates
# extract code which he/her wrote into a master module template

*Delivery team would like to.:*

# use different versions of master module template

*Admin would like to.:*

# share Master Module Template with other teams within his/her organisation
# restrict master module templates visibility to different team
# restrict master module template code from public
# make master module template public to organisation but private to public (edited)

----

h3. Topics

# Module template creation & sharing
## How is this done for public modules & what must change for private modules?
# Module testing & debugging
# Prefab catalog
## Master template in DB vs module-library repo
### Does master template code need to be accessible outside the platform?

column1: Investigate performance improvements based on API calls
column33: Based on the findings from [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10543|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10543|smart-link], we must now investigate what can be done to improve dashboard performance based on the frequency of API requests
column114:
* Identify what performance improvements can be realized, given the frequency of API calls outlined in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10543|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10543|smart-link] 
* Determine how we will optimize specific API endpoints in order to alleviate the slowdown from the frequency of these requests

column114: Determine if we should switch to client-side rendering

column1: Server-side generation/rendering
Minor style consistency between studio and Dashboard
column33:
* All text color must be the same everywhere, including the collapse panel headers, except when warranted (e.g. links, icons, etc)
** Color must be {{$textColor}} ( {{#2c3e50}})
* info icons for tooltips should all be *fas* circle-info (*solid* version, not regular or other types)
* double-check that font-family is {{Roboto,Franklin Gothic Medium,Tahoma,sans-serif}}`
* All clickable buttons must have the cursor pointer on hover (e.g. the pre-fab dropdown menu, additional components dropdown menu, save button, buttons in Component Tree, all buttons everywhere)
** Bonus: Make sure to mark these components with{{ role=button}})
* All draggable buttons must have a [grab cursor on hover |https://stackoverflow.com/a/18294634](e.g. Shape, Text, Media, all additional components, Screen, Screen Row, and Screen Column)

column1: Successfully Deploy Multi-Tenancy to a Mock Staging instance - Phase 2
column33:
*Copied from Phase 1*

h2. Goal
The goal of the ticket is to set up a mock staging instance within Heroku and successfully deploy multi-tenancy
* Start time and end time should be recorded once the sequence of events has been formalized from maintenance mode: on *to* off
* A runbook should be published on the sequence of steps to deploy
h2. Scope
The goal does *NOT* include the following:
* A runbook to roll back changes
* validation of the application and/or test plan
h2. Description and Plan Implementation [WIP]
Steps/Plan is documented here: [Notion Doc|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/django-tenants-infrastructure-and-migration-plan-92809105092b40dfbb02a14b9c1612d8?pvs=4]
h2. Acceptance Criteria:
* A runbook should be published on the sequence of steps to deploy
* Stretch: an automation script can be created if we automate the steps once we can manually do them

Tech-enablers for multi-tenancy feature parity

Tech-enablers for determining private and public apps within and across tenants

column1: SPIKE: scan, identify, automatic module(s) import
column33:
+*PWC demo feedback:*+

{quote}They asked about how they can scan a codebase and identify and import a set of modules automatically (!) This is a killer feature, if anyone has ideas on how you'd achieve it. They seemed to suggest this is a relatively common state of affairs when PWC enters an enterprise organization, but I can see it being useful to accelerate our module workshops.{quote}

----

_→_ It seems like a viable PLG hook within MM/ENT. We’d probably be able to get away with crawling a codebase and then displaying its structure (even as a file tree) with some basic insights and recommendations.

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Do most frameworks provide a command that scaffolds a standard dev environment and build pipeline with predictable file hierarchies and file names, a la {{create-react-native-app}}?
{panel}

→ Both React & Express frameworks have this sort of default config option.

As a very basic initial motion, I think it would be conceptually simple to create a tool that crawls a codebase, references these default framework configs, and surfaces “non-differentiated” and “differentiated” files based on file names or locations in the file tree.

*Non-differentiated* code would be standard, minimally customized files, most often produced from a default scaffold command. One example of non-differentiated code might be the build pipeline that gets produced when you run {{create-react-native-app}}  — you’d pluck those filenames out and bucket them as non-differentiating.

To start, *differentiated* code would be any set of files that don’t fit known default file structures or naming conventions.

You could also check inside the non-differentiated files themselves (such as inside a {{package.json}} file) and call out likely dependencies at the point of module creation — “looks like you’ll need these dependencies for this module to function properly — would you like to add them to this module?”

This seems like a decent starting point for a dev, since they can start creating modules by cloning files out of either group. It helps us greatly because it inculcates a CodeOps mindset from the start: “what are the highest-leverage items to reuse from this app? what are we customizing that we don’t need to customize?”

As with anything, it’s also likely that some GPT-style tool could look at these files and make initial suggestions to the user about what is clone-able and what isn’t.
column114:
h2. Part 1

h3. Recreate an existing app by scanning its repo & importing relevant modules from our catalog into a new project repo

* How can we leverage the repo scanning capability we use to calculate the Code Reuse metric in order to automatically detect differentiated vs non-differentiated code and import modules into a new project based on an existing app codebase / repo?
* Create a PoC that showcases the ability to scan any given project repo and extract the modules we can leverage from our catalog in order to effectively rebuild the app.
** Ex. take a Microsoft Power Apps project repo, scan it & determine which modules we can use to start rebuilding the app in Studio and which modules we must modify in order to completely rebuild the app in Crowdbotics

h2. Part 2

h3. Use the project repo from Part 1 to create new modules from the portion of the app code that does not match any existing modules in our catalog

* Provide an implementation plan to connect a completed project’s repo and start modularizing desired chunks of it one by one.
** Do we have an existing flow for navigating to a given file in an attached repo and cloning it into a module (which then auto-populates into the module catalog)?
** Conceptually, it’s just copy-paste existing code from their repo into our module catalog, but it conveys the idea of rapid reuse to the enterprise customer.

column1: Change text: "Pay by Invoice"

column1: Allow moving of flexbox elements.
column33:
Non-absolute positioned elements should allow drag and drop which floats other elements.  Similar to how storyboard works.

In this example I’m moving a button to appear before the text by dragging the button above it, this pushes the text input down to make room for the button:

!image-20230313-195407.png|width=830,height=223!



This is the designer side for the ticket [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-8086|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-8086|smart-link]
column193:
15/Mar/23 9:49 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;Can we perhaps have an editing mode for screens in order to enable this feature? One main issue is that there is interference between dragging a screen (to reposition in canvas) and dragging a screen to rearrange elements. 

We need clear visual way to distinguish both behaviors so we can lock the screen position when we are rearranging elements.
column194: 17/Mar/23 8:51 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;I agree, I think we’ll need to move towards a focused edit mode instead of editing directly in the canvas.  This is something we’ll need to scope out and design for soon.  I think the focused edit would be helpful for integrating AI as well for fast screen edit iterations. cc: [~accountid:64148ced7222b08f3e718e34]
column195:
17/Mar/23 10:47 AM;64148ced7222b08f3e718e34;I think it’s a great idea to have a distinct object users can use to drag screens.
For having an edit mode, I think we might want to be a bit careful. some considerations for adding any mode to the design:

* how do users get in and out of the mode
* is there a save functionality?
* does clicking out of the mode dismiss the mode?
* should the rest of the ui be blocked when in this mode?
* does the rest of the ui change when in this mode?

Answering these will help decide if having a mode is justified. 

alternatively we could explore adding drag and drop to the tree-view as a mode of re-arranging the items on the screen. i think it might be easier to block certain areas that an item can be dropped into in the tree view than directly on canvas. 

----

side note: you can look at this resource I made a while ago that shows some design best practices for drag and drop interactions:
[https://www.figma.com/community/file/1147359808629888681/The-Perfect-Drag-%26-Drop|https://www.figma.com/community/file/1147359808629888681/The-Perfect-Drag-%26-Drop|smart-link] 
make sure you click on the dropdown in the bottom left corner of the screen and choose *page: designs*

column1: BE: PRD not populating tasks in proposal correctly
column33:
Slack thread for reference: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1678202293347449|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1678202293347449|smart-link] 

On this thread some issues are identified:

* Sometimes approving a PRD Item creates a task for a Milestone already In Development.
* Sometimes the approved items are not created on the Proposal tab.



Those issues happen when a PRD is approved, then the milestones move to In Development, and then the PRD is updated and approved again.

*Expected behavior:*

The way it should work is that a new milestone is created with the new tasks (only the new tasks and not the tasks that are already in development) in the proposal tab when the PRD new version is approved, even if the original milestone is already past checkout

column1: Missing Actual Delivery Date w/ completed milestones
column33:
There are at least four projects in our data studio that are missing *actual delivery date* value, despite all milestones being in the *delivered* status. 

I believe the *actual delivery date* should be calculated when milestone moves to *delivered* status.

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
This issue may be because these projects were not backdated after the change in terms of how we collect data, and that all *actual delivery dates* are now calculated correctly. We want to double check regardless. 
{panel}

Here are 4 milestone id's that fit the mold: 45804, 45807, 45815, 45802

Please look at screenshot for example of missing data:

!image-20230310-231647.png|width=713,height=46!

*Note:* this was done for Tasks, but not Milestones ([~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] worked on this for Tasks)

column1: SPIKE: modular & custom scaffolding
column33:
Based on initial findings from [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10216|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10216|smart-link] & [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10323|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10323|smart-link] → our Scaffolding is consistently being customized, with most large changes being done within the Dockerfile, package.json, pipfile that's related to the scaffolding code.

If approximately half of our Scaffolding code is consistently changed by our Service team developers to meet the various requirements of customer projects, then we must revisit our definition/classification of ‘Scaffolding’ as it relates to the calculation used to derive Bot Coverage.

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Differentiate our current Scaffolding between Functional (base) & Configuration (dynamic)
{panel}

----

 [*Notion Spike Report*|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/SPIKE-custom-scaffolding-91db35cb8aab469ba63a4338efb8f56a?pvs=4]

----

_Optional_ → understand how we will modularize our Scaffolding to achieve “pluggability” of components and give users the ability to easily design a generator in order to create a template for a particular type of project.

*Template Engine*

# Choose a compatible template engine
# Define a set of templates that can be customized to generate the desired project structure, such as for views, models, forms, and other components.
# Create a config file that allows users to specify the parameters for each template (i.e. project name, database type, etc.)
# Render the templates based on the user's input to generate the custom app template structure.

*Config Options*

# Create a config file with default project settings (i.e. database settings, installed apps, middleware, etc.)
# Use a CL tool like Click or Argparse to create interactive command-line prompts that gather input from users.
# Merge the user's input with the default settings and use them to generate the project structure.

*Customizable Generator*

# Use Cookiecutter to create a custom generator with a rich set of features & functionality.
# Define a set of templates, options & all other customizable features.
# Use Cookiecutter's built-in functionality to generate the project structure based on the user's input.

*Modular Architecture*

# Project structure & design based on modular architecture that allows users to select components
# Provide a set of pre-built modules for common functionality (i.e. AuthN, hosting, UI, etc.)
# Use a CL-tool to allow users to select the private modules from private catalog.
# Use Django's built-in functionality to generate the app structure based on the user's input.
column114:
# Divide the current scaffolding into individual base components
# Identify which components/files of our current scaffolding are modified most frequently and the reason for it.
# Evaluate different approaches we should consider when revising our current definition/classification of what constitutes ‘Scaffolding’ → should we split our ‘Scaffolding’ into smaller components based on which parts are edited the most?
# Propose which of these approaches we should use to reduce the frequency of manual changes to our base scaffolding and increase the veracity of bot coverage as it relates to ‘Scaffolding’

column1: show native django or react web views from routes
column33: From Anand:   It'd be nice to be able to index and show native Django or React web views here, from those routes, instead of just RN views. That would let us inexpensively show the fuller set of products we support here, even if we don't intend to let people edit them.I don't know enough about how Canvas enumerates RN routes, but you could certainly capture all the Django webapp routes and show them alongside your RN routes.

16/Mar/23 9:18 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] This happens when multiple circle deployment are triggered simulaneously, or in a very short interval. Basically, we update platform_id var in circle with each circle deployment.
*Scenario for this case:*

# Android deployment triggered
# After short time IOS deployment triggered
# Case: Before android build run on circle, the platform_id of android in circle is updated by the platform_id os ios platform. So, when android build runs this gets the platform_id of the ios platform.
# Android builds succeded, so it sends the the webhook with the platform_id of ios platform. So, the builds of android are regarded as the IOS builds. And IOS deployment is regarded as success.
# IOS build failed, so the IOS deployment is shown as failed. SO, the change {{first success and then failed status}}
# Android is running infinitely, since the build was triggered, but it never received webhook with the platform id of android platform.

*Fix:*

# For the circle deployment, when there is a build running in circle, add a delay until the former build is actually started, then update those var and trigger new build.

column1: Model Builder - "kpi_dashboard_dm" is considered a python reserved name
column33:
Some app names are passing our “reserved names” validation feature but will still fail in the django command. We need to extend our validation to guard against this and surface the validation error to the user so that the user knows what to do (to change his app name to something else).

Error:

{quote}'kpi_dashboar_dm' conflicts with the name of an existing Python module and cannot be used as an app name. Please try another name.\n{quote}

Error Log:
[https://us-east-2.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-2#logsV2:log-groups/log-group/$252Faws$252Flambda$252Fmodelbuilder-lambda/log-events/2023$252F03$252F08$252F$255B$2524LATEST$255D60ebfe911f5d4e1d95b09d65ff9a4f66|https://us-east-2.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-2#logsV2:log-groups/log-group/$252Faws$252Flambda$252Fmodelbuilder-lambda/log-events/2023$252F03$252F08$252F$255B$2524LATEST$255D60ebfe911f5d4e1d95b09d65ff9a4f66]

column193:
09/Mar/23 12:20 PM;618e6f963ae5230069229010;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] Can we fix this issue, due to this our many test cases are failing.

cc [~accountid:5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1]
column194:
09/Mar/23 1:13 PM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;[~accountid:618e6f963ae5230069229010] This is not a bug, it was a fix introduced as part of the previous automation bugs you were having: [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10464|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10464|smart-link] 

What happens now is that the app waits until it finishes generating before it attempts to create a new screen.

*We can’t create a new screen until the app GitHub is available. And GitHub is only available when the app finishes generating.*  So it’s not an infinite load, but a load time that takes as long as app generation does.

Additionally, in your video, it seems like automation was stuck in a popup, which was introduced in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10515|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10515|smart-link] as a new feature (vide Dave’s comment in the same ticket). So your automation tests might need to click on this popup to then move away from Studio.



If you have any suggestions for improvements to help your tests, they are welcome, but this is the current behavior of Studio and not really a bug

column1: Creating screens in a new app is not allowed (prod)
column33:
Create a new app in production, create a screen, upload a preview image, try saving.

# Go to Studio, using an account *that is not superuser*
# Add some screens
# Save
# Notice an error 405

*Expected result*: no error 405 should be visible. User should be able to save a screen for their own app



The issue is that the newest endpoints for creating and updating screens do not have permission mapping. All of those actions must be mapped to a specific screen permission. A list of the actions and the permission they must be mapped to:

* {{create_screens}}: add_screen
* {{remove_screens}}: delete_screen
* {{uninstall_screen}}: delete_screen
* {{update_screens}}: change_screen

column1: BE: Add Overview section to PRD PDF
column33:
We want to add the Overview section to the PDF version of the PRD, to help sales/BAs/CSMs better interface with clients and agencies handling projects. Basically, the current PDF version is hard to understand, and can use a little context that explains what any app is all about. That’s what this ticket will solve. 

# To find the PRD PDF: Overview section on Task page → “View PRD History” → Click on any version
# We want to auto-populate the content of “Goals and Objectives” at the top of the PRD PDF
# That’s it. It’s up to the ops/sales team to make sure the “Goals and Objectives” section is populated

column1: Automatically send Slack message
column33:
The last step of the manual approval flow-- we need to automatically send a Slack message to a CSM group, notifying CSMs to approve the manual Task approval. 

After the 48 hour window of *Task Needs Approval* event:

# Send slack message to #cb-core-milestone-approval
# Include in the message: 
## Text: “Client Task Approval Overdue”
## App ID
## Name of Project
## Link to Project dashboard



Comments: we already have Slack API set up, just need to focus on implementation.
column114:
After the 48 hour window of *Task Needs Approval* event:

# Send slack message to #cb-core-milestone-approval
# Include in the message: 
## Text: “Client Task Approval Overdue”
## App ID
## Name of Project
## Link to Project dashboard

column1: Automatically create Jira ticket in support group
column33:
After the 48 hour window of *Task Needs Approval* event, we want to automatically create a Jira ticket in the support channel. 

# For now, this ticket can be titled: “Task needs manual approval: *App ID*”
## In the description, we will include:
### The name of the project
### The app ID (even though it’s also in the title)
### Link to project dashboard



That’s it.

If the models don’t load at all, it just means that the models are not yet available. And for them to be available, the model builder needs to finish running AND parsing the API specification.

*Did you test this ticket with connectors,* as described in the description, rather than models? Connectors are added instantly, and hence you can test this ticket reliability.

The model builder issue is a backend issue that Juan is actively investigating, but unrelated to this ticket here.

column1: Customer Approval Flow
column33:
This is an automation flow designed to implement the latest Delivery Team operations for *_tasks that need client approval_*. Basically, it works like this:

* When client is notified to approve Tasks, they have 48 hours to do so
* After 48 hours, we can manually approve Tasks ourselves. This is where the flow comes in. 



Basically, all we have to do is:

# cc: CSM on every Task Approval notification email
# Automatically create Jira ticket for support after 48 hour window
# Automatically send Slack message in CSM channel after 48 hour window

column1: Provide QA History
column33:
It’s important that we track the history of QA events within any project. We will do this using a “QA History” log, which functions very similarly to “PRD history”. 

*Implementation:*

# We will have a *QA History* link in the description section of every Task. 
# This will function the same way that *PRD History* does —> it will open a modal, where the design will be implemented in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10748|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10748|smart-link] 
# To confirm, the QA History will record the following events:
## The date of a QA Event 
## The email address of the QA person who performed QA
## The status of QA Event (i.e. pass or fail)



!PRD History Link.png|width=249,height=202!

!PRD History.png|width=668,height=298!
column114:
# We will have a *QA History* link in the description section of every Task.
# Clicking the link will open a modal that will list the log of the task
## The design of the modal will be implemented in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10748|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10748|smart-link] 
# Permissions: everybody on project can view QA history.



-This will function the same way that- *-PRD History-* -does —> it will open a modal, showing QA pass/fail event, including a timestamp and the username who performed QA.-

# -For example, it will show:-
## -3/8/23 fail by:- [-matt.riback@crowdbotics.com-|mailto:matt.riback@crowdbotics.com]
## -3/10/23 pass by:- [-matt.riback@crowdbotics.com-|mailto:matt.riback@crowdbotics.com]
# -To confirm, the QA History will record the following events:-
## -The date of a QA Event-
## -The email address of the QA person who performed QA-
## -The status of QA Event (i.e. pass or fail)-
# -Permissions: everybody on project can view QA history-

column1: Allow QA to approve/fail tasks
column33:
This is the first most important step of our QA process: allowing the QA individual to mark Tasks as *Pass*

or *Fail.* 

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Permissions:* Only Team Members with “QA” Job Title will have the ability to perform this feature. 
{panel}

For QA users, when they are Testing any Task, they will have the ability to notate whether QA passes or fails in the *Task Description section.*

Proposed Implementation:

# QA will have a button, labeled *Report QA*, in the Task description section. Only QA team members will see this button. 
# When they select *Report QA*, two buttons will then appear:
## *Pass*
## *Reject*
# When user selects *Pass*:
## Task automatically moves to *Needs Approval* status
# When user selects *Reject*:
## A comment box automatically appears, prompting the user to provide an explanation of what was wrong with the Task. User needs to submit comment in order to Task to be Rejected.
## This comment will permanently exist as a comment in the Task description section to help provide a history of QA. Everybody will be allowed visibility into these comments. Moreover, developers will be able to view comments and have them as a reference while they fix their tickets. 
## Right now, the Task does *not* automatically move back to *In Progress*. We have to answer some questions before we do this step.



We are doing no further automation as of yet-- this is just the first iteration. 

Note: PM moves all subtasks into “*testing*”, which moves the parent Task to *testing*, which then enables this QA feature.
column114:
# When a Task is in *Testing*, QA will have a button, labeled *Report QA*, in the Task description section. Only QA team members will see this button.
# *Permissions:* Only Team Members with “QA” Job Title will have the ability to perform this feature. 
# When they select *Report QA*, two buttons will then appear:
## *Pass*
## *Reject*
# When user selects *Pass*:
## Task automatically moves to *Needs Approval* status
# When user selects *Reject*:
## A comment box automatically appears, prompting the user to provide an explanation of what was wrong with the Task. User needs to submit comment in order to Task to be Rejected.
## This comment will permanently exist as a comment in the Task description section to help provide a history of QA. Everybody will be allowed visibility into these comments.

column1: QA tracking + Client Approval flow
column33:
QA, as we all know, is one of the most important steps of any software development process. However, we are currently not tracking anything related to QA in the CB dash-- it’s handled differently, out of platform, for nearly every project. This epic is designed to bring visibility, insight, and automation into the QA process for CB apps. 

This will help us understand crucial steps of our software delivery process, and will also provide a foundation off of which to automate next steps (depending on if QA passes or fails), which can cumulatively save 100s of hours per month.

column1: Publish Module BE
column33:
The backend will attempt to emulate how [ShareableComponent|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/commit/9336665b1f9a9e860097f416fbb4b0cd3b9943af] operates: a post request creates a new *module* (i.e. {{Component}} instance) *that isn’t marked as verified* (verified modules are the ones from our modules repo)

The shareable screen endpoint accepts the same fields as the fields available for modules (Component model). Check the UI description below for more information. Make sure that:

* validation exists for *unique* module names and slug

 💡 Do we want to have database relationships between the original screen, the shared screen, and the installed screen with the shared screen? For tracking purposes

More information found in spike: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/SPIKE-Publishing-Screens-and-Modules-2b7154f214fc408d8a79bba0252f4352?pvs=4#e23ed126042949a597d6f73653ad3b47|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/SPIKE-Publishing-Screens-and-Modules-2b7154f214fc408d8a79bba0252f4352?pvs=4#e23ed126042949a597d6f73653ad3b47]

column1: Top 10 API requests
column33:
We receive complaints on a weekly basis regarding the platform not working due to performance issues.

As such, we would like to investigate the reason(s) why the platform takes an incredibly long time to load by creating a report that highlights the top 10 API calls into our system, to see if those API requests can be optimized in order to alleviate the performance issues negatively impacting the Dashboard.
column114:
* Create a report that lists the top 10 API calls into our system and rank them based on average number of daily requests and average server response time, respectively.
* Determine what can be done to increase platform performance in light of these top 10 API calls

column200:
15/Mar/23 5:20 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692] in the screehshot that percent represent the number of request. And those progress bar the average time, with tasklist being the longest.
Can we get the total time taken by the request and no. of db queries/api call each request calls?

May be we can get time taken by the db queries/api call as well.

In terms of list, this seems fine as,

 Task is the most used part of our platform. 

Applist/appdetails this makes sense as they are default for every flow. 

Webhook calls we get a lot, since we have a lot of projects.

For server logs, it does poling on certain interval so it makes sense it’s among the top ones.
column201:
16/Mar/23 9:47 AM;60a2b6488cbda700689ac692;

{quote}Can we get the total time taken by the request and no. of db queries/api call each request calls?{quote}

This requires distributed tracing which we don’t have currently.

[~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835] I would say checking average time over certain time frame is a better approach when trying fix latency compared to checking single request.

Ex: Here’s the Drilldown  for {{WebTransaction/Function/crowdbotics.api.v2.viewsets:TasksViewSet.list}} - [https://onenr.io/0oR8aYveojG|https://onenr.io/0oR8aYveojG] 

- *_Per transaction it’s making 6 calls to DB,_* something we can check if this can be optimised? Like this we can identify and work on reducing the latency.  

!image-20230316-164433.png|width=100%!
column202: 16/Mar/23 10:50 AM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692] [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] Please review the findings here. We wanted to overlay this with [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f]'s findings with django-silk to see if this makes sense. Does this provide an accurate summary of what and where we can start optimizing the endpoints and viewsets?
column205:
16/Mar/23 12:46 PM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:60b681f3994185007431bb28] this makes sense to me.

Not sure if we really can improve performance even further on {{WebTransaction/Function/crowdbotics.api.v2.viewsets:TasksViewSet.list}} given that [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] recently made some huge improvements there ([here|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4204/])

We will reduce the number of calls to this endpoint with [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10141|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10141|smart-link]. I think that alone should handle this endpoint bottleneck.

Now for the other function calls, I think a more in-depth investigation would be required, inspecting it with a profiler maybe. But I bet we can improve some of the ORM queries for most of them.

column1: publish module to enterprise
column33:
Allow option to publish modules to an enterprise and not to public if the app is part of an organization (organization is available from the DB).

If the app is an enterprise associated app and a module is published it should only be shared to other apps associated with that organization.  The module should be linked to that organization in the DB.  

Update the [publish modal for enterprise users to include an info box that says “This screen will only be made available to other apps associated with your organization.”

!image-20230525-144701.png|width=826,height=583!

When importing modules add an option to the dropdown to include “Enterprise” in the verified and unverified dropdown.  Default select “Enterprise” if the app is associated with an organization, Verified and “All modules” will remain as the other 2 options.  The enterprise selection will only display modules published by the organization users.

!image-20230525-144749.png|width=415,height=379!
column114:
If the app is an enterprise app (part of an organization) the user will see an info box on the “Create Screen Template” modal.  Non-enterprise apps should NOT see this message.

When working on an enterprise app and viewing modules in the menu or the right-hand panel, the modules shown by default must be part of the enterprise account and the filter dropdown will have “Enterprise” selected.

Modules published from an enterprise app must not be visible to users who are not part of the organization.  This includes when viewing all modules and should not be returned via the API.

and the current behavior for is{{is_verified}} param will be the same right? are you handling at the BE side the correct response when an user select the option all? it should show all (verified, non verified and enterprise one)
column201:
08/Jun/23 7:15 AM;61084bde75ad9600691fd79f;For {{visibility}} : {{Public}} | {{Private}} | {{Shared}} are valid values. 
{{Public}} means all app can use it.
{{Private}} means only for specific app 
{{Shared}} means for enterprise apps   
We can keep the previous behavior by using {{is_varified}} : true | false

column226: Publish screens and modules in Studio

column1: SPIKE: research MVP for publish screens and modules
column33:
The initial request is to support module publishing as a 1-for-1 replacement for the same functionality in Storyboard.  This spike will investigate how much work needs to occur to support basic publishing as well as additional steps.

Suggested steps:

# MVP: Studio screens with supported elements, components and styles.  Broken code can remain, though we should try to clean up the code some.
# Modules - support for publishing the entire module: the screen and the other related module files.  Broken code is ok, though minimal preferred.
# Support for images and stylesheets.
# support for screen/file imports.
# Support for databinding



*Initial discussion:* [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/GQWPU9JHZ/p1678222527248469|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/GQWPU9JHZ/p1678222527248469|smart-link]

Studio support for margin and padding
column33:
*Description*: Expose CSS properties for padding and margin. If user update these properties, they should update the equivalent code property as well. 

Add padding: paddingTop, paddingLop, paddingBottom, paddingRight

Add margin: marginTop, marginLeft, marginBottom, marginRight



Missing designs
column193:
08/Mar/23 8:56 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;*In the future*, we can make the UI more robust with options for padding per side (T, L, R, B), per direction (horizontal/vertical values), as well as updating the values for the entirety of the property (full padding/margin) like this:

!Peek 2023-03-08 11-55.gif|width=435,height=45!



But for now, let’s keep them as individual properties to update and only update per side.

column1: Improve user experience with alignment
column33:
*Motivation*: Alignment today automatically makes an element absolute positioned. However, when an element is not absolute positioned, the user should be encouraged to use flex properties instead. Absolute position alignment should only happen if the user already defines the element with such property

*Description of Task:*  This ticket goal is to unify Flex layout system and alignment panels into one, in a more cohesive, user-friendly manner.



TODO: Need to add more info on how it will look like

column1: Saving a connector should be disabled for missing responses
column33:
# Go to Connectors page
# Create a connector, add a data call to it
# Do not add a response
# Notice that the save button is not disabled
# Save
# Expect the connector code to never be generated

*Expected result*:  *If the user adds a data call, it must have at least one response or connector should not be allowed to save.* 

This is mandatory as per openapi documentation: [https://swagger.io/docs/specification/describing-responses/|https://swagger.io/docs/specification/describing-responses/]

----

column1: Expose global options for an app
column33:
We currently only expose options specific to a given module. The UI should now make all options available (global options as well). 

This will allow us to introduce new features that enable centralized global changes for an app. An example is the header shown for the screens as “UntitledX” (this is not an module option yet, but will be introduced as such): 

!image-20230307-201227.png|width=334,height=137!

*Suggestion*: Have a collapse panel called Global Options on the left panel, above”Data Models”

!image-20230307-201437.png|width=309,height=95!



(designs and location can be revised)

column1: STORY: Tenant Management System (DRAFT)
column33:
h3. Questions

*Is there a way to tweak the public schema’s Django admin to use as a quick and dirty tenant management system?*

*Relevant GitHub Issues*

[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/discussions/754#discussion-3993486|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/discussions/754#discussion-3993486|smart-link] 
[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/869|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/869|smart-link] 
[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/293|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/293|smart-link] 
[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/606|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/606|smart-link] 
[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/606#issuecomment-851015450|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/606#issuecomment-851015450|smart-link] Comment
[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/407|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/407|smart-link] 
[https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/407#issuecomment-634874408|https://github.com/django-tenants/django-tenants/issues/407#issuecomment-634874408|smart-link] Comment

*If not, what do we need to build our own tenant management system?*

Non-exhaustive list of tickets if we decide to build our own:

# SPIKE: Editable features of a Tenant
# DESIGN: Tenant Management UI
# SPIKE: DevOps - Automation of tenant creation + subdomain routing
# SPIKE: FE: Django Templates or Frontend Frameworks? (React, Vue, etc.)
# SPIKE: BE: Vanilla Django or DRF?

h3. Resources

[https://github.com/Corvia/django-tenant-users|https://github.com/Corvia/django-tenant-users|smart-link]

column1: Ability to copy OpenAPI Specification for a connector
column33: *Description*: There will be a button in the “Details“ toggle for connectors installed in an app. This button will have an option to “copy to clipboard“. Once clicked, the OpenAPI specification string object will be copied to the user’s clipboard.

column1: As a user, I want to see my "internal connectors" in the UI
column33:
*Description*: We already generate the “internal connector” (a.k.a API spec) for the app’s back-end. We should be able to display these connectors in the connector UI.

* This should be visible in the “Active in my project” section
* *This connector cannot be shared,*
* If the user attempts to delete, or edit and save this connector, we should display a warning message saying that this could be overridden by future updates to the data models (we could also just disable editing altogether - discuss in refinement)

To be discussed: how do we highlight that this connector is the app’s own connector
column193: 19/May/23 10:27 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;minor FE change

column1: Allow Collaborator role to view subtasks
column33:
David Lin requested that we allow collaborators to view subtasks.  The collaborator should be able to view subtasks in readonly mode.  They should not be able to see costs, hours or ‘request a team member’ columns.

Collaborators should also be able to see IDs for milestones, tasks and subtasks.

This is primarily focused on the “In Development” tab, though other tabs should also be viewed to ensure the data and GUI are consistent.

Hopefully this is as simple as adding a permission to the collaborator role.
column114:
I moved this ticket directly to testing because there are no code changes for it. All the changes were made from the admin area and the goal is to have Users with the role of Collaborators only view subtasks and their IDs on the In Development tab. 


[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] here are the changes required for the Collaborator role on Production.

*The following Permissions were removed for the Collaborator role:*

* User is able to assign tasks to other permitted members 


*While the following was added for the Collaborator role:* 

* User is able to view subtasks 
* User is able to view tasks ids 



CC: [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910]

column1: As an advanced user, I would like to create a connector from an OpenAPI
column33:
*Description*: The platform should allow users to create a connector directly from an open API specification.

The Create Connector button will have an option to create “From OpenAPI Spec“

!image-20230307-165806.png|width=75%!

When clicking on that option, the Plugin Creating popup will have the usual metadata “Properties“ sexction, and also a section for editing the open api specification with a code editor.

The UI should validate the given document, and if the {{JSON}} object is valid, user should be allowed to click save and store the connector. Any errors detected should be shown to the user as a label at the bottom of the code editor

!image-20230307-172805.png|width=1339,height=972!



(Ignore the button at the top written “Use Rich Editor“).

----

*Technical details*: Validation can happen with a library that we currently leverage in other parts of the app that parses open api specifications: {{@apidevtools/swagger-parser}}

We can also use the *v-jsoneditor* component that is used in module options inside of Storyboard as the code editor
column114:
User should be capable of creating a connector from an Open API Specification document.

Wrong document formats should be validated and should not be allowed to be saved.

column1: Set up S3 CORS to allow botics.co links access to S3 bucket by default.
column114:
After the creation of a project, S3 bucket should have the default CORS configuration to allow {{botics.co}} URLs access to S3 objects of that project.

Please also include the optional element {{MaxAgeSeconds}} in your CORS config

# Go to that models admin and upload images
# Image should be uploaded correctly and should be accessible.

column33:

column1: Migrate connectors code from extraReducers to builder callback
column33:
As of Today, we are generating connectors code with {{extraReducers}} as seen here:  [https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/ac69fb066325b2b9aff5a80a892b74bc3c8d9a23/test/transformers/slices.spec.js#L63-L68|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/ac69fb066325b2b9aff5a80a892b74bc3c8d9a23/test/transformers/slices.spec.js#L63-L68]

However, this feature is becoming deprecated and will not longer exist in the next version of RTK. In order to allow our apps to be compliant with newer versions, we must migrate the codegen for connectors to use the recommended approach with builder callback notation: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/ac69fb066325b2b9aff5a80a892b74bc3c8d9a23/test/transformers/slices.spec.js#L63-L68|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/ac69fb066325b2b9aff5a80a892b74bc3c8d9a23/test/transformers/slices.spec.js#L63-L68] 

!Screenshot from 2023-02-17 10-20-59.png|width=33.333333333333336%!
column114: Migrate the codegen for connectors to use the recommended approach with builder callback notation: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/ac69fb066325b2b9aff5a80a892b74bc3c8d9a23/test/transformers/slices.spec.js#L63-L68|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/ac69fb066325b2b9aff5a80a892b74bc3c8d9a23/test/transformers/slices.spec.js#L63-L68]

column1: Fix minor CSS issues generated by Studio
column33:
There are a few areas where Studio generates wrong RN CSS code. We need to start validating user input  based on this ticket: [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-6098|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-6098|smart-link] both for Studio and modules options code.

But in the meantime, Studio should not attempt to generate broken code in the first place.

 *Here are the fixes this ticket must accomplish:*

# *Numbers*: Any number input value must be converted to a number (For example, the Flex property generated {{flex: "1" }}when it should be {{flex: 1}}. The value as a *number*, not a *string*. 
## Another instance of the problem: Slider value
## Check for all input values as numbers and make sure they generate numbers, not strings!
# [*Rotation*|https://reactnative.dev/docs/transforms]: rotation should generate a valid react native rotation code. For a 45 degree rotation, for example, we must generate code as {{transform: [{rotateX: '45deg'}, {rotateZ: '45deg'}]}} and *not* {{transform: "rotate(45deg)"}}



Video showing the problem and how to test:

!Screencast 2023-03-06 11_21_06.mp4|width=1784,height=974!

column1: As a user, I want a consistent screen properties editing experience
column33:
Description/ Motivation: Today, there are two ways of editing screen-specific properties, and both displays different types of information. One is if you select a screen, you see the “Screen details“ panel. The other is if you click the “Properties“ button, more screen details information is visible, with also module options.

!image-20230306-154619.png|width=300,height=379!

!image-20230306-154646.png|width=301,height=260!



This ticket will unify both into a single view.

If the user either selects a screen or click “Properties“ button, they should see a panel called “Screen details“. This panel will contain the toggable menus, in order:

* *Properties*: user can edit screen Name, Description (change label from “Module Description” to just “Description“), Preview Image
* !image-20230306-155117.png|width=21.526772793053546%!

# The “preview Image” label needs to come before the upload image button
# The preview image should be much smaller so it doesn’t occupy as much space in the panel (max-width 150px) - we could use a thumbnail with full preview.
# The “Render Preview” toggle panel must have the same label styling as the other labels (it should not be bold) and it should have and “info” icon tooltip with the hover message “Render preview image instead of the screen code“

* *Screen Route Parameters*: should work the same as it is today
* *Events and Actions*: same as it is today
* *Module Options*: same as it is today

column1: Client was charged on old default credit card
column33:
Env: production

*Steps*
1. Add new credit card to be default credit card
2. Pay 

*Expected*
New credit card to be used for payment

*Actual*
Previous default is used

{quote}The customer had updated his card to be charged as default (0060) but it appears that his old card was charged. I checked on Stripe and indeed, we did not charge the card that was supposed to be charged. Can you check please?{quote}

See thread
[https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1677107745642549|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1677107745642549|smart-link]

column193:
22/Mar/23 9:45 AM;61084bde75ad9600691fd79f;From platform we only allow customer to add single card only that is default card by design and stripe subscriptions automatically charge the default one so I believe it’s not issue for subscriptions invoice. Form the checkout workflow the generated stripe invoice link when customer pay the invoice on stripe that is handled by stripe and customer have to fill the card detail other than auto fill value.  
Eduardo and I investigated on this and found the customer last subscription get charged the default one mentioned in slack thread. 

CC: [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f]
column194:
24/Mar/23 9:17 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;After some more investigation, we found out when this issue happens:

This happens when the user first registers on the platform through the managed user workflow: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Managed-User-Register-Workflow-c308971841114255a0cdc1f5a3bf9b9c|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Managed-User-Register-Workflow-c308971841114255a0cdc1f5a3bf9b9c] after they finish registering on stripe they have a customer created on djstripe (let’s call it a {color:#ff5630}stripe customer{color}). Then after creating a password and logging in on the dashboard a new djstripe user is created (let’s call it a {color:#4c9aff}dashboard customer{color}).

This workflow already gives the user an app with a subscription linked to the {color:#ff5630}stripe customer{color}, but all new subscriptions are linked to the {color:#4c9aff}dashboard customer{color}, same goes for the default credit card being used, we only update the {color:#4c9aff}dashboard user{color} credit card.

So in the end, even if the customer updates its credit card on the dashboard we still charge the old card given we don’t update it for the {color:#ff5630}stripe customer{color}.

The way I see we should handle this is to maintain a single djstripe customer instead of two.

column1: Catalog API - Update Module model to remove 'feature' requirement
column33:
Currently, the {{module}} model requires a {{features}} collection. This is no longer required.  The front-end does not send this value when creating a new module, resulting in a bad request response.

Please remove {{features}} from the {{module}} model.

column1: Getting an invalid date on the Accept and Reject buttons for a task is available on the Need approval tab.
column33:
Getting an invalid date on the Accept and Reject buttons for a task is available on the Need approval tab.

Steps - 

# Open Url [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/] and login
# Create an app
# Go to Tasks > proposal tab
# Create a milestone task 
# Create Payment milestone
# Approve the proposal and payment and checkout
# Move the milestone from development backlog to In development tab 
# Add team member 
# Assign the task
# Change the task status To In progress > Needs Approval
# Go to Needs Approval Tab
# Mouse over to the Accept and reject button

Actual Result - Date is appearing as Invalid date on both button Accept and Reject button.

Video for reference - [https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/-vuz08-B29f-nGxjJZbpxrv4f9iHKDDZ8VAn26am1sU?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=false&_=1677846128712|https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/-vuz08-B29f-nGxjJZbpxrv4f9iHKDDZ8VAn26am1sU?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=false&_=1677846128712|smart-link]

column1: SECURITY: Reflected XSS within PRD Overview description
column33:
Environment:

[https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/67535/tasks?tab=project-details|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/67535/tasks?tab=project-details]

Date: March 2, 2023



Steps to Reproduct:

# Navigate to PRD Overview
# Edit the “Goals & Objectives”
# go to [https://github.com/payloadbox/xss-payload-list|https://github.com/payloadbox/xss-payload-list|smart-link]  and copy the entire payload “XSS Payload List” and paste it within the edit window of the “Goals & Objective”
# Save the field by pressing the X symbol

Expected:

The text should be displayed - escaped

Actual:

The entire control becomes a link, see screenshots for more details

column226: Create unique property for Bug Tracking milestone

column1: Create unique property for Bug Tracking milestone
column114: In both the BE & FE, we will be able to identify Bug Tracking milestones/tasks as having unique properties from other milestones/tasks. Bug Tracking milestones/tasks will *not* have any associated business logic in any way, and are *only* used for viewing/visibility purposes. All Tasks under Bug Tracking milestone will be unpriced.

We should add a delete button to connectors on “Active in my project“ so users can remove connectors from their app.

Technical details: For BE endpoint you need to call, refer to the linked BE ticket

column1: BE
When you click "Add Subtask" multiple times, a new set of subtasks is created.
column33:
When you click "Add Subtask" multiple times, a new set of subtasks is created.

Steps - 

# Open Url [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/] and login
# Create an app
# Go to Tasks → Proposal Tab
# Add Milestone Tasks 
# Click On Add Subtask Button twice (Multiple time)

Actual Result - A new set of subtasks is created on every click on Add Subtask Button

Expected Result - Only one subtask should be added if user click on second time on add subtask button  

Video For Reference - [https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/zhnkeQz-n3uKLNwnW-DwbJ8KlTnYjjrPxpvvW4F1D2k?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=false&_=1677680850390|https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/zhnkeQz-n3uKLNwnW-DwbJ8KlTnYjjrPxpvvW4F1D2k?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=false&_=1677680850390|smart-link]
