django.db.utils.ProgrammingError: operator class "gin_trgm_ops" does not exist for access method "gin"{noformat}

After investigating, this error pops up when the Postgres extension {{pg_trgm}} is missing. However, the {{pg_trgm}} extension already exists as when I try to {{CREATE EXTENSION pg_trgm WITH SCHEMA <schema-name>}} it already exists. I can't {{DROP}} and {{CREATE}} schema cause objects from other schemas already depend on it.

h3. Questions

# I assume that the component model field {{title}} needs to have some data in it before indexes can be added. Can that be the cause of this? Adding indexes on empty columns should still work, no?
# Taking an example of Heroku Postgres, Heroku automatically creates a schema called {{heroku_ext}} where it creates all the required extensions and then shares it with other schemas. This seems to work just fine for the first tenant (created using {{ALTER SCHEMA public RENAME TO cbdash}}) but not for the second tenant (created using Django ORM)

h3. Acceptance Criteria

# Figure out a way to share the existing Postgres extension {{pg_trgm}} with a new schema
# Can this be done without {{DROP}} and {{CREATE}} extension again?
# Can we automate this so it happens on creation of every new tenant?

h3. Resources

[https://github.com/PostgresApp/PostgresApp/issues/335|https://github.com/PostgresApp/PostgresApp/issues/335|smart-link] 

[https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/197208/using-tsvectors-with-gin-trgm-ops|https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/197208/using-tsvectors-with-gin-trgm-ops|smart-link] 

[https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/145586/postgresql-gin-pg-trgm-default-operator-class|https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/145586/postgresql-gin-pg-trgm-default-operator-class|smart-link] 

[https://github.com/hasura/graphql-engine/issues/8734|https://github.com/hasura/graphql-engine/issues/8734|smart-link] 

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73214844/error-extension-btree-gist-must-be-installed-in-schema-heroku-ext|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73214844/error-extension-btree-gist-must-be-installed-in-schema-heroku-ext|smart-link] 

[https://gis.stackexchange.com/questions/64324/what-is-gin-trgm-ops-of-postgresql|https://gis.stackexchange.com/questions/64324/what-is-gin-trgm-ops-of-postgresql|smart-link]
column193:
07/Mar/23 10:51 AM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;Solution: 

Use the {{PG_EXTRA_SEARCH_PATHS}} environment variable and set the value {{heroku_ext}} on the Heroku app. Heroku installs all Postgres extensions within {{heroku_ext}} and this environment variable allows other schemas to access these extensions.

Note from Quan:

{quote}you have to put a note that this ONLY works on heroku. if we are to consider deploying to a standard Postgres install, we need to help out the implementer (when that time comes) {quote}

column1: TECH ENABLER: Determine how to manage tenants through public or cbdash tenant admin
column33:
h3. Story

TBD

h3. Description

The screenshot suggests that the table is missing from the public schema but the django-tenants documentation suggests that site should be within TENANT_APPS if we wish to maintain isolation of sites between tenants. If we place django.contrib.sites within SHARED_APPS, then all sites will be shared with all tenants. This is NOT what we want.

!image-20230301-042626.png|width=1361,height=974!

For AC pt. 2, the Client model is available within the admin. However, if we add the Domain model to the admin, other tenants also have access to it. This is not acceptable as we do not wish to share tenant-specific data with individual tenants. Either we create a separate admin area for tenant management (before we build the Enterprise Console UI) or we restrict admin model rendering based on tenant-context.

h3. Acceptance Critera

# Figure out how to access the public schema admin panel without having to move django.contrib.auth within SHARED_APPS
# Is it possible to create Clients and Domains from within the admin panel

h3. Resources
column193:
07/Mar/23 11:50 AM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;Note to self:

I tried setting up Users within SHARED_APPS to test if its possible to create users independent of tenants and only limited to the public schema. 

*settings.SHARED_APPS*

{noformat}SHARED_APPS = (
    'django_tenants',  # mandatory
    'tenants', # you must list the app where your tenant model resides in

    'django.contrib.contenttypes',

    # everything below here is optional
    # CORE APPS
    'django.contrib.auth',
    'django.contrib.sessions',
    'django.contrib.sites',
    'django.contrib.messages',
    # 'django.contrib.admin',

    # LOCAL APPS
    "users",

    # THIRD-PARTY APPS
    # "allauth",
    "allauth",
    "allauth.account",
    "allauth.socialaccount",
    "axes",
){noformat}


Initially, the createsuperuser command did not work for the public schema as we are using a Custom User model. We have a bunch of lifecycle hooks and post_save signals that are executed after creation of a new user. However, these hooks and signals make reference to apps and models that do not exist within the public schema (SHARED_APPS).

As a workaround, I first tried to include these apps within SHARED_APPS, such as allauth, allauth.account, allauth.socialaccount, cb_slack. I quickly realized that this was a never ending spiral of chained apps and models cause the more I added, with each addition, it was necessary to include even more apps, hence I discontinued work on this approach.

Next approach was making parts of the code execute based on the type of schema selected. This seems a bit more elegant. This was done using {{from django.db import connection}} and then {{if connection.schema_name != "public"}}. The code and logic here works. The createsuperuser command runs without any errors but a User is still not created within the database.

Next steps: figure out why this is happening and what we can do to make this more consistent and logical.

column1: Update ALL Celery tasks to use the TenantAwareCelery task decorator
column33:
h3. Story

The current implementation of Celery is not tenant-aware. This means that Celery tasks will not run unless we make them tenant-aware. All actions on the Crowdbotics' Platform that run asynchronously make use of Celery which is a Task Scheduler and Runner. Everything from creating a new project, to using the model builder and layout editor, storyboard, creating tasks, assigning new team members, posting jobs, updating settings, and initiating deployments make use of Celery workers.

h3. Description

After successful migration of the Crowdbotics Tenant from {{public}} schema to its own {{cbdash}} schema, the Celery tasks are not running. The logs suggest that Celery tries to query the {{public}} schema for models that simply do not exist. This is true for both:  i) scheduled tasks added through {{django-celery-beat}} and Django admin; and ii) all other tasks using the {{@shared_task}} or {{celery.app.@task decorator}}.

*Suggested Implementation*

Current Implementation
{noformat}from celery import shared_task

@shared_task
def func():
	...{noformat}
Suggested Implementation
{noformat}from slackbotics.celery import app

@app.task()
def func():
	...{noformat}

h3. Acceptance Criteria

# ALL Celery tasks using the {{@shared_task}} decorator need to be replaced with {{slackbotics.celery.app.task}} decorator
# Testing: TBD

Note: All tests are currently failing which will be handled in a separate ticket.

h3. Resources

# The django-tenants documentation suggests making use of [https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|smart-link] which passes the current tenant within the context for each task executed through Celery. 
# This has already been implemented in the [https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4184|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4184|smart-link] PR.
# It has been tested on the {{projects.tasks.projects.build_project}} task [here|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/blob/08d0bf3580f68cee62dea593c6148b45331d3b54/projects/tasks/projects.py#L38] where it using the new TenantAwareCeleryApp task decorator fixed the problem

column195:
01/Mar/23 10:16 AM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;Good point [~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835]. I’ll test this with multiple-tenants. Here’s how [https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery#usage|https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery#usage|smart-link] explains it:

{quote}The {{TenantTask}} class transparently inserts current connection's schema into the task's kwargs. The schema name is then popped from the task's kwargs in {{task_prerun}} signal handler, and the connection's schema is changed accordingly.{quote}

column1: Update WebSocket implementation to authenticate using the correct schema
column33:
h3. Story

Currently, the frontend is *NOT* receiving crucial state change updates such as app activity logs and deployment notifications for actions that occur asynchronously. The goal of this ticket is to update the WebSocket implementation so the frontend can receive updates through the WebSocket. 

h3. Description

After successful migration of the Crowdbotics Tenant from {{public}} schema to its own {{cbdash}} schema, the WebSocket is malfunctioning. The logs suggest that the HANDSHAKING request made through {{/ws/crowdbotics/}} tries to access the {{authtoken_token}} table, however, it errors out as the table does not exist within the {{public}} schema.

*Logs*

{noformat}crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | WebSocket closed for ['172.23.0.1', 40530]
crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | WebSocket DISCONNECT /ws/crowdbotics/ [172.23.0.1:40530]
crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | WebSocket DISCONNECT /ws/crowdbotics/ [172.23.0.1:40530]
crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | WebSocket HANDSHAKING /ws/crowdbotics/ [172.23.0.1:60826]
crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | WebSocket HANDSHAKING /ws/crowdbotics/ [172.23.0.1:60826]
crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | Upgraded connection ['172.23.0.1', 60826] to WebSocket
crowdbotics-slack-app-postgres-1   | 2023-02-28 07:24:27.468 UTC [81] ERROR:  relation "authtoken_token" does not exist at character 95
crowdbotics-slack-app-postgres-1   | 2023-02-28 07:24:27.468 UTC [81] STATEMENT:  SELECT "authtoken_token"."key", "authtoken_token"."user_id", "authtoken_token"."created" FROM "authtoken_token" WHERE "authtoken_token"."key" = '158db45e457c9da22678e000e08b8c928262da82' LIMIT 21
crowdbotics-slack-app-app-1        | Exception inside application: relation "authtoken_token" does not exist{noformat}

h3. Acceptance Criteria

# Investigate and report why this is happening
# Refactor and fix the WebSocket implementation to query the correct schema

Stretch goal → Figure out how to make the WebSocket implementation tenant-aware

h3. Resources

# Refer to [PLAT-9938_django-tenants|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4184] branch for the current implementation of django-tenants

column1: SPIKE: Investigate support for other types in model builder
column33:
The model builder currently does not accept creating data models with an image ({{ImageField}}) and choices ({{Choices}}) types, which are pretty common.

The hypothesis is that these types would require extra configuration, such as the existence of an S3 bucket, for example, plus any other code configuration required to handle images.  

The goal of this spike is to investigate what is the effort to include these types in the model builder (include UI updates in the estimate - no need to plan the design, but inform what type of information the UI needs to provide to make the feature possible).
column114: A report with an assessed effort to include {{ImageField}} and {{Choices}} to the model builder.

column1: Upwork Service: CBDashboard Postgres Database needs to be updated to Standard to allow for Rollback functionality
column33:
*Background*

There is a large amount of work going into [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10096|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10096|smart-link]  with a risky migration. We must mitigate this risk by having proper backup and restore functionality if something goes wrong within the production database. The current db tier for Upwork Service: CBDashboard Postgres Database is Basic. Due to the data size and the ability to automatically rollback to an older database, it’d be wise to upgrade this database to Standard Tier

*Description:*

* [https://dashboard.heroku.com/apps/cbdashboard|https://dashboard.heroku.com/apps/cbdashboard|smart-link]  : postgresql-lively-18393 needs to be backed up
* A new Standard Tier database needs to be created, migrating the data from postgresql-lively-18393 to this new database and the application now needs to point to this new database
* The application Upwork Services needs to be restarted and tested against this new database



*Note:*

We also need to advise on an upgrade and rollback plan to [~accountid:61084bde75ad9600691fd79f] when he releases the migration to [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10096|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10096|smart-link]
column114:
* validate that data is valid from the previous database to the new database
* validate the application is functional with the new database
* work with [~accountid:61084bde75ad9600691fd79f] to apply the upgrade to the feature listed

column1: SPIKE: Time-to-first-deployed-app: Display & Graph
column33:
_Pre-sale period_ _= time between PRD approval & customer checkout_



*Start-time* *= time at which checkout is successfully completed*



*_End-time = MFP delivered → time at which iOS, Android & RN Web clickable prototypes are delivered to the customer_*



+*Minimum Functional Product (“MFP”)*+

{quote}A running and clickable application prototype which consists of the following:{quote}

* A web version of the UI
* Mobile versions of the UI deployed to the emulator (Appetize).
* All application screens completed with unstyled or minimally styled views.
* All application models created.
* All connectors built.

{quote}Workflows and application logic are out of scope.{quote}

----

h3. PART 1 (CORE)

Manually calculate the average time to first deployed Mobile &/or Web app for paid customer projects only.

# Identify a random sample of paid customer projects that were created within the last year (sample size ~1% the total number of paid customer projects over the same period)
## ensure that all projects within the random sample have a customer approved PRD + task checkout completed
# Determine the date/time at which the PRD was approved by the customer for all projects within the random sample
# Determine the date/time at which the task checkout process was completed for all projects within the random sample
# Determine the date/time at which the first Mobile build (Android + iOS) was generated for all projects within the random sample
# Determine the date/time at which the first Web build was generated for all projects within the random sample
# Calculate the duration of time between:
## (3) - (2)
## (4) - (3)
## (5) - (3)
## (5) - (4)

----

h3. PART 2

Determine the implementation required to automate *PART 1 (CORE)*
column114:
h3. *PART 1 (CORE)  |  3-5 points*

Manually calculate the average time to first deployed Mobile &/or Web app builds for paid customer projects only. (3-5 points):

# Identify a random sample of paid customer projects that were created within the last year (sample size ~1% the total number of paid customer projects over the same period)
## ensure that all projects within the random sample have a customer approved PRD + task checkout completed
# Determine the date/time at which the PRD was approved by the customer for all projects within the random sample
# Determine the date/time at which the task checkout process was completed for all projects within the random sample
# Determine the date/time at which the first Mobile build (Android + iOS) was generated for all projects within the random sample
# Determine the date/time at which the first Web build was generated for all projects within the random sample
# Calculate the duration of time between:
## (3) - (2)
## (4) - (3)
## (5) - (3)
## (5) - (4)

h3. *PART 2  |  3-5 points*

* Determine the implementation required to automate the manual derivation completed in PART 1 to satisfy the following criteria:
** Calculate the average time to first deployed app (“MFP”) across all customer project repos in [https://github.com/crowdbotics-apps|https://github.com/crowdbotics-apps|smart-link] as the amount of time between the customer completing the task checkout process based on an approved PRD, up-until the time at which the delivery team provides the customer with the first clickable app prototype(s) for iOS, Android & RN Web builds, respectively.
* Create a line graph that shows the change in average time to first deployed app (“MFP”) across all customer project repos scanned based on subscription plan type (i.e. Community, Pro, Advanced, Enterprise) over different periods of time:
** Over the past 7 days
** Over the past 30 days
** Over the past 90 days
** YTD
** Average Month-over-Month → February 2023 vs February 2022
** Average YoY → 2023 vs 2022
* Create a searchable table that displays the average time to first deployed app (“MFP”) for any customer project repo, based on subscription plan type (Community, Pro, Advanced, Enterprise)

06/Mar/23 6:39 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] parking this for now so I can cover the code coverage and bot coverage pieces.

*Initial analysis:*

I spoke with [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] and we can get an approximate value if we key off of the on_create field for {{ProjectPaymentStatus}}. That will give us a rough idea of when the {{is_checked_out}} flag has been set.

Anyone picks this up should query the production database and the average between the {{created}} and {{modified}} date to get the average range of possibly when the project was checked out.

The real implementation however is to add an entry within the auditlog for when {{is_checked_out}} is set to True. That’s a code change and will only affect new projects. Older projects will need to key off of the approximation of the created and modified date of {{ProjectPaymentStatus}}

Note: for [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] I did look into the Data Warehousing effort from the other team: [https://console.cloud.google.com/bigquery?project=data-warehouse-cb1&ws=!1m0|https://console.cloud.google.com/bigquery?project=data-warehouse-cb1&ws=!1m0] they are not scraping what we need to properly capture the start-time outlined within the requirements of this ticket. We must query the production database for this information or ask them to augment the ETL jobs for the database tables/fields we need.

column1: SPIKE: Code Reuse: Display & Graph
column33:
h1. Visualization Requirements:

* Display the *number of repositories* scanned
* Display the number of existing modules used within all scanned repositories as a proportion of the total code therein
** Which modules are the most frequently used amongst all scanned project repos?
** Which modules are most frequently customized from their existing template?
*** Is there a correlation between the most frequently used modules and the most customized ones?
* Display the percentage of customized module code versus existing CB module code from the module GitHub repo
* Display the percentage of complete new module code versus existing module code
* Display the *date* that the scrapping took place
* Graph trends with a periodicity of the past 7 days, past 30 days, past 90 days & YTD 
* Create a searchable table that allows internal CB users to obtain the code reuse metric on a per project basis based on subscription plan type (Community, Pro, Advanced, Enterprise)

_Stretch: Feature extract should be flexible to extrapolate additional findings from the data, e.g. the project type/category, private or public repos_
column114:
h3. PART 1 (CORE)  *|  3-5 points*

# Manually calculate the code reuse metric as the proportion of [https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules|smart-link] code that comprises a customers' total project repo codebase by taking a random sample of paid customer projects from [https://github.com/crowdbotics-apps|https://github.com/crowdbotics-apps|smart-link] that were created within the last year. 
## The random sample size should represent approx. ~1% the total number of paid projects.
## All projects within the random sample should contain an approved PRD & completed task checkout
# Categorize module type to determine the top 5 most frequently used modules in the random sample
# Create the data model required to push the metadata scape+batch into Prometheus that will be used in PART 2

h3. PART 2  *|  3-5 points*

# Create a line graph to show the change in the code reuse metric as a percent of all scanned project repos over time based on subscription plan type & the number of modules used therein
## Over the past 7 days
## Over the past 30 days
## Over the past 90 days
## YTD
## Average Month-over-Month → February 2023 vs February 2022
## Average YoY → 2022 vs 2023
# Create a CDF to determine the probability of a particular module’s code being used in any given project code repo
## Which modules are used most/least often across all projects?
# Create a searchable table that allows us to ascertain the code reuse metric for any given project repo
column193: 28/Feb/23 10:38 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;we store module usage in our DB → we can get which modules are being used for which projects → must determine how we can ingest this data into Prometheus so all Product Metrics are available in Grafana
column194: 28/Feb/23 10:39 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;How is module usage tracked currently → it’s a data clip from Heroku [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] will find the data clip and attach it to the ticket

14/Mar/23 2:09 PM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:625eea269e7c190069e6c59f] Marking as Under Review

(/) Display the *number of repositories* scanned

(/) Display the number of existing modules used within all scanned repositories as a proportion of the total code therein

❌ (/) Display the percentage of customized module code versus existing CB module code from the module GitHub repo

Explanation: module detection is a best-effort approach. Some “Custom” module code might be considered as “Other” by the detection algorithm

(/) Display the percentage of complete new module code versus existing module code

(/) Graph trends with a periodicity of the past 7 days, past 30 days, past 90 days & YTD

❌ Create a searchable table that allows internal CB users to obtain the code reuse metric on a per project basis based on subscription plan type (Community, Pro, Advanced, Enterprise)

_Explanation:_ We don’t have this visibility with regard to subscription plans at this time. We can add it in if this is really important

column1: UI clean up
column33:
Style Guide for reference: [https://www.figma.com/file/PnZxSAQLf0LAkxzplb9Y3W/CB---UI-Style-Guide-2?node-id=0%3A1&t=O0qcq00WejLS588b-0|https://www.figma.com/file/PnZxSAQLf0LAkxzplb9Y3W/CB---UI-Style-Guide-2?node-id=0%3A1&t=O0qcq00WejLS588b-0|smart-link] 

*On Team Page:*


• Column arrows-- unclear which column they refer to, confusing UI. I don’t think anybody uses these arrows-- let’s delete them for now. 
• Center the values under “Github Access” and “Actions” column
• Create zero state for charge rate, i.e. a way to reflect when a user doesn’t have any charge rate: when there is no charge rate set, use a short line as the “zero state”, i.e.:  ——
                      • The length of two em dashes without space in between
• Scroll bar extends beyond table 
• Avoid blue color for menu icons → change to [dark grey color|https://www.figma.com/file/PnZxSAQLf0LAkxzplb9Y3W/CB---UI-Style-Guide-2?node-id=0%3A1&t=O0qcq00WejLS588b-0] (to indicate it’s not clickable)

* *Job title column:* needs to be the first column to the right of *username* column. We also need to adjust spacing to ensure that this column can be read w/ a reasonable amount of comfort. 
* Consider column spacing, decreasing space where possible to make more room for Job Title column. 
** I recommend: shortening “In Progress” column a bit, since we already have the hover-over for full explanation. We can also remove the bullet points that precede “In Progress” values to free up space
** Shorten the SU column b/c it is rarely used, keeping in mind it will soon be moved to detail view




!Scroll Bar.png|width=468,height=113!
column114:
On the Team page:

* Column arrows (used to filter top/bottom) will be removed
* The values under “Github Access” and “Actions” will be centered under column
* When a user does not have a charge rate, a short line will appear: ——
** The length of two “em dashes” but without space in between
* The scroll bar will not extend beyond table
* *Job Type* column will appear to the right of *username*, and will have more spacing. 
* Reduce spacing on “In Progress” and “SU” columns, to make more room for Job Type. 
** Remove bullet points at beginning of In Progress values? Or use a small dash instead-- current solution takes up too much space.
* Avoid blue color for menu icons → change to [dark grey color|https://www.figma.com/file/PnZxSAQLf0LAkxzplb9Y3W/CB---UI-Style-Guide-2?node-id=0%3A1&t=O0qcq00WejLS588b-0] (to indicate it’s not clickable)

column1: Studio commits into master/main need to have a commit header from Crowdbotics
column33:
*Background:*

Crowdbotic is poised to measure the reusability of its generated code. Legacy projects there is a mechanism do to this in a lossy way. Moving forward however it would be better if we can simplify our code bot detection to look for a label within the commit logs. Then we can know which commits came from the platform and which were manually inserted 

*Description*

The Studio code needs to add a new heading for each time it commits code from the CB platform into a customer repository. Below is the new heading

{{[Crowdbotics Platform Commit]}}
column114:
* validate that all new commits for customer projects have the new commit heading

The format of:

{noformat}[Crowdbotics Platform Commit]

Crowdbotics Studio: Update app screens{noformat}

or

{noformat}[Crowdbotics Platform Commit]
Crowdbotics Studio: Update app screens{noformat}

are acceptable

column1: Actions - Regression on databinding feature, no longer supports complex jsx expressions
column33:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/ast-api/utils.ts#L26-L29|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/ast-api/utils.ts#L26-L29]

Introduces a regression where an expression such as:


{noformat}"{lorem.ipsum.map(lor => <View>{lor.name}</View>)}".match(DATABINDING_PATTERN){noformat}

is no longer supported since they fail the regex match above.

The same goes for {{{Users[0].name}}}

Intentional support for nested components was built via regression:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/actions/update-text.ts#L51-L52|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/actions/update-text.ts#L51-L52]
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/visitors/jsx.ts#L223-L225|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/visitors/jsx.ts#L223-L225]

Checklist for fixing the issue:
- Add unit tests for complex JSX Expressions on {{updateText}} and related visitors
- Use a visitor to check whether a string is a valid JSX Expression instead of doing regex-based matching
- Test/validate whether other updates made on {{updateText}} are also a regression

column1: update sections styling - better vertical space, auto expand and collapse
column33:
* Increase _vertical_ padding for collapsible panels title (an increase from 8px to 10px), but reduce the space between them (from 16px to 8px)  (before/after)

!image-20230315-153032.png|width=33.33333333333333%,alt="before"!

!image-20230315-152950.png|width=33.33333333333333%,alt="after"!

* *Auto expand* all of the sections by *default*
* *Only the following sections must remain collapsed by default*
** Events And Actions
** Advanced Settings (additional components)
** Data models
* *Code improvements*: make the collapse panels lazy-loaded: only load the component content when expanded
column114:
* Collapse panels are expanded by default, except the ones listed in the ticket description 
* Space between panels is 8px
* Vertical padding for panel title is 10px
* Panels that are collapsed will be loaded only when toggled open (this should be verified at code review stage)

column1: Toast message not appears on screen "Screens cannot overlap, please move the screen to an open position on the canvas."
column33:
When user try to overlap screen an Toast should appears to user at bottom of the screen.
"Screens cannot overlap, please move the screen to an open position on the canvas."

Steps:-  
Go to  Studio
Add multiple screen
Now added 4 screen to cover an screen such as left ,right, top and Bottom to the added screen
Now try to drop one a new screen to covered screen to the canvas
Observe 

Expected Result:-

column1: changed value of module options from module properties of added module in storyboard is not getting saved
column33:
Description:- when user try to change and save the module options values from module properties of added module in storyboard then changed value is not getting saved also user is getting a success toast message as well but when we recheck the saved values then user gets the pervious one only, not changed values.

Artifact:- [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TLhEHdtSdxca_KDiC8JLFQtj0EA3ykmc/view|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TLhEHdtSdxca_KDiC8JLFQtj0EA3ykmc/view|smart-link] 

Test step:

# go to CB dashboard

# open existing mobile app

# go to storyboard & add module from module option then save

# mouse hover over the added module & click on properties option

# go for module options values & make some changes then save

# observe the toast message

column1: FE to use new serverside endpoint for search
column33:
Currently the Search by ID input is client side. This means that the FE needs to have all the tasks loaded to be able to search on them.

This is not ideal as the FE needs to make multiple requests to load all the tasks before it can search on them. We should have a server side search endpoint that returns the searched tasks.

* Frontend to use new endpoint created in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10132|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10132|smart-link] 
* Frontend to remove code that was used to generate the lists and previous code to make the search work

# I don’t think the original ticket included links *in the pop up*; only links for the *In Progress* column itself. So that is not a bug. However, that is an improvement I’d like to make in the future, so I think your thinking here is great [~accountid:618e6f963ae5230069229010] .
# All tasks look like they are appearing in the pop up in your demo? If not, I would please send this back to whomever worked on the original ticket, maybe [~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4] or [~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] to double check?

column195:
23/Feb/23 3:33 PM;621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] can you please clarify, what’s the bug exactly ?, I don’t think i get it.
if we’re talking about showing all tasks, this is not a bug, I’m showing only 2 tasks intentionally,  and the rest on the popover. otherwise if we show more than 2 tasks that wouldn’t look good at all.
column196:
23/Feb/23 7:40 PM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4] yes, you are correct! That’s not the bug. Showing two tasks, and using ellipses if there are more than two, is exactly what we want to do. 

Here is the bug [~accountid:618e6f963ae5230069229010] found:

* On the pop-up (that appears on hover over): if you look at the screenshot, you will notice that some of the text is cut off at the top. There needs to be a scroll bar so that the user can actually view *all* of the Tasks that are in progress. 
* We also want to make sure that *every* assigned task appears on the pop-up hover over. It looks like that might be the case but please just double check. 

Does that make sense? So the only issue is the UI of the pop-up hover over… it just needs a scroll bar so that every Task can be viewed. Let me know- thank you!

column1: Maintaining shadow table for crowdbotics_tasks table for historization
column33:
Maintaining History of "Crowdbotics Tasks" table	"Instead of manipulating & changing  crowdbotics_task, we can create a shadow copy of that table let's say crowdbotics_task_changelog.

# With this approach, existing UI logic and support ticket will still work with main task table.
# For the shadow task table, data engineering team will just have to update the sql queries at the backend to support capturing of history and change log.

This feature has been discussed between Our Team & Eduardo / Santosh"	With this, we can accurately report on historical data.

column1: Milestones paid by the client, which do not have any tasks/subtasks - Orphan milestones
column33:
25 Milestones with *1156 hours and $86,697* - Paid by the client in crowdbotics_milestone, which do not have any tasks/subtasks - Orphan milestones

For all these 25 Milestones, we have no data available on tasks/subtasks level. These are considered as "Orphan" milestones in the database. The reason is unknown to us at the moment.	

1. If a milestone exists in the milestone table, and paid by the client with hours & revenue assosicated to it, then it should have "Tasks/Subtasks" connected to it.	

We are not able to reconcile the hours & revenue between milestones and subtask level data

*Spike:*

Is this still happening? Investigate first, depending on results, might require further work

column1: Mismatches between UI & the Production Database
column33:
"If adding Hours / Revenue / COGS on a subtask level, does not get added and reflected correct as ""Summed"" up values in the Parent Task.

In the example (see screenshot) at the end, the sum of hours and revenue for subtasks is 15 & $750 However, the Parent Task total is 25 hours and $1250 "	Summing up Hours / Revenue subtasks should always be equal to Parent Task. 	"Everything we have built is associated to ""Subtasks"" level data. 

Our logic work from bottom up. 

In this way we are unable to match the data with the UI, creating confusions among the dashboard users."

*Discussion:*

Spike first to investigate, implementation comes after

column1: Calcuatlion Error between the UI & the actual database values
column33:
"The task (344018) of this milestone (47585) is still in ""Needs Approval"" according to the database, however the UI is showing this milestone as ""Delivered"".

Need more thorough investigation why this happend? and fix future use cases as well as past use cases"	"If all subtasks are ""Done"", then the Parent can be ""Needs Approval"" or ""Done"".

If all Parent tasks are ""Needs Approval"", then Milestone is in ""Need Approval""

If all Parent tasks are ""Done"", then Milestone is ""Delivered"".

However, there are instances where the UI is not respecting these constraints."	"Because of this we are unable to provide clarity to the CSM/TL/PM on why our GDS dashboard is showing milestone in needs approval and the UI is showing it as delivered.

Secondly, the UI is simply filtering out the task and its subtask even though they are not archvied. With this we are also missing  3 hours & $126 against this task in comparison to the UI."

column1: Move SOW button (Task Page)
column33:
*Description:*

The Scope of Work contract currently lives in the *In Development* section of the Task page. It is confusing, and hard to locate. Clients often need to refer back to this contract throughout a project’s life cycle for obvious reasons-- it’s the signed agreement stating *how much the client will pay* for *the services we will provide to them.* 

When Clients can’t find button, it takes time away from sales/support teams who have to help the clients. Let’s save everybody some time and make this Scope of Work contract more obvious!

*Implementation: (Will update based on conversation → modal view on overview page)*

# Turn the SOW contract into a button, labeled: *SOW Contract*
# Place this SOW Contract in +one+ place: 
## *Overview Tab*
### Place underneath under “Attachments”, bottom left of screen (see screenshot). 
# Remove Current implementation, at the end of the row for every milestone/task on *In Development, Dev Backlog, Needs Approval, and Delivered tabs* tab.
# If there is only one SOW contract, then upon clicking button, PDF will automatically open. If there is more than one SOW contract, we will utilize the same UI for PRD history to show the different contracts.

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
If there is more than one SOW contract, utilize the same UI as we do for PRD history (on Overview Tab-- see attached screenshot for example). 
{panel}

column1: Add "Upload Picture" to "Submit Bug" Form
column33:
Include the option for users to upload a screenshot of any bug they encounter. Use whatever “upload picture” feature we are already using in our codebase (unless this would be a good time to find a better one). 

Field Title: *Attach File*

Button description: *Click to Upload File*

When this feature is implemented, this screenshot will also be visible as an attachment under the correlating *Task Description* that is created for this bug

!Submit a Bug Mockup.png|width=568,height=739!
column114:
User will have the ability to upload a screenshot of the bug they encounter, to help our system track down bugs. 

When implemented, the screenshot will also appear *as an attachment* in the *Task Description* for the Bug that is created.

column1: Populate details of "Bug Tasks" under Bug Tracking milestone
column33:
# When a bug is submitted, automatically create a new milestone on the *In Development* tab, titled “*Bug Tracking”*
# Any bug that is submitted will appear under the *Bug Tracking* milestone as a *Task*
# Right now, the dropdown details of a Task include: a) *Description* and b) *Acceptance Criteria.* For Bug Tracking, we are going to modify the dropdown details:
# Include the following fields (taken from Bug Sumission Form):
## Description
## Milestone
## Task
## Date Reported (collected on BE)
## Reporter (collected on BE)
# In the *Submit Bug* form, the only required fields is: *Description.* We also automatically collect *Date Reported* and *Reporter*. In the case where there is no value for (*Task* and *Milestone*), use “N/A” for their values in the Task Description. 
# Delete the “Acceptance Criteria” section w/in Task dropdown



See Screenshot:

!Task Details Screenshot.png|width=1085,height=255!
column114:
# When a bug is submitted for the first time, a new milestone will be created-- the Bug Tracking Milestone. This Milestone will be titled: *Bug Tracking*. 
# The submitted bug-- and all future submitted bugs on any given project-- will appear under this milestone as Tasks.
# The details of that Task will populate with the information taken from the *Submit Bug* form:
## Description
## Milestone
## Task
## Date Reported
## Reporter
# If *Milestone* and *Task* (two fields that are +not+ required) do not have any value, use “N/A” for their value in Task Description. 
# There will be no field labeled “Acceptance Criteria”

column1: Create "Submit Bug" Form
column33:
# Create button with the label: *Submit Bug*
# Place button to the left of “Billing Type” button (see screenshot). You can place button where current “Filter Tasks” button is. We are moving the Filter Task (Bulk Update) button to left side of the screen. 



*Permissions:* Anybody can submit a bug that is part of a project

!Where to Place Submit Bug Button.png|width=775,height=312!





3. Create a pop up form that appears after user selects “Submit Bug” button

4. Form will have the following fields

# Title: *Submit a Bug*
# Subtitle: *Share what isn’t working so we can address it*
# Description form
## Label: *Description*
## Placeholder text: *Describe the bug with as much detail as possible, including steps to reproduce if applicable.*
## Interaction: User types their description
## This is a required field
# Milestone form
## Label: *Milestone (if applicable)*
## Placeholder Text: Select Milestone
## Interaction: Select dropdown with available milestones
## This is an optional field
# Task form
## Label: *Task (if applicable)*
## Placeholder text: Select Task
## Interaction: Select dropdown with available milestones
## This is an optional field
# Buttons
## *Submit*
## *Cancel*
# BE Data collection
## Collect the name of the *user* who submitted the bug
## Collect the *timestamp* for when this bug was reported
# Permissions Note: **_Anybody_ invited to the project is able to submit a bug if they desire.



!Submit a Bug Mockup.png|width=568,height=739!

Note: Don’t include “Steps to reproduce” field; we’re combining that w/ “Description” to simplify
column114:
When somebody clicks *Submit Bug* button, a *Bug Submission Pop Up* will appear. This pop up will have the following fields:

# Description
## Label: *Description*
## Example text: *Describe the bug with as much detail as possible, including steps to reproduce if applicable.*
# Milestone form
## Label: *Milestone (if applicable)*
## Placeholder text: Select Milestone
## Interaction: Select dropdown with available milestones
## This is an optional field
# Task form
## Label: *Task (if applicable)*
## Placeholder text: Select Task
## Interaction: Select dropdown with available milestones
## This is an optional field

Including two buttons: a) *Submit* b) *Cancel*

The Pop up will have the correct Title and Subtitle (see above). 

Our Back End will also collect the following data: a) *timestamp* b) *username of reporter*

Permissions: anybody that is part of the project will have the ability to submit bug.

column1: Bug Tracking Epic
column33:
Bug tracking, as we all know in this product team, is a critical part of every software development process. However-- *_you may want to take a seat_*-- we currently do not have a way to track bugs w/in the CB Platform! This epic will change that. 

This epic will allow any Team Member so submit bugs as they find them on their project. This feature will allow projects to: 1) Track Bugs and 2) Process them (as they would other tasks)



Let’s dive in!

column1: Update scaffold for user designated start screen in Studio
column33:
Allow the user to specify which screen is the first screen to load when the app runs.

The first screen added to the canvas will default to the first screen.

Add a toggle to the Screen Details panel below the screen name that has a label of “App start screen”.

Show an info popover icon to the right of the label that says “This screen will be loaded first when the app is run, only one screen can be selected as the start screen.”

If the user toggles on a screen as the start screen and another screen exists as the start screen then disable (turn off) the app start screen for the other screen.

Show a gold star icon to the left of the name of the screen in the canvas to indicate the start screen.  When mouse over that icon it will show a tooltip: “This screen will be loaded first when the app is run.”
column114:
Update the React Native scaffold at crowdbotics/modules to support a user defined initial route here (via global options):
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/blob/74ec19e2fecf20be90df8d9c2d1d9b848242f47d/scaffold/template/custom/modules/index.js#L5|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/blob/74ec19e2fecf20be90df8d9c2d1d9b848242f47d/scaffold/template/custom/modules/index.js#L5|smart-link] 

Use *or* logic to fallback to the old implementation if a global option value isn’t provided. I.e:

{noformat}globalOptionValue || currentImplementation{noformat}

column1: BE
column33:
Update the current connector endpoint {{/v2/connectors/{id}/ }}to expose a shared connector (i.e. from {{Connector}} model{{)}}detailed information (such as openapi spec).

Expose the fields:
- auth_type
- base_url
- tags
- created_by
- image
- public
- category
- description
- name
- website
- openapi



This endpoint currently exists, but it does not work as expected: 

!image-20230228-225355.png|width=1422,height=369!

It returns the basic fields like the *list* endpoint. it must return more *detailed* information for a single connector request.



Note: Check with the equivalent FE team member working on this if they require more fields available

column1: Codegen for connectors does not treat optional parameters as optional
column33:
Add a connector with optional parameters, like this one: 

!image-20230222-173355.png|width=1387,height=1502!

Notice the code generated, it attempts to access payload.param, assuming that payload is an object: [https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/february-app-0216-d-64125/blob/master/store/boredAPI/api.js#L10-L19|https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/february-app-0216-d-64125/blob/master/store/boredAPI/api.js#L10-L19|smart-link] 



But when payload is undefined (user is not passing any parameters), the code fails.

*Expected result:* Codegen should not assume that the parameters object is passed. Perhaps we could add a default object value instead (like {{function (payload={})}})

column194: 22/Feb/23 10:07 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;This is code update, it shouldn’t be testable by QA.

column1: As a user, I need to see details of a connector to be installed
column33:
*Motivation*: Shared connectors don’t have the detail information about them visible in the UI today. We only display basic metadata info like this: 

!image-20230222-165142.png|width=1213,height=253!

Users should be able to click on a “More details“ button and view a popup that will display all of the technical information about a connector, the available endpoints and configuration that this connector have.



(update design idea below if necessary)

The contents of the popup should look exactly like the current edit plugin panel (use the same component), expect none of the editable options would be available (and input forms would be disabled). Also, all of the Data calls panel would be toggled open by default.

!image-20230222-174432.png|width=585,height=1350!
column114: Detailed information of connectors in the “All Connectors“ tab should be accessible with “More Details“ button
column193: 22/Feb/23 8:55 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;I worded the details as a popup because only if the user chooses to see the details that we should fetch the data from the backend, otherwise the list of connectors  come with unnecessary extra data (connectors JSON objects are large)

column1: Update UI and Codegen to accept advanced FlatList
column33:
Currently, if a FlatList has the {{renderItem}} defined as an inline function

{noformat}<FlatList renderItem={() => <Component />  }{noformat}

Studio works as expected.

But if a FlatList received a component as prop directly, you cannot edit the FlatList elements nor see them in the Component Tree.

{noformat}<FlatList renderItem={Component} />{noformat}

This ticket will address:

* Fixing the codegen {{getTree}} plugin and let it parse components as props
* Fixing the UI to treat the component items like usual (A text will be able to be edited in the text panel, etc) (I suspect fixing the getTree should automatically fix everything else, but make sure it is all working  as expected)

Reproduce-able steps in video: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bS834O0dMZArD2RxJFmiChjBnB2CWZu7/view?usp=share_link|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bS834O0dMZArD2RxJFmiChjBnB2CWZu7/view?usp=share_link|smart-link] 

Code that works: [https://snack.expo.dev/_CYEkYyiE|https://snack.expo.dev/_CYEkYyiE|smart-link] 

Code that doesn’t work: [https://snack.expo.dev/@alinetavares/92f850|https://snack.expo.dev/@alinetavares/92f850|smart-link]

column1: Spike: Determine work needed for PRD to generate studio screens instead of storyboard
column33:
We need to figure out what work would be needed to make the PRD generate Studio screens instead of Storyboard screens.

When a task goes into “In Development” it generates code in the repo but nothing is visible on Studio.  We need these screens to be generated in studio and displayed sequentially by default.

A few use cases to consider, in order of priority:

# A fresh project where the user utilizes Catalog for all modules. 
# A fresh project where the user utilizes catalog as well as custom screens. (we need to generate a blank screen for 100% custom modules/screens).
# A project that the user uses Studio for part of the project and the rest are created from Catalog.

Ideally, we should be able to handle all three use cases but the first 2 are the most important.

*Update post planning meeting (3/1): The primary exercise here is to document anything that is not working as intended when you add modules to PRD, check out, and move the tasks into “In Development”.  This workflow should result in the same functionality in Studio as if you dragged and dropped a module from the module menu into the canvas only in Studio.  We should test different types of modules: screen only and modules with BE code.*


-> [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Spike-Determine-work-needed-for-PRD-to-generate-studio-screens-instead-of-storyboard-7f01fefb31794453aa90d8994f3d01c4|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Spike-Determine-work-needed-for-PRD-to-generate-studio-screens-instead-of-storyboard-7f01fefb31794453aa90d8994f3d01c4]
column114: A report outlining the work needed to support creating Studio screens from catalog modules.

column193: 28/Feb/23 11:01 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] does this need to come from Studio team or PRD team? Feels like a collaboration, but needs to come from someone who understands the current behavior of PRD first, before making any suggestions
column194:
28/Feb/23 11:47 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;[~accountid:5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1] I think [~accountid:5afc9b4315546e06f95320e2] may have some insights on this.  If I recall, the code is installed when the module task goes to “In Development”.  The issue is that we’re creating a module in storyboard (you can see the screen in storyboard canvas), but there is no screen added to Studio.  We need the module installation which is done through the Tasks system to also create a screen.

When PRD is approved then the modules that are part of the PRD are added as tasks in the proposal.  The tasks are the same that we’ve used before and have a reference to the code module (if any). 

An additional thing we should also do (eventually) is allow the BA (or customer) to designate a custom screen/module as having a visual aspect (screen) and create a blank screen PH in studio for these.  That’s not something we need with this ticket, however.

column1: Make the code editor modal larger
column33:

The preview panel should be be able to show an entire mobile preview without scrolling on a 1080p screen, this likely means the preview should be a little smaller.

column1: Studio "Data Models" values are not consistent
column33:
The data models panel is not consistent with the actual data models in code. 

*Expected result*: The data models values should *capitalized and pluralized* (Logins, Signups, Passwords… etc).

----

*Details*: 

!image-20230217-221600.png|width=294,height=391!



In the example above, boredapi20 is not capitalized, and the other values are not pluralized. Here is how the data model look like in code.

They start pluralized: [https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/february-app-0216-d-64125/blob/master/store/februaryappdAPI/logins.slice.js#L15|https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/february-app-0216-d-64125/blob/master/store/februaryappdAPI/logins.slice.js#L15|smart-link] 

Then they are capitalized: [https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/february-app-0216-d-64125/blob/46984dbc6df44131b3ec986e17de0b6402f7b3ab/store/index.js#L10|https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/february-app-0216-d-64125/blob/46984dbc6df44131b3ec986e17de0b6402f7b3ab/store/index.js#L10|smart-link] 

Here is a console.log of the name of all models in this same redux app:

{noformat} LOG  ["app", "Boredapi20_response_get_GetActivities", "Articles", "AuthTokens", "Logins", "PasswordChanges", "PasswordResetConfirms", "Passwords", "Signups", "UserDetails", "VerifyEmails"]{noformat}

column1: Left nav menu cleanup
column33:
There are a few changes needed for the left nav menu:

# Canvas should be first in the list, then Data Models, then Connectors.
# Expand Studio by default, instead of starting collapsed.  When we expand our menu some time down the line we can have it collapsed by default.
# When expanded, show a divider line above the Studio menu item to indicate visually that Studio is the parent of the group. (see screenshot below)
# When collapsed, have the icons show the same color as when expanded, remove the left vertical line.
# Show the crowdbotics pencil icon when collapsed instead of the ‘collapse’ icon at the top.
# Shift the content in studio to be flush with the left panel.
# Move Storyboard to show below the Studio group.
# Move Storyboard to show below the Studio group. # Apply {{canViewStudio}} permission only to the “Canvas“ link

!image-20230217-212756.png|width=491,height=587!

column1: Standardize Github Actions releases for all repos
column33:
All repos should follow the same release process and have the same type of Actions to automate releases.

* Release action that creates a tagged release based on our standard release tag. Optionally choose a branch with default master.
* Cherry pick release action that creates a release based on specific unreleased commit IDs

Repos that need this:

* crowdbotics-slack-app
* vue-dash-5104
* modules
* django-scaffold

column1: Setup Staging/Development environment for k8s on AWS
column33:
Currently, we don’t have a Kubernetes infrastructure setup. In order to create and test the required K8s manifests, we need a production-like infrastructure setup for staging/development.

The infrastructure should be set up using Terraform. The following services are required.

* RDS for Postgres
* Amazon MQ for RabbitMQ 
* AWS ElastiCache for Redis
* Monitoring. Grafana, Prometheus and Prom Pushgateway should be setup

The staging/development infrastructure should be of the smallest tiers possible.
column114:
When {{terraform apply}} is run, this infra resources should be spinned up and there should be {{outputs}} showing the relevant connection strings to each.

* RDS connection string
* grafana UI
* Pushgateway UI
* SSL configured

column1: Merging to master triggers deployment of modules in production
column33:
Checkout the modules repo: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules|smart-link] 

Modules repo deploys to staging on merge to master and to production as a release tag. The newly introduced GitHub action [that automatically release modules does not follow this pattern.|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/blob/52d781f2e24a538c7d4ed4bc0e46b1ff2d802f54/.github/workflows/release.yml#L16-L22] It is set to:  deploy to staging with merge to develop  and production on master.

*Expected result*: merge to master should deploy modules to staging. A release tag should deploy modules to production.

----

Visual example of the bug: 



A recent merge to master today (January 16) triggered this action: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/actions/runs/4198067707/jobs/7281205666|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/actions/runs/4198067707/jobs/7281205666|smart-link] 

!image-20230216-214431.png|width=1205,height=561!

Which triggered updates for modules in production: [https://app.crowdbotics.com/admin/projects/component/?is_verified__exact=1&o=-7|https://app.crowdbotics.com/admin/projects/component/?is_verified__exact=1&o=-7]

!image-20230216-214518.png|width=1819,height=914!

But not on staging:

!image-20230216-214557.png|width=1814,height=944!

column1: Screen route parameters delete button deletes the whole remaining parameters
column33:
When user try to delete the an single parameters from the Screen route parameters delete button it delete the entire parameters which were added.

Steps:-
Go the Studio
Add screen
Now Drop element on it
Now Click on the Screen details option
Click on Screen route parameters + button  4 to 5 time to add more parameters 
Now Click on the delete button
Observer 

Expected Result :-
The entire parameters  should not get deleted it should delete only one parameters. 

Video:-[https://mithilesh.hippovideo.io/video/play/DCN8oCdTMKcH4iiF6zqOlLFhvjKEORLTFKInD8wD2GM|https://mithilesh.hippovideo.io/video/play/DCN8oCdTMKcH4iiF6zqOlLFhvjKEORLTFKInD8wD2GM|smart-link]

column193:
16/Feb/23 10:57 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;Next time you create a ticket like this, can you please be more specific with both the description and the expected result? Is it really all additional component or just a specific one? If you see any console error, also attach those.

Generic tickets like this tend to either be completely ignored or drag on forever (with every single different bug related to this section but unrelated to the original cause causing the ticket to be returned).

column1: Remove Tooltip showing member email on Team Page
column33:
On the Team Page, we want to hide the email tooltip that appears above Team Member names *for clients* (or those with *owner* permissions)

[~accountid:618e6f963ae5230069229010] Can you please confirm that this is the case when you get a chance?

Specifically, *clients should not be able to see the email addresses of the service team.* They should only be interfacing with CSMs and PMs. 

!Screen Shot 2023-02-16 at 8.44.38 AM.png|width=341,height=344!
column114: As a client, I will not be able to see the email addresses of the Team in a tooltip.

column1: Text is not getting deleted from the text element box for the setting Windows
column33:
When user try to add any new Text in to the text element from the setting windows it get added, but when user try to remove the text it not get deleted and user cannot able to make the text box blank.

Steps:-
Go to studio
Add screen and Drop Text element 
Now Edit the text and 
Now Try to delete the text 
Observe

* *AI screens should be able to be cloned normally* (cloning needs to also clone some of the metadata information, like the 

{{AIStatus}}).

column1: Successfully Deploy Multi-Tenancy to a Mock Staging instance - Phase 1
column33:
h2. Goal

The goal of the ticket is to set up a mock staging instance within Heroku and successfully deploy multi-tenancy

* Start time and end time should be recorded once the sequence of events has been formalized from maintenance mode: on *to* off
* A runbook should be published on the sequence of steps to deploy

h2. Scope

The goal does *NOT* include the following:

* A runbook to roll back changes
* validation of the application and/or test plan

h2. Description and Plan Implementation [WIP]

Steps/Plan is documented here: [Notion Doc|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/django-tenants-infrastructure-and-migration-plan-92809105092b40dfbb02a14b9c1612d8?pvs=4]

h2. Acceptance Criteria:

* A runbook should be published on the sequence of steps to deploy
* Stretch: an automation script can be created if we automate the steps once we can manually do them



----

*Archive*

h3. Initial Migration Plan
# Try django-tenants suggested single-to-multiple tenant migration with Django management commands
# Try the same approach with psql, pgbackup and pgrestore
# Test schema migration plan
# Setup separate Postgres DB to test migration plan
# Determine how long the migration will take and potential roadblocks we might encounter
# Schedule production downtime
# Setup new Postgres DB for Prod
# Perform migration
# Post-migration guide
h3. Out of Scope
# Create a list of core dashboard functionalities to be tested e.g. app creation, deployment, studio, etc.
## Deployments
## Studio
## PRD
## Task Checkout
## Payment
# Create a list of external services that the dashboard uses to be tested e.g. model editor, layout editor, etc.

column193:
21/Feb/23 9:53 PM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;I was able to successfully deploy multi-tenancy to a review app: [https://cbdash-pr-4219.herokuapp.com/|https://cbdash-pr-4219.herokuapp.com/]

Notes:

# The custom data migration piece was still done manually. I am trying to figure out a way to do it in an automated way. The only issue is determining which domain to use from within the custom data migration. For this specific case, I used hardcoded values to link the {{public}} tenant to [cb.abd.dev|https://cb.abd.dev] and the {{cbdash}} tenant to [cbdash-pr-4219.herokuapp.com|http://cbdash-pr-4219.herokuapp.com]. I was thinking maybe we could infer this from environment variables where before we push the code changes and run the custom data migration, we add environment variables {{PUBLIC_SCHEMA_URL}} and {{CBDASH_SCHEMA_URL}} and then use that within the custom data migration script. What do you think? [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] 
# I need access to add domains to Heroku apps to fully test the public and tenant-specific domain routing. I don’t have access to add domains right now. CC [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] 
# Celery implementation requires tweaking. Currently, none of the celery tasks are running cause the current implementation likely refers to the public schema and can’t seem to find the appropriate tables. Further research required [https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|smart-link] CC [~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835] I know you did some research on this. Can you link that document here please? Thanks 🙂
column194:
27/Feb/23 10:26 AM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;Next steps:

# Test the custom data migration using environment variables to create the {{public}} and {{cbdash}} tenant and link them with the appropriate domains
# [~accountid:60b6618066df7900704e3a3d] will help with setting up domains and pointing them to the correct review apps
# The celery implementation will be a two-phased approach: i) revert celery tables to the public schema; ii) continue implementation of tenant-aware celery
column195: 27/Feb/23 10:30 AM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;I’ve also looped in [~accountid:63ecf71dd08a73e538f4305c] on this ticket so he can help with pt. 3ii
column196:
13/Mar/23 5:58 PM;60b681f3994185007431bb28;Known bugs / issues:

# In certain cases, e.g. Stripe webhook setup, the URL sent to Stripe is taken from {{ALLOWED_HOSTS[0]}}. This would not work as now we have multiple domains within the same instance. We need to come up with an approach to refactor this to use the correct domain dynamically for the specified tenant and domain. Stripe was the only usecase I found but I reckon there are other instances of this.

column1: change hardcoded email address in Fastfile
column33:
h3. Background

A customer raised a concern about their email address being hardcoded in the iOS fastfile: 

!Screenshot 2023-02-15 at 12.31.25 PM.png|width=573,height=38!

In this instance, the customer’s repo was public, and as a result, their email address was exposed.

h3. Proposal

To avoid this from happening again to another customer in the future, we should update the [iOS Fastfile|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/blob/master/scaffold/template/custom/ios/fastlane/Fastfile], as well as our [repository codebase|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules] to ingest this variable from CircleCI

h3. References

iOS Fastfile: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/blob/master/scaffold/template/custom/ios/fastlane/Fastfile#L120|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modules/blob/master/scaffold/template/custom/ios/fastlane/Fastfile#L120|smart-link]
column114:
# Ensure our customer’s email address is not exposed in their public (or private) project repo by eliminating the hardcoded ‘ProjectOwnerEmail’ variable in the iOS Fastfile, and instead, pull it in from CircleCI to protect our customer’s personal information.
# Apply these same changes (in principle) to the Android Fastfile as needed in order to achieve the same results for our intended purpose in eliminating the hardcoded value, and instead, taking it in from CircleCI to protect our customer’s personal information.

column1: SPIKE Investigate if api-spec job can run if the app is not deployed
column33:
We were receiving many errors about updating the API spec and they were related to the overlapping of the actions. We remove those logs because they were not needed. 
The goal of this spike is to check if the error could also come when the api_spec action is called, but the app is not deployed.
If this is the case, we should figure out a solution.
column114: In case of the hypothesis is true, the Spike should have a possible solution.

column1: Fix 2FA text!
column33:
So confusing. For 2FA in sign-in, the text currently reads something like “Please enter the 6-digit authentication code generated by the app”

This is so confusing, because in reality, it’s being generated by the Google Authenticator app (not Crowdbotics). Text should read:


*Please enter the 6-digit authentication code generated by your Google Authenticator app*
column114:
* For 2FA sign-in, the descriptor text will read: *Please enter the 6-digit authentication code generated by your Google Authenticator app*
* Confirm that we are still using Google Authenticator app for this

column1: Return the Action results to Crowbotics-Slack-App endpoint ( modelbuilder-lambda)
column33:
The {{modelbuilder-lambda}} would make a *POST* request when the action has finished with the result.
The action’s results should be sent to the {{crowdbotics-slack-app}} new endpoint. 
The actions have to run async on the lambda server to return the success/failure response quickly, and then post the result when it is finished.
Payload example:

{code:javascript}{
	"action": "routes",
	"app": 1857,
	"results": { #results },
}
{code}

h3. Acceptance Criteria:

* A new env-var token should be added. 
* Triggering an Action should work as it does now, but the result should be sent {{crowdbotics-slack-app}} alongside some extra data.

column1: Create a new endpoint to communicate between apps. ( Crowdbotics-Slack-App )
column33:
Create a new secured endpoint where the {{modelbuilder-lambda}} will send the results of the actions ( when needed ). i.e {{/api/v2/studio/model-builder-endpoint/}} Payload example:

{code:javascript}{
	"action": "routes",
	"app": 1857,
	"results": { #results },
}
{code}

h3. *Acceptance Criteria:*


 - The endpoint must have an access token to validate the request.
 - The endpoint should handle the request from all the actions ( i.e for the {{api_spec}} action, it should populate the {{api_spec_storage}} field of that app ) → in the future we will probably need to mix it with the action queues too. 
- The action {{api_spec}} triggers a WebSocket to the Frontend.

column1: Make ModelBuilder-lambda async
column33:
Motivation:

 Right now, we are consuming extra resources (celery workers) when calling it. For example, for one action we are taking one worker for 5 minutes, and waiting for the response. However, we can avoid keeping the worker out by making the call async: we give the {{modelbuilder-lambda}} the ability to populate data under the {{crowdbotics-slack-app}} . This change will need updates in both Apps, since we need to create a secure communication way between them ( and the actions from {{modelbuilder-lambda }}will post the result there.
column114:
* {{Crowdbotics-slack-app}} should be able to receive data from {{modelbuilder-lambda}}.
* The new endpoint should be secured with a token.
* Calling the{{ modelbuilder-lambda}} server should not use extra resources.

column1: App icon in App store connect is getting saved with 2 app icons after giving error message
column33:
Description-

# Open the [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/]
# Login with your credentials
# Create a new app
# Upgrade the plan
# Click on App store connect in settings
# In app icon section, crop the default image and upload new one without deleting the default one
# The cropped image will appear in App icon section
# Fill other information of App store connect
# Click on save ( Error message will come “App icon already exist please delete before uploading new one”)
# Again click on save ( It gets saved)

Actual Result- When we save for first time it shows “ App icon already exist please delete before uploading new one” and when we again save it , it gets saved

Expected Result- 

# When there should be two images in App icon and when we are saving it Error toast message  should be correct i.e Maximum one image can be uploaded in App icon
# It should not get saved after second click.

Video for Reference- [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cXCFDLxfrzk2oR2LmROstQTYFvMEMS0B/view|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cXCFDLxfrzk2oR2LmROstQTYFvMEMS0B/view|smart-link]

column1: SPIKE: BOT Coverage: Display & Graph
column33:
The task is product-focused, emphasizing viewing trends within the data.

The goal is to provide a dashboard for Senior Leadership, Product Managers and the Sales Team to consume, providing lead metrics on the BOT coverage OKR. Listed below is the breakdown of screens and their usage. UI Mockups will be provided at a later date.

h2. *Dashboard*

* *Has the capability to change the period of time from [past 7 days, past 30 days, past 90 days, YTD, Average Month-over-Month, Average YoY]*
* *Provides the date of the latest scan → Last Week = previous 7 days*
** _NOTE: the start of the week is Sunday at 12:00am PST & the end of the week is Saturday at 11:59pm PST_
* *Provide a searchable list of projects by name with a filter based on subscription plan type (i.e. Community, Pro, Advanced, Enterprise)*
* *Provides a bar chart representing the number of repositories being managed by the CB platform on the primary axis, as well as a line graph of the total Lines of Code (“LOC”) on the secondary axis.*
** Ex.: 
!image-20230215-162005.png|width=1690,height=990!



* *Provide a chart of the breakdown of LOC per category [Scaffolding, Deployer, Layout, API, Other]*
** +_Optional_+ _→ (nested doughnut chart) → the inner most ring represents the average based on the time-series period selected (i.e. Weekly Average, Monthly Average, etc.) & the outermost ring represents the most recent time-series data (i.e. Last Week, Last Month. etc.) in order to show the change between the breakdown of LOC per category as compared to the average over time._
*** _Ex.:_ 
!image-20230215-163509.png|width=225,height=224!
+_Optional_+ _→ A filter capable of changing the time-series data displayed in the LOC per category chart_



* *Provide a graph of trends for the categories and percentage of automated code vs human-generated code.*
** +_Optional_+ _→ tooltip displayed when hovering over a section of the nested doughnut chart that breaks down a specific category into human vs machine-generated code._
*** _Ex.:_ 
!image-20230215-164043.png|width=536,height=542,href="https://playfairdata.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Expanding-Donut_GIF.1.gif"!

h3. +_Optional_+

*Per-Project Dashboard*

* Same capabilities as the common dashboard but specific to a project

*Per-Private / Per-Public Dashboard*

* Same capabilities as the common dashboard but specific to a project
column114:
h3. PART 1 (CORE)  *|  3-5 points*

* Manually calculate the current Bot Coverage metric across a random sample of paid customer projects (~1% the total number of paid projects) from the previous year.
** Ensure that all projects within the random sample have an approved PRD & task checkout completed

h3. PART 2  *|  3-5 points*

# Automate the manually derivation in PART 1
# Determine whether Graphana has the capability of visualizing the Bot Coverage metric in the various ways we’ve outlined above, and if not, propose alternate visualization SaaS tools we should use for our intended purposes in terms of value provided & monthly cost.

column196:
14/Mar/23 7:52 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;(/) Has the capability to change the period of time from [past 7 days, past 30 days, past 90 days, YTD, Average Month-over-Month, Average YoY]

Date can be filtered based three values, {{summary.scan_date}},  {{summary.created_on}}, {{summary.latest_proj_update}}, {{summary.latest_push}} - opensearch is index based upon {{summary.latest_push}} as this is the most relevant metric. You can use the date range picker to fulfill this requirement

❌ Provide a searchable list of projects by name with a filter based on subscription plan type (i.e. Community, Pro, Advanced, Enterprise)

Currently, the scan has no notion of pricing tiers as it has no access to the production database. We can pull this data but for this iteration it is not available

(/) Provides a bar chart representing the number of repositories being managed by the CB platform on the primary axis, as well as a line graph of the total Lines of Code (“LOC”) on the secondary axis.

It’s a line chart, and it is interactable

!image-20230314-144855.png|width=973,height=446!



(/) Provide a chart of the breakdown of LOC per category [Scaffolding, Deployer, Layout, API, Other]

You can use the time based project dashboard: [https://search-crowdbotics-dev-u5zedbyy53hnoj7nfd7sd4yalm.us-east-2.es.amazonaws.com/_dashboards/app/dashboards#/view/636158d0-c25b-11ed-9be8-8f029420fe14?_g=(filters:\!(),refreshInterval:(pause:\!t,value:0),time:(from:now-1M,to:now))&_a=(description:'The time is based upon the push date (date of last modified within Github) for the project',filters:\!(),fullScreenMode:\!f,options:(hidePanelTitles:\!f,useMargins:\!t),query:(language:kuery,query:''),timeRestore:!f,title:'Time Based Project Summary',viewMode:view)|https://search-crowdbotics-dev-u5zedbyy53hnoj7nfd7sd4yalm.us-east-2.es.amazonaws.com/_dashboards/app/dashboards#/view/636158d0-c25b-11ed-9be8-8f029420fe14?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:now-1M,to:now))&_a=(description:'The%20time%20is%20based%20upon%20the%20push%20date%20(date%20of%20last%20modified%20within%20Github)%20for%20the%20project',filters:!(),fullScreenMode:!f,options:(hidePanelTitles:!f,useMargins:!t),query:(language:kuery,query:''),timeRestore:!f,title:'Time%20Based%20Project%20Summary',viewMode:view)]

Use the DQL to filter per project, set the date picker based upon the push date (usually relative to 1 month)

 

!image-20230314-145108.png|width=1792,height=768!

❌ Provide a graph of trends for the categories and percentage of automated code vs human-generated code.



(/) Per-Project Dashboard

same as above, use the time based project summary



❌ Per-Private / Per-Public Dashboard

We do not need to scan public repositories, this is not in scope anymore

column1: Spike: Look into data issues
column33:
Taken from [Eduardo’s spike on COGS measurement|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/PLAT-10019-Spike-Implement-COGS-measurement-feature-5cca6fb8916148cd90a8f3aea2cf1cf9].

* We have many tasks that are not in {{todo}} (i.e.: {{done}}, {{doing}}, etc) that have a {{hours_estimated}} greater than 0 but the {{assignee}} is null. I'm unsure of how this is possible, but it's happening. We need to investigate this.
** I suspect that this is happening because of manual changes via the admin panel. We should prevent this from happening.
** If this is related to manual changes. We need to understand why this is needed.
** Some tasks in production on this situation: 462424, 384916, 374166, 374163, 374154, 364026
column114: Ensure that we understand why tasks have hours_estimated greater than 0 but assignee is null. This will affect our ability to accurately measure costs in a detailed way moving forward.

column1: Docker installation not working properly on ModelBuilder-lambda
column33:
I’ve noticed a few issues with the new docker installation of the ModelBuilder-lambda app.

The first problem was that a library wasn’t installed on the docker build. That was blocking all the requests to the app. Then I realized that any of the libraries on the PipFile was installed on the docker build.

As a workaround , we can run {{pipenv install -r requirements.txt}} under an app’s bash. But that has to be done every time we start the server, so we need to investigate how we can add a permanent fix.


*NOTE:* This is only happening locally. At least for me, running Docker in MAC with an M1 chip.

column1: Implement COGS measurement v1
column33:
*Description:*

This is the first iteration of COGS measurement, which *closely* follows [Eduardo’s spike|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/PLAT-10019-Spike-Implement-COGS-measurement-feature-5cca6fb8916148cd90a8f3aea2cf1cf9] into this topic. If Eduardo doesn’t end up doing this himself, then I suggest you reach out to him!

*Data needed to calculate COGS:*

* The assignee
** We have a relationship between the {{Task}} model and the {{TeamMemberRole}} model through the {{assigneed_to}} field
* Charge rate of the assignee
** Located in the {{TeamMemberRole}} model as {{charge_rate}} and on the {{ProjectMemberRole}} model as {{charge_rate}}
** We first try to get the charge rate from the {{ProjectMemberRole}} model, and if it's not there we get it from the {{TeamMemberRole}} model
** Currently, we don't have a way to track the charge rate at the time the task was started, we only have the current/latest charge rate (see below)
* The task hours
** Located in the {{Task}} model as {{hours_estimated}}



*For this first version:*

* Only calculate the "actual" COGS
* Only calculate the COGS for tasks that have an assignee
* Use the current/latest charge rate to calculate the COGS, even if the task was started with a different charge rate
* *Show* COGS in admin panel
* Include a base hosting cost of $23/month for every app deployed to Heroku


Closely following [Eduardo’s spike|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/PLAT-10019-Spike-Implement-COGS-measurement-feature-5cca6fb8916148cd90a8f3aea2cf1cf9] on this topic.
column114:
* COGS for any given project will appear in the admin panel; COGS will be calculated according to the above methodology that [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] outlined
* Be sure to include a base hosting cost of $23/month for every app deployed to Heroku
