column1: Metric Snapshot
column33: Epic to regarding the various metrics we want to measure & show in various parts of the dashboard. For example, COGS and % of app complete!

column1: Show total workload for service team
column33:
*Description:* we want to be able to show the workload currently assigned to any given team member. The purpose of this is to help us & PMs make better hiring decisions— contractors will rarely say “no” to a project, even if they have a large pile of other active commitments. Therefore, we want some data to help show this information and prevent excessive workload for contractors (which can lead to delays, overall poor performance).



*Implementation:* On the detail page, we want to show the total number of active projects that a team member is assigned to, and, eventually, the % complete of those projects as well. This information will populate on the Profile View as discussed. For now, develop the backend capability to show both values for any given team member: total active assigned projects

*Next Steps:* Provide measurement to show %complete of each project (and see, therefore, the %complete of active projects that contractors have)
column114:
We will have the ability to show, for any given team member: Total active assigned projects

This information will then populate for any given team member on the [profile view|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10306] as described

column1: Incorporate Ranking UI on Team Page
column33:
*Description:* we want to incorporate a feature where service team members can rank one another. This feature will help CB manage talent, evaluate performance history, and make better decisions regarding hiring, team selection, and overall community development.

*Implementation:* We already have the front-end and back-end set up from the hiring flow (see screenshots). We simply want to show this on the Team page. In agile methodology, we want to move small & quickly. Copy this code onto the Team Page.

*Note:* We are holding off on exactly how we want to prompt PMs to rate service team, given that we seem to be switching to an agile methodology for teams and away from current milestone breakdown. I will get more clarity & we’ll update this further.

*Note:* show only to internal team, do be discussed regarding permissions
column114:
# The FE/BE code for the hiring flow will be added to the profile view of Team Page.
!Detail View example.png|width=1146,height=539!

2. Use the UI on this mock up (or same UI as currently exists in hiring flow) to show performance history for any given team member

column1: Create "Profile View" for service team
column33:
*Description:* we want to be able to have a more detailed “profile view” for any individual service team member on the Team page. This “profile view” will only apply to service team members, including PMs. The purpose is to show more information about contractors that is important to Crowdbotics, but too specific to show on the main Team Page view.

*Implementation:* See screenshot that will serve as a rough mock up. I’m going to be working w/ Curtis to align on exactly how and what we want to show, but this mock up should do a decent-enough job of conveying the version 1. We want to show:

* Total active projects that team member is assigned to, with links to dashboard (and, eventually, % complete of those projects)
* Cumulative historical performance ratings (and, eventually, an aggregate list of individual ratings/comments)

*Permissions:* only internal users, to be confirmed
column114:
Create v1 UI for “Profile View” of team members. Show, at a minimum:

# Name, user, profile pic (as seen in mock up)
# Create this view on top of which we will add further information from other tickets in this epic

column1: Team Page enhancements v2
column33: Second round of Team Page improvements!

column1: Proposal Tab / Wishlist bulk selection
column33:
*Description:* This is specifically focusing on the *Proposal* tab of the Task page. Right now, our BAs/sales folks have to *_manually_* drag & drop each task from the Proposal tab down into wish list. This takes forever, and b/c they are unable to move milestones as a whole, it becomes hard to track. We want to make it easier by: 1) allowing users to move milestones as a whole into wishlist, and 2) adding UI functionality to move items in bulk more easily 

*Implementation:*

The Wishlist section will have two buckets:

# Milestones can be moved directly into wishlist, and will appear as milestones
# Individual Tasks can still be moved to milestones, but will be grouped under a bucket called “Wishlist Tasks”. That way, we keep the same functionality as before and sales teams have flexibility with what they want to move. 

Back-End:

[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] Based on our discussion, can you please detail the BE requirements needed to move milestones into wishlist, and also create a separate “milestone bucket” for individual tasks moved to wishlist? We also may want to consider any implications for moving items *out* of wishlist, and back into Proposal or PRD? I’m not sure exactly the implications but [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] highlighted this. Please advise!

Front-End:

[~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] I would like to sync on any suggestion for UI that will allow “bulk selection” of items from Proposal into Wishlist! After aligning on a direction I’ll scope out the details. My idea was something like [this|https://dribbble.com/shots/15449715-CRM-Mac-Application], but I’ve heard some pushback for better alternatives which I would love to hear.



cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] 

!Screen Shot 2023-03-01 at 11.22.24 AM.png|width=686,height=646!
column114:
# Users will be able to move milestones into Wishlist directly as a group
# Users will be able to move individual Tasks into Wishlist, where they will all appear under a “Wishlist Tasks” Milestone
# If an entire milestone is moved to wishlist, its children tasks will also move over and appear beneath the milestone. 
# Users will have the ability to move items in bulk from Proposal to Wishlist, and also from Wishlist to Proposal

column1: SPIKE: CI/CD pipeline providers
column33:
Given that CircleCI does not currently support integrations with GitLab self-managed instances, we must evaluate alternate CI/CD pipeline providers in order to determine if we should switch to the selected CI/CD pipeline provider, based on whether they support integrations with GitLab self-managed instances, in addition to all services we currently use CircleCI for.

h3. Requirements (initial pre-screening in order to be included in the final list of alternates)

* MacOS servers
* iOS/Android support
* React Native support
* GitLab self-managed integration
* Environment variable customization
* Job batching
* Audit logs

h3. Reference

[https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/CI-CD-pipeline-providers-78efef0e32e345b39caeb06b2eac983e?pvs=4|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/CI-CD-pipeline-providers-78efef0e32e345b39caeb06b2eac983e?pvs=4]
column114:
+*Propose a list of CI/CD pipeline providers we should consider switching to, based on the following criteria:*+

# *Requirements* (mentioned above)
# *Services* (compared to CircleCI)
## Final list of proposed alternates must all offer the same services/functionality we currently use CircleCI for
## Key advantages in comparison to CircleCI
### Is the alternate CI/CD pipeline provider “future-proof” in the sense that new features/functionality we intend to build in the future is taken into account.
# *Price*
## Is the alternate provider more or less expensive than CircleCI?
column193:
28/Mar/23 9:23 AM;60a2b6488cbda700689ac692;||Feature||GitLab CI/CD||CircleCI||
|Integration with Git|Built into GitLab platform, tight integration with Git repositories|Integrates with GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab repositories|
|Flexibility and Customization|Highly flexible and customizable with support for parallel jobs, conditional builds, and deployment to multiple environments|Easy to use and set up, but may not offer as much flexibility as GitLab CI/CD|
|Pricing|Available for free as an open-source tool, paid plans available for larger organizations|Free plan with limited build minutes, paid plans based on concurrent builds and users|
|Community and Support|Large and active community of developers, paid support plans available for enterprise users|Active community of developers, support available through email, forums, and chat channels, paid support plans available for enterprise users|
|Platform Support|Supports Linux, macOS, and Windows build environments, as well as Docker containers|Supports Linux, macOS, and Windows build environments, as well as Docker containers|
|Security|Built-in security features such as vulnerability scanning and secure credentials management|Offers a vulnerability scanner and the ability to integrate with third-party security tools|
|User Interface|User-friendly web-based interface with a visual pipeline editor, real-time logs, and detailed metrics and analytics|Simple and intuitive interface with real-time logs, detailed analytics, and integrations with popular messaging tools like Slack|
|Scalability|Highly scalable with auto-scaling capabilities|Highly scalable, may require additional configuration and optimization for larger projects|
|Integration Ecosystem|Offers a wide range of integrations with other tools and platforms, extensive library of third-party plugins and extensions|Supports many popular tools and platforms, large library of plugins and extensions|
|Workflow Management|Powerful workflow management system with features like merge request pipelines, environments, and approvals|Supports workflow management, may require additional configuration and customization for more complex workflows|


Based on pricing and native integration with gitlab, preferred alternative should be gitlab CI/CD (using native gitlab runners).
column194:
29/Mar/23 9:22 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] I’ve to review the output of this ticket but it doesn’t address the ultimate need, I think a tighter scope is needed if we are to move forward with the next generation of this spike/evaluation of other CI/CD providers. The description that [~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692] has to provide is good but doesn’t answer the question, should we put in the effort to switch to GitLabs CI/CD pipeline? (which is a significant lift). I don’t have enough data to definitively answer that question



My recommendation moving forward is to:

# update the notion document with Shashank’s findings
# If we want to put effort into this evaluation, create a more focused ticket

column1: SPIKE: BOT Coverage: Batch & Storage
column33:
The task is infrastructure and access control related. 

*The goal:*

* Provide infrastructure that runs periodically from a given code repository (main)
* Provide a database that can hold time series data (Prometheus & two other possible DBs)
* Provide tooling to query that time series data and graph that data based on a query
* Provide access control so the DevOps and Management teams are the only ones that can access the database
* Provide access control so that only Crowdbotics employees can access the tool for displaying the results
* Data pushing to these endpoints MUST have SSL (self-signed) as no customer/company should be sent over the internet unencrypted



*Note:*

The management and DevOps teams are changing at a constant basis, it is out of scope for this spike, but onboarding and off-boarding should be considered in this design
column114:
A Proof of Concept MUST be created that fulfills the requirements above, periodic runner, time series database and display and access control.

*OUT OF SCOPE*

* The infrastructure can be hand rolled with the intention of automating the deployment at a later time.
* The access control can be hand rolled with the intention of automating access (onboarding/offboarding) at a later time.
* The database does NOT need backup and snapshotting and can be automated at a later time.
* The database does NOT need encryption (at rest) but MUST be considered when taken to production

*MUST*

* Cost MUST be considered when considering the time series database and display tool, the cost of either a cloud solution or the cost of maintaining the infrastructure internally if there is consideration of a paid solution or an internally managed solution.
* Access to the database and display must adhere to the above requirements (database access, display/tool access)

column200:
23/Feb/23 10:16 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;An update: I was looking at the cost of setting up the infrastructure, and I think for POC, we can use AWS managed Prometheus which has a free tier.

column201:
28/Feb/23 6:47 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;AMP (AWS managed Prometheus) and Grafana infra setup is complete. Setup has been done using terraform. The other remaining part of the infrastructure here is the Pushgateway.
The main challenge here is that AMP, is by default used to monitor EKS cluster and/or ECS clusters.

Here configuring the default {{prometheus.yml}} file in which we can define the {{scrape_configs}} and use it to configure our Pushgateway as a scraping source, has become a bit of a challenge since there is no clear documentation on how to do that.

With this in mind, We have several options to choose from:

#  Setting up a K8s cluster. 
# Setting up an ECS cluster 
# Deploy Prometheus as a standalone and not a managed service- Makes custom configuration easy.

This way, by default AMP will collect all the metrics from the container services, including our pushgateway, that run on AWS infra.

column1: SPIKE: BOT Coverage: Scraping Metadata
column33:
The task is backend/software-focused. The goal is to create a runner application that can access Crowdbotics customer private repositories and extract metrics/features from that repository to be inserted into a [time series database.|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10301]



{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
IMPORTANT: 

* Care must be taken to determine code that deviates from the templated autogenerated code from the Crowdbotics platform.
* Care must be taken to determine the category of the code
** Categories are: *_Scaffolding, Deployer, Layout and API_*

*This determination will be scrutinized the MOST*
{panel}



*The goal:*

* Propose a framework and libraries as the basis of the runner (it doesn’t have to be Python/Django, but note the language and framework proficiencies of other employees within the company)
* The runner MUST have access to private CB repositories being maintained with the CB platform
* The runner MUST have access to future Enterprise repositories
* The runner MUST determine if code changes are from CB or custom work
* The runner MUST determine if code changes fall under the 4 different categories or OTHER
* The runner MUST extract these features (there could be others) from the repository
** Total LOC
** Date of Scan (UTC)
** Total LOC / per category / that is custom
** Total LOC / per category / that falls under the 4 categories
** Is Repository Public



*Additional Requirements:*

* Propose a data format to be used to be inserted into the time series database listed in this [ticket|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10301].
* Prioritization will be given to libraries that do NOT access the GitHub API (due to existing rate limiting issues)
* *_Based upon the access mechanism (GitHub App), our CB legal disclaimer must allow for these permissions and the collection and usage of data. If the legal text does now allow collection, access and applied analytics to private repository data, further actions must be taken to scope out the legal updating of text_*
column114:
A Proof of Concept MUST be created that fulfills the requirements above, runner, categorization, deviation determination, access

*OUT OF SCOPE*

* Runner code can hand code credentials into the running application for the time being (do NOT commit into the repo)
* Scraping run times per committed changed LOC does NOT have to be measured, but running times per 100K lines of code should be considered

*MUST*

* Consideration MUST be given to the activeness, robustness and licensing of the library package being used to access the repository.
* The runner must be able to date and insert entries into the time series database.

Basically, the final solution which we should be very close to (given this epic is almost complete) is: 
1) The *In Progress* column will list tasks in Progress for any given team member

2) If there are too many tasks to list in the limited space, then the *tooltip* will list the complete list of tasks in Progress for that Team Member

3) The Tasks that are listed will exist as a hyperlink that will take the user to those tasks in the *In Development* tab.

column1: Internal connection is not getting visible while refreshing studio
column33:
When user add some element on to the added screen and make them pressable and save the studio, then user try to refresh the page the connect should remains same without any error.

Steps :-
Go to studio
Add a 2-3 screen on canvas
Add Elements on it and make them pressable
Now connect the screen with  the element
Save the screen
Now Refresh the screen
Observe 

Expected Result:-

column1: Removing social account could cause flooding of Sentry
column33:
*Problem*

See Sentry Logs for more details:

[https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/share/issue/78cbe04d649243a9bbf2e3d7509bd54f/|https://crowdbotics-corporation.sentry.io/share/issue/78cbe04d649243a9bbf2e3d7509bd54f/|smart-link] 

The JSON dump of the records has been attached to this Jira Ticket

Steps to reproduce are still getting iron out by the QA however, the logic goes 

{noformat}def on_social_account_removed(sender, **kwargs):
    social_account = kwargs.get("socialaccount")
    if social_account and social_account.provider == "github":
        detach_all_github_projects.delay(
            social_account.extra_data["email"], social_account.extra_data["login"]
        )
        
------
@shared_task(queue="low")
def detach_all_github_projects(email: str, github_username: str):
    TeamMemberRole = apps.get_model("cb_slack", "TeamMemberRole")
    GithubRepo = apps.get_model("crowdbotics", "GithubRepo")

    member = TeamMemberRole.objects.filter(email=email).first()
    if member is None:
        return

    projects = GithubRepo.objects.filter(
        Q(owner=member) | Q(members__in=[member])
    ).distinct()

    for project in projects:
        if not project.is_imported:
            remove_github_invitation_or_collaborator(project, github_username){noformat}



Here it loops through all projects and calls remove_github_invitation_or_collaborator however it does not check for errors.

This could potentially loop through all the projects (thousands) and log errors for every failed API request



*Possible Solutions:*

* We need a way to detect errors and stop
* Potentially provide some type of exponential backoff
* Query Github to see if the operation we are doing, in this case a DELETE will be successful on that specific user

column1: SPIKE: Investigate Babel internal state updates after code transformation
column33:
After code transformations done to codegen {{node}}, its internal state is no longer reliable for inferring information. This spike is to investigate (and possibly implement a fix for that).

Here is an example: [https://astexplorer.net/#/gist/70492bd9c80bd9c9c40aecff2572c5fd/71e1ea770e2a075545dccad5c230d36f9f2f728e|https://astexplorer.net/#/gist/70492bd9c80bd9c9c40aecff2572c5fd/71e1ea770e2a075545dccad5c230d36f9f2f728e|smart-link] 

!image-20230213-164639.png|width=1837,height=976!

In the example, after adding {{newVariable}}, the available “bindings” for the function scope is not updated.

This is a documented, unsupported feature. A suggested approach is to forcefully update the scope bindings: [https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/8358#issuecomment-406801192|https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/8358#issuecomment-406801192|smart-link] 

This spike will:

# Verify if there is no better way of updating all of the changed node state
# If there is a better way, write a report or implement solution (depends on the estimated effort)
# If there is no better way, document a strategy or directly implement the “official suggested workaround” for ALL visitors that interferes with scope (anything that adds or remove a node)
##  revert any {{buildFileAST}} from the chain checkpoint (checkpoint must solely clone the original node)



(description might change)
column193:
28/Mar/23 8:11 AM;5afc9b4315546e06f95320e2;There’s two ways that I know of on how to deal with this issue:
- everytime you create a new binding explicitly register it with the {{registerBinding}} api.
- re-crawl the scope with the {{path.scope.crawl()}} helper, so that the scope bindings get regenerated

The first option should be preferred and the second is more of a fallback technique. It will be hard to guarantee that all of our codegen visitors and actions are respecting the need for calling {{registerBinding}}. I will think a bit more about this.

We have examples of the second option in our codebase already.

column1: SPIKE: RN Web scaffolding update (automated test script)
column33:
We need to update the RN scaffolding for legacy apps to be able to use the new automated RN Web deployment pipeline

However, it is difficult to manually test all randomly selected apps from the sample group & subscription plan subsets therein.

Therefore, we must come up with an automated test plan to ensure we can test a larger sample group without having to manually test each individual app once the scaffolding update is implemented in that specific project repo
column114:
+*Create an automated test plan that defines:*+

# How we will randomly select a sample group of apps from all subscription plan levels large and diverse enough to ensure that once the RN Web scaffolding update is applied, we can confidently predict that any project will retain all core functionality and will work as expected prior to the update.
# Define the test script we will use to address (1)
# Propose how we can leverage this automated test plan process for other future scaffolding updates.

column1: Polishing New and Existing Studio UI

column1: Normalize release workflow of all lambda functions
column33:
We currently have 3 lambda functions:

# Layout Editor: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor|smart-link] → uses CircleCI
# Dependency runner: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/dependency-runner|https://github.com/crowdbotics/dependency-runner|smart-link] 
# Model Builder: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/modelbuilder-lambda|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modelbuilder-lambda|smart-link] → uses GitHub Actions

The goal is to normalize the release process for all of them.
column114:
They should all:

* Deploy to staging on merge to main/master
* Deploy to production with a release tag
* Document on README how to trigger a production deployment
* Ensure main/master is protected (they probably already are)
* Make the default visible branch the main/master (dependency-runner, for example, is develop today, but model builder is main)
** This means that new PRs , new git clones will automatically point to main/master.

column1: SPIKE: Investigate reliability of model builder
column33:
*Motivation*: Today, there are a variety of issues with the model builder service, mostly related to how unreliable it can be

*  if the backend sends the exact same request to the model builder (same app, same input values) the model builder will attempt to run twice and might fail for one or both. 
* If we send 2+ different requests for the same app at the sametime (e.g. one for {{open_api}} spec and one for {{model_parser}}) , they could also fail.

Here is a hypothesis: 

# User A requests an open_api spec update for the app X
# User B, 10 seconds later, also request the same update for the app X
# Backend send two identical lambda requests
# The first request starts cloning and installing Pipfile into the {{/tmp/app-X/}}
# The second request attempts to do the same; depending on the stage of request 1, request 2 might fail with {{Command 'cd /tmp/crowdbotics-apps/petsapp-aline-38494/backend && unset DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE && PIPENV_VENV_IN_PROJECT=1 PIPENV_CACHE_DIR=/tmp/cache/pip PIPENV_DONT_LOAD_ENV=1 python -m pipenv install --ignore-pipfile --python=/usr/local/bin/python --site-packages' returned non-zero exit status 1}} or similar errors.

----

The goal of this SPIKE is to investigate and confirm the hypothesis, and propose changes to the current model builder behavior.

# How we can  make the requests idempotent and exclusive? (different requests to the same app should work concurrently)
## How does the proposed solution affect performance?
# Should we reject similar requests and only gracefully “fail“, returning information that the request is already being processed? (2 requests for the same operation on the same app). This is done in the dependency-runner, for example: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/dependency-runner/blob/a64010747192aacc3218d7302d64815818a1eb67/src/index.js#L70-L76|https://github.com/crowdbotics/dependency-runner/blob/a64010747192aacc3218d7302d64815818a1eb67/src/index.js#L70-L76]
## If not, what are the alternatives?
# (optional) Research a mechanism to clean up the lambda filesystem periodically
column114: A report answering the questions proposed above. Report must include proposed solution(s), with pros and cons, if necessary

column1: PRD url is broken for some of the Finalize with an expert event sent to Segment and Hubpsot
column33:
We noticed ~ 5 - 10 PRD urls had broken links on Hubspot for the Finalize with an Expert event. See examples PRD urls that are broken:

* [+https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38792//dashboard/app/38792/tasks?tab=PRD+|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38792//dashboard/app/38792/tasks?tab=PRD]
* [https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38702//dashboard/app/38702/tasks?tab=PRD|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38702//dashboard/app/38702/tasks?tab=PRD]

When we try to click on the above links we get a 404 in CB dashboard.

If we type the url manually to correct it (e.g. [https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38792/tasks?tab=PRD|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38792/tasks?tab=PRD]) - then we can see the app.

Why are we getting broken urls for some of the projects where “Finalize with an Expert” event was triggered? 

__________

To investigate if there was an issue with PRD urls on Segment, John Bender did the following:

He created a new account with Segment open in a second window. He saw the Free User Account Creation event fire when he created it, as well as an Identify event for the test email he was using. 

Then he selected a template, but no corresponding event fired in Segment. 

Then he clicked Finalize with an Expert, but no corresponding event fired in Segment. 

When he looked in HubSpot, all of the details were populated on the record for my new test account. 

So, at some point, Segment did its job. But he did not see the live firing of the events, which made it impossible to intercept the PRD URL to see what might be wrong with it.

Here are the questions that John B has:

* Why I see the Account Creation and Identify events fire in the Segment live feed, but not the App Template Selected or Finalize with an Expert events?
* Why does Segment show that the App Template Selected event (screenshot below) and the Finalize with an Expert event fired, but only seems to show that email is getting populated as a field?
* Why does the data seem to reach HubSpot successfully, _with the exception of_…
* The PRD link — why is this broken only sometimes?

!Screen Shot 2023-02-09 at 1.28.32 PM.png|width=1172,height=467!

column1: BE
column33:
In Bulk Update Subtask endpoint:

* Can set *Assignee* from bulk update given that all selected task status must be In {{Todo}} and must be un assigned. 
If all selected task is in {{Todo}} then we can un assign the *Assignee*. 
* Can change status from bulk update endpoint for selected subtask, the status change should be sequential like from {{Todo}} → {{In-progress}} → {{Testing}}  
All the selected subtask status should be in same state so it would be consistent to update on Backend.

column1: Refine "Assignee" and "Status" columns
column33:
These two columns are grouped together because they both a) already function correctly and b) will have the same changes.

# Ensure next column *Assignee* functions correctly
## In this column, user will see the respective assigned team members for any given milestone, task, or subtask-- same as current “in development” tab
## Above column title *Assignee,* replace “Assignee” dropdown button with “Select View” button
### “Select View” button will have same functionality —> will open a dropdown where users can select from all service Team Members assigned to the project
### If user selects, for example, “Dave Olund”, then the milestones/tasks/subtasks will update to *only show the milestones/tasks/subtasks* that Dave is assigned to. Users can select as many team members as they wish to view at once.
# Adjust *Status* column
## Status column will correctly list the status of any particular milestone/task/subtask. This should already be working correctly.
## Above column title *Status,* replace “Status” dropdown button with “Select View” button
### “Select View” button will have same functionality —> will open dropdown where users can select from each type of status:
#### To Do, In Progress, Testing, Done
### Whatever status options are selected from dropdown will populate in table below



!Bulk Updates super rough mock up.HEIC|width=1280,height=960!
column114:
Both Assignee & Status columns will correctly populate the correct assigned team member & status for every corresponding milestone, task, and subtask. 

Above both column titles will appear a button that reads “Select View”. Clicking on select view will prompt a drop-down menu listing all of the available a) assignable team members or b) status options. When any option is selected from the above “Select View” button, the Bulk Updates table will correspondingly show *only* the milestones/tasks/subtasks for those selected options.

column1: Prepare Error Message
column33:
*Context:* There are times when the user will not be able to perform a bulk update due to contradictions with our existing logic in task page. In these instances, we want to be prepared by storing a notification bank of respective messages that educate the user on why they were not able to perform a specific bulk update. So far, we are only aware of one use case, which we will prepare for:

# *Use Case/logic*: A user is unable to change the scheduled delivery date of a milestone/task/subtask until that milestone/task/subtask is in the status “To Do”.
# *Problem:* If a user tries to change scheduled delivery date for any tasks that do not have “To Do” status, they will fail and receive error message
# *Solution:* Our error notification will explain why they can’t do this, and teach them how to use the platform correctly. Specifically, this error message will read: “Bulk updates cannot be performed for milestones/tasks/subtasks that do not have “To Do” status. To change the delivery date of selected tasks, please first move them to the “To Do” status.”
# This way, users will not bother support with questions when they think the Bulk Update feature isn’t working correctly.
column114:
For the situation in which a user tries to perform a bulk update *changing the scheduled delivery date* but is unable to do so because the status of one or more tasks is not “To Do”, then our error message will show the following message: 

“Bulk updates cannot be performed for milestones/tasks/subtasks that do not have “To Do” status. To change the delivery date of selected tasks, please first move them to the “To Do” status”

column1: Include confirmation pop-up after clicking “Bulk Update”
column33:
Include confirmation pop-up after clicking “Bulk Update”

# Pop up will read: *This will apply the selected changes to every milestone, task, or subtask you have chosen. Do you wish to continue?*
# With two options below:
## Yes (emphasized as main choice)
### When selected, close pop up & flash notification “Bulk Update successful”
## Go Back
### When selected, close pop up and return to previous view that user was editing
column114:
* When a user clicks on *Bulk Update* button, to implement a bulk update, a confirmation pop up will appear. 
* Pop up will read: *This will apply the selected changes to every milestone, task, or subtask you have chosen. Do you wish to continue?*
** With two options below:
*** Yes (emphasized as main choice)
**** When selected, close pop up & flash notification “Bulk Update successful”
*** Go Back
**** When selected, close pop up and return to previous view that user was editing

{quote}This will apply the selected changes to every milestone, task, or subtask you have chosen. Do you wish to continue?{quote}

column1: Refine “Control Panel” at bottom of table
column33:
Reform “Control Panel” buttons at bottom of table: *Set Date*, *Set Assignment*, and *Set Status*

# Below bottom of “Scheduled Delivery Date” column, replace “date entry” space with button labeled *Set Date*
## Clicking *Set Date* will open the calendar which will function the same way as it currently does.
## After selecting date, the calendar pop-up will close automatically, after which the user will have the ability to click “Bulk Update” and apply selected scheduled delivery date to all selected milestones/tasks/subtasks
# Below bottom of “Assignee” column, replace “Assignee” dropdown with button labeled *Set Assignee*
## Clicking *Set Assignee* will open a dropdown menu from which you can select all available team members (same as in column view for Assignees). Whichever team members are selected can then be added to selected milestones/tasks/subtasks via “Bulk Update” button
# Below bottom of “Status” column, replace “No Change” button with button labeled *Set Status*
## Same functionality as above, user can select status options from drop down (To do, In progress, Testing, Done), enabling user to apply that status to selected milestones/tasks/subtasks via “Bulk Update” button
# Style these buttons in the same way as “Select View” button above column titles.



*Notes:* “Set Status” button not working-- changed component might be affecting it; need to test that this works on BE once FE is changed [~accountid:61084bde75ad9600691fd79f] to confirm
column114:
* *Set Date* button will appear below table, below the column *Scheduled Delivery Date*. Clicking this button will allow user to select a date that can then be added to every selected milestone/task/subtask using click Bulk Update.
* *Set Assignee* button will appear below table, below the column *Assignee*. Clicking this button will allow user to select a team member that can then be assigned to every selected milestone/task/subtask using click Bulk Update.
* *Set Status* button will appear below table, below the column *Status*. Clicking this button will allow user to select a status option that can then be assigned to every selected milestone/task/subtask using click Bulk Update.
* These buttons will all have consistent styling

02/Mar/23 2:11 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] So all updates are done. I am just left with one small thing that I might need your input on. There is a catch which ensures that we cannot update status of any task that hasn't been assigned to anyone. Now, while I am able to add logic to disable a user from going through with an update in such an instance, how do I tell a user what's going on?

Also, I realised this ticket may not need any backend changes based on the acceptance criteria.



cc: [~accountid:60f2d4eba0de58006ae1cd4c]
column195: 02/Mar/23 6:05 AM;60f2d4eba0de58006ae1cd4c;[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] the backend ticket is meant to provide the bulk task update endpoint. There’s none existing currently.
column196: 02/Mar/23 6:25 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] I think the best option would be to show a confirmation modal that lists the ones items that can not be updated and have a confirmation that asks if they want to continue to update the ones that are valid.   Depending on how complicated that is, we could just let the BE validate it and throw an error saying that not all changes were accepted because “Status cannot be changed to [Status] because the subtask must be assigned.”  I think the BE should still allow the valid changes to go through, even if there are some that are invalid.
column197:
02/Mar/23 6:30 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]{{I think the BE should still allow the valid changes to go through, even if there are some that are invalid.}} I agree, but also, I think a frontend approach would still be ideal. Let me work with [~accountid:60f2d4eba0de58006ae1cd4c] to see the best way forward, thanks.

[~accountid:60f2d4eba0de58006ae1cd4c] Yahh… after our chat, I get what the end point is supposed to be doing. Thanks

column1: Adjust "Hours" column
column33:
# Hours column will list the total hours associated w/ any Milestone, Task, or Subtask
# *Add a function that shows the cumulative hours at the bottom of the Hours column.* At the bottom of *Hours* column, add text: “Total”, after which will list the aggregate number of hours for whatever is being viewed.
## Common use case: If a PM wants to see the total # of hours assigned to any particular team member, they will select that team member from “Assignee” filter, and then at the bottom of the *Hours* column, they will be able to view the *total number of hours* assigned to that particular team member.
## In terms of UI, reference my example image and/or follow instructions of Dave/Curtis

!Total Hours Example (8da95a7e-0e7c-4b33-b579-71e2fb035da2).HEIC|thumbnail!
column114:
* *Hours* column will list correct number of hours for every corresponding milestone/task/subtask. 
* At the bottom of the hours column, we will show the *total # of hours* for whatever milestones/tasks/subtasks are currently populated.
* Test: If the view is toggled to only show the subtasks that are assigned to one specific team member, then the *hours* column, at the bottom, should list the *total # of hours* assigned to one specific team member, *calculated only from the subtasks that they are assigned to.*

column1: Edit Scheduled Delivery Date column
column33:
# *Schedule Delivery Date* column will list the *scheduled delivery date* for all corresponding milestones, tasks, and subtasks
# Include button “Select View” above Scheduled Delivery Date column title, which will open a calendar just like in the current “Filter View” modal.
# The Calendar is meant for users to select a date; we will then give the user  *two choices:*
## Show every deliverable with a scheduled delivery date *on or before* selected date
## Show every deliverable with scheduled delivery date *on or after* selected date
## To accommodate these choices, include two options below the calendar (see screenshot).
## Before/After selection states:
### When no date is selected, the two choices just read:
#### *Show before*
#### *Show after*
### When a date is selected, the two choices read:
#### *Show before {{selected date}}*
#### *Show after {{selected date}}*
## Then, include a final button at the bottom, reading *See Deliverables*
### This will exit the calendar view and show all of the deliverables relating to the scheduled delivery dates that the user selected



*Notes:* We use a 3rd party date-picker, ensure that we are able to customize [~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4] 

# !Schedule Date mockup.HEIC|width=1280,height=960!
column114:
* Column title will read: *Scheduled Delivery Date*
* Column will correctly show scheduled delivery date for every corresponding milestone/task/subtask
* “Select View” button will appear above *Scheduled Delivery Date* title
* Clicking “Select View” button will open up calendar interface, giving user the option to view all deliverables that are due *on and before or on and after* the selected date. User will then have option to confirm “See Deliverables”, after clicking this, calendar pop up closes and user goes back to updated Bulk Updates table.

column1: Refine "Job Type" column
column33:
Refine column for *Job Type:*

# This category will show all available job types for any specific subtask.
# Job Types values will *not appear* for Milestones or Tasks. They will only appear for Subtasks. *When showing Milestones or Tasks, fill the space with the text: “see subtasks”*
# Above the header *Job Type,* replace existing entry box “Select View” button.
## Clicking this button will trigger a dropdown with the following options (every available job type):
### Front-End Dev
### Back-End Dev
### QA
### Design
### Design Support
### Project Manager
## Users will be able to select *as many job type categories as they want.* For example, if the user only selects “Front-End Dev”, then only subtasks for “Front-End Devs” will list. If user selects both “Front-End Dev” and “QA”, then only subtasks with both “Front-End Dev” and “QA” will list. Etc.
## The *Title* view will *automatically default to “subtask view”* when a user toggles based on job type. For example, if the user was previously only viewing *Milestones only*, but then toggles the view to show all tasks for “Front-End Devs”, then the *Title* column will automatically populate to show all subtasks, not just milestones.
column114:
Job type column will show the correct job type for any associated subtask-- for milestones & tasks, it will populate with text that reads: “See Subtasks”

*Select View* button will appear above column name, which, when clicked, prompts a dropdown menu with selections of all available job types. When one or more options are selected: *a)* the table will filter to show _only_ those subtasks with the corresponding job type(s) and *b)* the “Title” column view will automatically adjust to “Subtask” view so that users will see the subtasks for all listed job types.

column1: Refine "Title" column
column33:
# Add button above the word “Title” with the text: “Select View”
# When the user clicks “Select View”, a dropdown menu will appear with three options:
## *Milestone*
## *Task*
## *Subtask*
# The Select View button will let users toggle between viewing different “levels” of tasks. There is a parent-child relationship between Milestone, Task, and Subtask, that functions as follows child selection will always show its parent(s). Selection options:
## Only *Milestone* selected: The table below will only list M*ilestones.* Tasks and subtasks will not list.
## *Task* selected: If *Task* is selected, then only *Milestones* and their respective *Tasks* will show. *Tasks will always be connected to their parent grouping, Milestones.*
## If *Subtask* is selected, then *Milestones, Tasks,* and their respective *Subtasks* will show. *Subtasks will always be connected to their parent grouping, Tasks and Milestones.*
## Use the same UI as in the current “In Development” section to show the relationship b/w Milestone —> Task —> Subtask. Users will *not be allowed to toggle the view by clicking arrows on the table itself* (like in the normal “In Development” view). Users can *only* toggle the view by clicking “Select View” button above the category.
column114:
Users will be able to toggle their view of milestones/tasks/subtasks in the *Title* column by selecting the various options via button “Select View”. When a child category is chosen, its parent(s) categories will always show as well. 

For example, if only have “Tasks” selected for my view, then all the listed tasks will also show their associated milestones.

column1: Quick UI edits for Bulk Updates
column33:
For *In Development* tab:

# Rename “Filter Tasks” button to “Bulk Updates”
# On the modal pop-up (after clicking “Bulk Updates” button):
## replace text, “Find and Edit Tasks” with heading “Perform Bulk Updates”
# Update the columns to read, from left to right:
## *Select All, Title, ID, Job Type, Scheduled Delivery Date, Assignee, Hours, Status*
## for *Select All* column, simply add the text “*Select All”* to the left of the check box currently serving as header
## We will likely need to increase the size of the Bulk Updates interface to account for added columns
# Increase the size of the modal-- there’s a lot of vertical space we can use, and more horizontal space to take advantage of as well. column1: Bulk Updates on Task Page
column33:
*Description:* 

The purpose of this epic is to allow PMs to perform “bulk update” actions within the Task page of the Crowdbotics dashboard. This is most pressing for the “In Development” tab of the Task page— where PMs are currently forced to *_manually_* update every single individual task/subtask— in short, this takes *_forever_*. With this epic, we will save PMs massive amounts of time (up to 1 hour+/project), literally thousands of clicks, and immeasurable mental anguish. We will fix this by allowing PMs— and other stakeholders when relevant— to efficiently perform bulk updates.

*Metrics:* 

We should be able to measure the following results from this update:

# Faster delivery dates
# More projects delivered on time
# Greater adherence to CB dashboard
# Increased CSAT
# Probably more

column1: Invite user to create an account when inviting a collaborator through the teams page
column33:
Currently the invite implementation on the teams page is quite confusing and the workflow needs to be tidied up. 

As a member of an application, I would like to be able to invite a user to my app without knowing if they have an account or not. 

* If they have an account, invite them to join the app
* If they do not have an account, create a invite to register (or something similar) ex, “You’ve been invited to join X, please create an account here!”
column114:
Invite to join app email is sent if user has an account

Invite to create account email is sent if user does not have an account

Respond with error if account already is in app.

Note: It should be uploaded as a zip file.

* Uploads the file {{media.tar.gz}} to the bucket

The bucket should have necessary permissions to allow file download.

column1: Software prices for modules disappear when user clicks "Save and Apply" on resource cards
column33:
When an app template is added to PRD and the PRD is approved - we correctly see the software price for modules included in the Proposal tab. But if a user opens the rate card and clicks “Save and Apply”, then the software hours for modules disappear from the “Software Included” section. 

Example app links:

* [App link for the app in video|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38797/tasks?tab=backlog]
* [App link for an accounting app|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/38063/tasks?tab=PRD]

*Video of the problem:* [https://www.loom.com/share/2d1c624afd09405997a30265bd885b8a|https://www.loom.com/share/2d1c624afd09405997a30265bd885b8a|smart-link] 

*For context:* BAs and Estimation team sometimes need to adjust prices for a given project in the Proposal tab (e.g. to apply a different rate for a specific deal). The concern is that if they adjust the price in the rate card for anything in Proposal tab and click “save and apply” - then the software price will disappear.
column193:
08/Feb/23 12:48 PM;618e6f963ae5230069229010;Test case - 

[TC-3886-Verify that Software prices for modules should be appear when user clicks "Save and Apply" on resource cards|https://cbtcms.herokuapp.com/case/3886/]
column194: 09/Feb/23 11:15 AM;618e6f963ae5230069229010;It should be enhancement instead of bug, because as per the current functionality when we clicking on save & apply button the price is getting auto generated, that is why software milestone price are getting changed.
column195:
09/Feb/23 2:05 PM;621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4;[~accountid:633b37c1409249995eeb9973] that doesn’t seem like a bug, it seems like we’re having property named “{{resource_cost_estimated}}“, meaning we are overriding the real price which is the sum of subtasks.

cc [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]  [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column196:
10/Feb/23 6:31 AM;633b37c1409249995eeb9973;I see - thanks [~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4]! I can understand why we might want to update the resource rates for a specific project - for instance, we might want to do that if a client specifically negotiates a lower rate. That should change the cost of tasks. However, our software price for any modules with reusable code (e.g. completed and screen modules) should still stay the same. [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] - do you agree?

If so, then can we confirm whether: (i) only the task hours are get updated if we adjust the resource rate and hit save and apply, and (ii) the software price for completed modules and screen modules are still included after a user hits save and apply?
column197:
10/Feb/23 7:11 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;Save and Apply should update the subtask cost to be hours * hourly rate (for jobtype) which updates the parent task and parent milestone.

The costs for these ‘software included’ tasks should be set and there should not be any subtasks I would think.  If we are having tasks that have subtasks and software cost then I would think the task total would be the sum of all subtasks plus the software cost.

In either case, the number changing by simply clicking “Save and Apply” is clearly a bug.  I’m just not sure if the bug is occurring on the initial total shown (and save+apply is actually showing the correct price) or if the bug is solely on save and apply.
column198:
10/Feb/23 10:53 AM;621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4;[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] the save and apply button (logic), is working correctly, but the data coming from the BE {{resource_cost_estimated}} not correct or being calculated in a different way.

[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef]  can you confirm that ?
column199:
10/Feb/23 11:25 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4] this happens because some of those Software Included Milestones have an added “license” price. That is not computed using hours * rate. So whenever we click “Apply and Save” we recalculate everything by aggregating the sum of hours * rate. 
This is definitely something we need to fix on BE.
column200:
10/Feb/23 11:31 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;!image-20230210-193011.png|width=980,height=770!

This is a module added via the PRD. 1500 is the license cost (this cost is added to the parent task during approval), I see we have a “install module” subtask. But it has no price (maybe we could use that?).
After hitting “Save and Apply“ we will have a total price of 172 instead of 1672

TECH-ENABLER: time to first deployed app KPI
column33:
Time-to-first-deployed-app (TTFD) is the time it takes for the first functional app build to be generated and successfully deployed for either Android &/or iOS to the customer once the PRD is signed.

Start time = date/time when PRD is signed by customer

End time = date/time when:

# iOS app is successfully built & deployed to TestFlight with link to test iOS app provided to customer
#  Android app is successfully created in Play Console for first time manual deployment in conjunction with Internal track release

TTFD (iOS) = End time (1) - Start time

TTFD (Android) = End time (2) - Start time



{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Note: TTFD must be calculated on a per project basis in order to arrive at overall metric across all projects based on plan type
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Note2: all legacy projects will not be counted in determining this metric
{panel}

h3. UPDATE 2-28

Per Charath: Start time = when customer completes checkout process

→ does not account for pre-sale period → identify latency between PRD approval & checkout completed

 +*Minimum Functional Product (“MFP”)*+

{quote}A running and clickable application prototype which consists of the following:{quote}

* A web version of the UI
* Mobile versions of the UI deployed to the emulator (Appetize).
* All application screens completed with unstyled or minimally styled views.
* All application models created.
* All connectors built.

{quote}Workflows and application logic are out of scope.{quote}

h3. Reference

[+https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Strategies-to-increase-Bot-Coverage-Module-Reuse-082323707df04216a192b86375d530de+|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Strategies-to-increase-Bot-Coverage-Module-Reuse-082323707df04216a192b86375d530de]

column1: TECH-ENABLER: code reuse KPI
column33:
h1. Why

Our goal at CB for fiscal 2023 is to move away from *custom* development initiatives spear-headed by our delivery team and focused on automation. We need clear indicators of this progress so we can scale with better unit economics. One lead metric to focus our measurement is the ability of our customers to generate a fully working application with zero-touch. To measure this metric, we are looking to track Module Reuse and Automation. To answer some questions:

* How often do customers and our delivery team create new modules?
* How often do customers and our delivery team modify existing modules?
* What percentage of existing modules get modified?

h1. Description:

We need a mechanism to periodically scrape our customer's software applications and extract metrics/features to measure Module Reuse.

The ticket builds off of the work already being done for [Tech Enabler: BOT Coverage|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10216], consisting of Scraping, Batch & Storage and Display and Graphing. The commonality is the Scraping, Batch & Storage. Display and Graph will dictate Scraping.

Outlined below are the Display and Graph requirements

h1. Visualization Requirements:

* Display the *number of repositories* scanned
* Display the number of existing modules used within all scanned repositories
** Which modules are the most frequently used amongst all scanned project repos?
** Which modules are most frequently customized from their existing template?
*** Is there a correlation between the most frequently used modules and the most customized ones?
* Display the percentage of customized module code versus existing CB-templated modules
* Display the percentage of complete new module code versus existing module code
* Display the *date* that the scrapping took place
* Graph trends with a periodicity of past 7 days, past 30 days, past 90 days & YTD 
* Create a searchable table that allows internal CB users to obtain the code reuse metric on a per project basis

_Stretch: Feature extract should be flexible to extrapolate additional findings from the data, e.g. the project type/category, private or public repos_



– OLD

----

% of as-sold app code that uses a customer’s own private modules → the % of finished app that uses prebuilt modules (PRD-level)

----

How should we create the mechanism/means by which to track this metric?

# Scrape
# Batch
# Storage
## need a time-series DB in conjunction with Graphana 
# Display
## we must differentiate between new code for new modules & code changes made to existing modules.
### this can be represented as a stacked bar graph over time with sum of both equaling total code changes
## total code changes = new lines of code added + changes to existing lines of code
## we must also be able to ascertain which specific modules have had the most code changes to their existing codebase
### Hypothesis: the Login screen module will have the least amount of code changes

column1: Product Metrics
column33:
!image-20230207-170354.png|width=2414,height=1370!

----

h4. +The definition of “bot coverage” is:+

{quote}The percentage of an application’s codebase which is generated by the Crowdbotics dashboard through use of the visual build tools and from prebuilt artifacts. This would include items such as the scaffold, modules, models, connectors, screens generated via the studio canvas.{quote}

*_Bot coverage_*, therefore, is *_a measure of the efficiency of our platform toolchain, & indirectly, its impact on metrics such as COGS & Time-to-First-Build._*

----

There is a separate metric, “+code reuse+”, which measures *the percentage of an app’s codebase that is realized purely with reusable artifacts (scaffold & modules).*

----

Code reuse, therefore, is a measure of reuse (unsurprisingly) & speaks to the foundational Crowdbotics premise of creating software through assembly of reusable artifacts.

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Based on these definitions, please note that Bot Coverage is a superset of Code Reuse, although in the early part of FY23, the numbers will be very close to one another
{panel}

----

h4. +How does this translate to measurement?+

* “As-sold” Code Reuse is easy to measure. An early proxy for it can be to just calculate how many modules (plus scaffold) are included in a PRD and quantify that as a percentage of total features in the PRD. This should be easy for BAs to quantify & enter.
* For Bot coverage, the engineering team is committing to having a baseline number established for each project by EOQ. I suspect we’ll have something preliminary next sprint (3/15) & a formal version by 3/31.
* Once that launches, *the “as-sold” bot coverage measure will include all the modules, screens, connectors, models, & scaffold that’s available when the customer checks out.* → under the operating assumption that BAs will initialize the project using Studio prior to checkout.
* *The “as-delivered” bot coverage for a project will be measurable when all tasks in the project are completed.*

column1: TECH-ENABLER: software code "bot" coverage KPI
column33:
Bot coverage is the % of code generated with zero-human-touch, i.e. machine-generated code, in an app. → the % of finished app’s code that is machine-generated.



*_Per Charath →_* *_“bot coverage”_* *_is:_*

{quote}_The percentage of an application’s codebase which is generated by the Crowdbotics dashboard through use of the visual build tools and from prebuilt artifacts. This would include items such as the scaffold, modules, models, connectors, screens generated via the studio canvas._{quote}

----

How can we create the mechanism/means by which to track bot coverage?

----

We need infrastructure to host this data, the script we will automatically run to aggregate data used to calculate each specific metric, where we will store these metrics/underlying data & how we will display it in order to be informative & useful for sales/leadership/Service team members.

# *Scrape*
# *Batch*
# *Storage*
## need a time-series DB in conjunction with Graphana 
# *Display*
## We would like to break the overall bot coverage metric down into its individual components (scaffolding, deployers, API, etc.) that comprise the overall metric so on any given week or month we know which aspect of the bot coverage KPI was most affected
### Ex. we update the scaffolding for legacy projects last week, hence why the KPI is drastically different this week as compared to the historical average
## We would also like a tread-line to know if we are on track to meet our year-end target

h3. *References*

* [https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/graphs/contributors|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/graphs/contributors]

column203:
07/Feb/23 11:17 AM;5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910;{noformat}WITH
-- Change the proper dates here
    start_date_const AS (VALUES (date '2023-01-01')),
    end_date_const AS (VALUES (date '2023-01-31'))
SELECT DISTINCT "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."id", "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."full_name", 
"crowdbotics_githubrepo"."custom_name",
COALESCE("djstripe_plan"."id", 'free') as plan,
"cb_slack_teammemberrole"."email",
COUNT("projects_commit"."id") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))) AS "commit_count",
-- Lines of code count
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const) )
and (coalesce("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'username', '') NOT LIKE 'crowdbotics-apps')
and (coalesce("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'name', '') NOT LIKE '%dependabot%')
), 0) AS "loc_human",
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))
and ("projects_commit"."data" @> '{"author":{"username": "crowdbotics-apps"}, "message": "Initial commit."}' )
), 0) AS "loc_scaffold",
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))
and (coalesce("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'username', '') LIKE 'crowdbotics-apps')
and ("projects_commit"."data"->>'message' != 'Initial commit.' )
), 0) AS "loc_non_human",
COALESCE(SUM("projects_commit"."lines_of_code") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const) )
and (UPPER("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'name') LIKE UPPER('%dependabot%'))
), 0) AS "loc_dependabot",
-- End lines of code
"crowdbotics_githubrepo"."created_on" FROM "crowdbotics_githubrepo" 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "cb_slack_teammemberrole" ON ("crowdbotics_githubrepo"."owner_id" = "cb_slack_teammemberrole"."id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "auth_user" ON ("cb_slack_teammemberrole"."django_user_id" = "auth_user"."id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "projects_commit" ON ("crowdbotics_githubrepo"."id" = "projects_commit"."project_id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "djstripe_subscription" ON ("crowdbotics_githubrepo"."subscription_id" = "djstripe_subscription"."djstripe_id") 
LEFT OUTER JOIN "djstripe_plan" ON ("djstripe_subscription"."plan_id" = "djstripe_plan"."djstripe_id") 
WHERE NOT (UPPER("auth_user"."email"::text) LIKE UPPER('%@crowdbotics.com%') AND "auth_user"."email" IS NOT NULL)
GROUP BY "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."id", "djstripe_plan"."id", "cb_slack_teammemberrole"."email" HAVING COUNT("projects_commit"."id") 
FILTER (WHERE (("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date >= (table start_date_const) 
AND ("projects_commit"."created_on" AT TIME ZONE 'UTC')::date <= (table end_date_const))
-- amount of non-dependabot commits are > 0
AND (UPPER("projects_commit"."data" -> 'author'->>'name') NOT LIKE UPPER('%dependabot%'))) > 0
ORDER BY "crowdbotics_githubrepo"."created_on" DESC
{noformat}

column1: Images dimension once set in App store connect and Google play console, are getting cropped again and again
column33:
Description-

Steps -

# Login the [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/]
# Login with your credentials
# Create a new app
# Upgrade the plan
# Click on App store connect/ Google play console
# Click on App Icon in App information
# Click on crop icon of default image and crop it to 1024*1024 size
# Again click on crop icon of newly uploaded image
# Crop it to 1024*1024 size 
# New image will come again

Actual Result- The images of 1024*1024px will be created if keep on cropping the previous  1024*1024 uploaded images.

Expected Result- If once the image has been cropped to its is size (1024*1024 in this case) then the new created image should not be allowed to crop further to the same size( 1024*1024), because it has already been done. There should be some pop message to restrict this.

Note - This is happening with uploaded images as well not only with default images.

Video for Reference- [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dZXcj_uO6pPJvWwHH1KAsABjPQk8Layn/view|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dZXcj_uO6pPJvWwHH1KAsABjPQk8Layn/view|smart-link] ( for default images)

Video for Reference- [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1igi8Lv2PK7Dhi9O3Le9-FNElTweiTlYR/view|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1igi8Lv2PK7Dhi9O3Le9-FNElTweiTlYR/view|smart-link] ( for uploaded images)

column1: create review apps with proper seed data, permissions, catalogue data and backend for FE PRs
column33:
h2. Pain Point (FE and QA):

* Review apps functionality needs improvement for validating Pull-Requests
* QA needs a review apps to function as closely to staging as possible to validate frontend code changes
* Frontend code changes potentially require matching against a different backend codebase. (possibly a developer branch). These mix-and-match scenarios are needed to test parallel development initiatives between the frontend and backend code change.

h2. Description:

Currently, frontend code PRs from [https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104|smart-link]  generate links to [https://crowdbotics.github.io/vue-dash-5104|https://crowdbotics.github.io/vue-dash-5104] / <Jira Ticket> / dashboard / hash - however this is not usable:

* The link is broken
* If the link was working, it is not connected to a backend and has limited functionality

Unlike the PR from the backend [https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app|smart-link] PRs created from this repository create a full review app on heroku. The vue-dash-5104 needs the same treatment. Listed below are requirements.

h2. Requirements:

* When a new PR is created within {{vue-dash-5104}}, it will launch a Heroku review-app instance, picking up, by default {{master}} from {{crowdbotics-slack-app}}.
* Data will be populated within this review app instance so that features within the review app are functional
* The PR can also have an optional field with the description, the Github actions will be able to detect the key-value pair specifying a different backend to deploy. If the key-value pair is not present, it defaults to the backend’s {{master}} branch. The key value pair can have the form:
** CB_BACKEND=<branch name>
** CB_BACKEND=<long commit hash> e.g. {{3b271283dc7bb6199284814d93a4e3193eb6fb8e}}
** CB_BACKEND=<short commit hash> e.g. {{3b27128}}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Note: If there are parsing errors, CB_BACKEND will default to {{master}}
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Note2: the github actions parsing must account for spaces of the key-value pair (but not line endings)
{panel}

* The review app link will be populated as a description or entry within the PR to make it easily to navigate to
* If additional changes within code are done for the repository, the review app will deploy the new frontend code changes, again parsing out the backend, key-value pair as mentioned within the above description

h2. Questions:

# How long should the review app be available for testing? Should we destroy the heroku instance when the PR has been merged?
## Answer: Review app will be available for testing for 120 hours from the time it was created. We will destroy the heroku instance when the PR is merged.
column114:
* PRs created within the {{vue-dash-5104}} will have a fully functioning review app so that devs and QA can test against
* The review app will have a set of predefined login credentials to successfully log in.
* The review app functionality will match exactly the deployed review app from the backend code.
* The review app will not be accessible based on the lifetime scope when Question 1 has been answered.
column193: 09/Feb/23 9:47 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] I’ve reviewed this ticket and provided my answer to the Question that was asked. This ticket is ready for refinement.
column194: 09/Feb/23 9:50 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]  : need your feedback - is this what you want for FE
column195:
09/Feb/23 3:05 PM;63bc389e49a31f95b8733476;Regarding Question 1, what happens if a review app is created on a Friday? Would there be a way to create a new review app after the original has been destroyed?

I’ve noticed some devs put up PRs that are work in progress. Do we want to restrict that so we don’t create review apps prematurely, or would there be a way to trigger the creation?
column196:
10/Feb/23 7:43 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;The review apps should have enough resources that they can be tested.  We also need to have “demo apps” that have enough resources to handle several users using it to “validate” new functionality before we release it to production.  Basically the demo apps would have the same resources as [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/] or [https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com|https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/dashboard/accounts/login?next=%2Fdashboard%2F] and can be created as-needed.  We should also have the crowdbotics-staging be tied to master and crowdbotics-slack-dev tied to our integration branch (depending on how we do our branching strategy).

I think the important seed data would be (off the top of my head):

* permissions (we also need to keep our dev permissions (and Roles and Groups) in sync with production and have production be the source of truth).  This may be its own ticket.
* Catalog data
* dev site login info, so that we don’t have to register as a new user.  I think this is already available, however.
column197: 10/Feb/23 12:30 PM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;RESOLVED → GitHub Action has to parse out description and look for a key-value pair to feed into the CI/CD pipeline
column198:
13/Feb/23 12:36 PM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;Throwing in some additional info here: 

I see a ticket for the 404 errors. If the front-end review apps are still going to be GitHub Pages, since the dashboard is an SPA, additional coding/investigation will need to be addressed, specifically regarding routes. Here is the reason why: [https://github.com/rafgraph/spa-github-pages#why-its-necessary|https://github.com/rafgraph/spa-github-pages#why-its-necessary|smart-link] (and more info: [https://huishun.medium.com/how-to-deploy-a-vue-js-application-with-dynamic-routing-on-github-pages-3d36f4644e54|https://huishun.medium.com/how-to-deploy-a-vue-js-application-with-dynamic-routing-on-github-pages-3d36f4644e54|smart-link] )

To fix this, you might need s*omeone who is available from the front-end team* to partner with Samuel and because code changes might be warranted.

column1: Add Approve PRD event and send to Hupspot (BE)
column33:
Add the following Segment event (using track: [https://segment.com/docs/connections/destinations/catalog/hubspot/|https://segment.com/docs/connections/destinations/catalog/hubspot/|smart-link]) and send data fields to Hubpsot.

*Segment Event:* Approve PRD

*Firing Trigger:* When the owner of an app clicks “Approve PRD” in the PRD tab

*Data (Field: Value)*

* First Name (HubSpot internal name: {{firstname}}):
* Last Name (HubSpot internal name: {{lastname}}):
* Email (HubSpot internal name: {{email}}):
* Date / Timestamp of Approve PRD (HubSport internal name: {{approve_prd_click_date}}):
* PRD url (HubSpot internal name: {{prd_url}}):
* Template selected (HubSpot internal name: {{template_selected}}):
column114:
* *QA:* Make sure that the event for Approve PRD and data fields are passing correctly to Segment.
* *The Engineer working on this ticket:* should: (i) send a test event to Hubspot once the event is in production, and (ii) let John Bender know that you sent the dummy event. 
** This will help John Bender verify that data fields are correctly passing to Hubspot.

column1: Update module icon in PRD tab for consistency
column33:
*As a user, I should see the following in my PRD tab:*

* My PRD group should include an icon and count for total no. of modules in that group, if that PRD group contains items with code modules.
** Any PRD item with code should show the module icon.

*Screenshot of code module count and placement in PRD tab:*

!Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 5.53.24 PM.png|width=290,height=119!
column114:
*In the PRD tab:*

* If a PRD group has modules (code), then the PRD group should show module icon, along with a total count for modules in that PRD group.
** I should not see any module icon or count in a PRD group if that group has no modules with code.

column1: Show Better with Crowdbotics section
column33:
*As a user (customer or internal user):*

* If my PRD has modules with code, then I should see the Better with Crowdbotics section in my Proposal tab after my PRD is approved (even if pricing is not finalized).

h3. *Mock-up for what customers see before pricing is finalized*

!Screen Shot 2023-02-06 at 2.37.14 PM.png|width=894,height=453!
column114:
* I should see the Better with Crowdbotics section in the Proposal tab after my PRD is approved, if my PRD has modules with code.
** If my PRD has no modules with code, then I should not see the Better with Crowdbotics section after my PRD is approved.

column1: PRD Backlog updates
column33:
As a user (customer, BA, or Sales), I want:

* My PRD backlog to contain one section for the features I want now and another section for my Wishlist.
* PRD group should include an icon and count for total no. of modules in that group, if that PRD group contains items with code modules.
** Any PRD item with code should show the module icon.

*Mock-up*

!Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 4.35.45 PM.png|width=543,height=416!
column114:
* PRD backlog should contain PRD groups / features in one section and a Wishlist as the other section.
** Remove separate sections that include “Items with ready-made code” and “Custom items that need development”
* PRD item with code should show the module icon.
* If a PRD group has modules (code), then the PRD group should show module icon, along with a total count for modules in that PRD group.
** I should not see any module icon or count in a PRD group if that group has no modules with code.
* This update to the PRD Backlog does not need to be backward compatible.

column1: Proposal Enhancement: Pricing + Software Benefits
column33:
h3. What problem are we solving?

* Items with ready-made code currently include modules with tasks that require manual development. As a result the software price breakdown is *not accurate*.
* If the PRD includes Features from Catalog - then, part of the feature item lives under the software section, and the other part goes under custom development. So, items (e.g. modules) within a feature are split across 2 sections of the backlog.
* As a result, BA / Estimation team has to routinely drag and drop PRD items to “Custom Items that Need Development” when they review pricing.

h3. What will this enhancement accomplish?

* Inform customers about the price breakdown for software vs. services.
* Remind customers that they are getting  modules with reusable code that saves development time, and helps us build the app faster.
** Highlighting these benefits can help us close the deal.

column1: hide Hours & Cost columns in Tasks tab for Enterprise customers
column33:
Request from sales to hide the Hours & Cost columns for all enterprise customers, as they estimates provided in the PRD do not match the sum total of the line item costs. This line item cost breakdown also prompts the Enterprise client to negotiate more, thus increasing the sales conversion cycle.



*Implemntation:* Quick fix…

# On back-end, create the ability to flag an “enterprise” app
# Use existing permissions and remove the view costs/hours permissions from owner and finance roles if the app has enterprise = true
# Note: need to investigate if existing permissions allow for this, or if we need to create new ones

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Sales may still need to move Tasks through checkout in Admin panel, but that’s no issue
{panel}

!image-20230202-202141.png|width=1880,height=885!
column114:
When an app is flagged as “enterprise” in the admin panel, remove the “view costs” and “view hours” permissions from owner & finance roles when that app has “enterprise = true”. 

i.e. A project member with the *finance* or *owner* role will *not* be able to view costs or hours for their enterprise project.

column194: 02/Feb/23 2:19 PM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;I don't think we're identifying enterprise customers explicitly in the system.  The Owner role can  see hours/costs but Members and Collaborators can not.  If the enterprise customer role can be set as Member or Collaborator then it may suffice.  If we need to hide for Owners then we will need to edit the code to flag apps as "enterprise" apps and hide based on that data.
column195:
02/Feb/23 4:22 PM;633b37c1409249995eeb9973;Thanks Stefan and Dave!

[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] - Can we easily set the Enterprise owner role for Komatsu to Collaborator or Member?

 [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] - If we still need to assign this ticket to someone else in the Marketplace Ops team, can we make sure that this gets done asap?
column196:
06/Feb/23 6:47 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;[~accountid:633b37c1409249995eeb9973] This is a bigger effort to do correctly ([~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656] and Devops are scoping this out now).  However, we could do something simple like have a flag on the app that designates the app as “Enterprise” and treats all roles like collaborator.

The actual solution could be to have enterprise roles which are a subset of permissions specific to a group of apps.  This would allow us to change permissions for an Owner role and have it only affect Komatsu apps.
