column1: Group model builder, studio, connectors under one menu
column33:
*Final Goal*: Group model builder, studio, connectors under one menu.

*Description*: The side navigation menu must be updated so that it looks the same both inside and outside of Studio. Additionally, Data Models, Canvas and Connectors will be grouped under a parent menu called “Studio“. 

By default, this navigation menu is collapsed. It will get expanded once user clicks in the “Studio“ name.

If user clicks in one of the child navigation, the user must be redirected to the equivalent page.

If one of the child navigation is selected, the Studio group will always be displayed as expanded.

If any of Canvas, Data Models or Connectors is selected, it must be highlighted as active (like any other menu option currently).

----

Tech Details: 

*  Remove the {{NewStudioSideBar}} component for the left side bar

!image-20230201-192141.png|width=33.33333333333333%!

* Replace iit to always use{{SecondarySidebar}}. With a few changes:
** If user is inside studio, always be collapsed (expanding is disabled in the hamburger menu icon)
** If user is in other parts of the app, expanding is available
* Improve the margin left of the Studio component inside Vue so it will  accommodate the width of the collapsed `{{SecondarySidebar}}` correctly (meaning: remove this line {{"pl-0": this.ifCurrentRouteIsStudio}}` from the {{secondaryClasses}} prop, also make any adjustments to the logo in the {{PrimarySidebar}}). It will look like this:

!image-20230201-195058.png|width=1042,height=919!



* Implement the sub routes in the left side panel. Studio will have 3 sublinks, by moving the routes of Connectors and Data Models to a sublink of the Studio menu. If user clicks in “Studio“ name, it will expand and open the 3 possible navigation links, as seen below.
** Studio
*** Canvas
*** Data Models
*** Connectors

Final look should be like this:

!image-20230207-152049.png|width=375,height=950!

When panel is collapsed, the same styling should be applied.
column114:
Data Models, Canvas e Connectors are links of the “Studio“ group

When in Studio, the sidebar looks like the rest of the app (when collapsed)

column1: TECH-ENABLER: django-tenant infrastructure & migration plan
column33:
create a whole new infrastructure with django-tenant. After testing, switch DNS to point to the new infra.

we must create a migration plan to achieve this and test every core function of the Dashboard for end-to-end testing.

instead of having a separate app instance, we will create a separate Postgres & create a backup db, switch to the backup and carry out the migration

----

public schema (existing) + new schema (multi-tenant)

migrations on top of read replica not a new (empty) prod DB

best practices → never delete data during a migration. Add to only & validate 1-to-1 relationship.
column114:
Create a test plan for how we will test this?

Create a plan in the event that we must rollback any changes

column1: Studio - Parse OpenAPI path parameters, query parameters and request body
column33:
Parse the {{OperationObject}} items in the document and extract the {{parameters}} and {{requestBody}} properties values and data types.
[https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#operation-object|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#operation-object|smart-link] 

{{ParameterObject}}:
[https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#parameter-object|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#parameter-object|smart-link] 

{{RequestBodyObject}}:
[https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#request-body-object|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#request-body-object|smart-link] 

Map that data with the computed action creator name (based on operationId, or http verb + path) so that we can relate both and suggest the appropriate parameters for when a user is working on a Data Call in Studio.
column114:
Extract {{parameters}}and {{requestBody}} values from the connector’s OpenAPI documents (connectors+base connector) and build a map of those values and the actions names. Include Data Model names in the map too.

Reuse and extend the existing implementation from {{/src/codegen/openapi}} that parses OpenAPI documents and extracts services data and data calls data. Main goal here is to then expose this to UI via hook/action.

column1: FE: Update Redirected URLs
column33:
There are two endpoints that are being redirected on the back-end.

We should update the front-end URLs so that they match the redirected ones.

It looks like the redirect is simply adding a slash to the end of the URL, before any query parameters.

Specifically:

Change

[+https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v2/tasks/shareable-status+|https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v2/tasks/shareable-status] 
to 
[https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v2/tasks/shareable-status/|https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v2/tasks/shareable-status/]

and 

[https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v1/apps/28483/payment-proposals?|https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v1/apps/28483/payment-proposals?limit=50&page=1]

[limit=50&page=1|https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v1/apps/28483/payment-proposals?limit=50&page=1] 

to

[https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v1/apps/28483/payment-proposals/?limit=50&page=1|https://crowdbotics-staging.herokuapp.com/api/v1/apps/28483/payment-proposals/?limit=50&page=1]

column1: FE: Load tasks by demand, only when the milestone/parent task is expanded
column33:
Currently the FE loads all the tasks/subtasks for all the milestones on first load. This is not ideal as the FE needs to load all the tasks before it can show them. We should only load the tasks/subtasks when the milestone/parent task is expanded.

This means the response from the backend must have correct data for the milestone (delivery date, cost, status etc.)

Front-end will refactor where necessary but not overdue it. Which may include creating a component only for the proposal tab. But some refactoring ideas can be seen in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10744|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10744|smart-link]
column114: * Only load the tasks/subtasks when the milestone/parent task is expanded

column226: Milestone status together with "tab status" and respective filters should be server side.

column1: Milestone status together with "tab status" and respective filters should be server side.
column33:
Currently the Milestone status (in progress, completed, etc) together with "tab status" (proposal, development backlog, in development, ...) and respective filters are client side. 

This means that the FE needs to have all the tasks loaded for a specific milestone to be able to calculate the status and separate the milestones by tab.

This is not ideal as the FE needs to load all the tasks before it can calculate the status and separate the milestones by tab. We should have a server side endpoint that returns the milestones separated by tab and with the status calculated.
column114:
* BE: Add new fields to the Milestone model to store the status and "tab status".
** Those can be calculated fields or can be stored in the DB, it is up to the developer to decide, but it should not be performance impacting.
* BE: Create/Update a endpoint to return the milestones with those new fields and with a filter for both the "tab status" and the status.
* BE: Create a new endpoint to return the count of milestones for each "tab status".
* FE: Update the FE to use the new endpoints.
** We should only be loading the data on the current selected tab

04/Apr/23 5:11 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;* Getting a count on In Development tab even all milestone moved and no milestone is available

This seems to happen because before we would move a Milestone with no tasks directly to delivered. But now I think we shouldn’t do that anymore as even though it has no Milestones, the users can still want to move items to it, from another Milestone.

column197:
26/Feb/23 1:32 PM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;!Screenshot 2023-02-27 at 00.29.11.png|width=1553,height=739!

[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] I have been working on the filters for this modal today with [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] and atleast we have the end points all set. I just have one final thing to clarify. Since the data returned from the end points is paginated, are we using an infinite scroll here or Paged component? And also, what would be the recommended number of items per page.

Thanks
column198: 27/Feb/23 4:45 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;Let me add [~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] here. But what I understood when we talked about this is to “ignore“ the pagination for now. And just request “all pages”. I kept the endpoint with pagination because on some huge projects, the response payload can be quite huge.
column199:
27/Feb/23 9:41 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] Let me know if we need to get on a call to ensure we’re on the same page. 

Here is my stance: I would strongly prefer an infinite scroller as opposed to pagination. The reasoning is that for the UX of this feature, PMs will want to be able to have the freedom to view everything at once, with ease… adding pages is a huge block to their view and also # of clicks. 

Can we make this work?

cc: [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column200:
27/Feb/23 9:53 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;Given that when the customer “select all” we need to have all ids of the items so the FE can make the changes and correctly display everything. I don’t think we can have either, pagination or infinite scroll.

So for now I would chain all pages and load everything.

Until we develop a BE solution to handle this, at least.
column201:
27/Feb/23 10:03 AM;63bc389e49a31f95b8733476;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] An infinite scroll is when you’re scrolling through a list and you get to the end, it loads the next page without you having to do anything. Here is a quick example of that, [https://scrollmagic.io/examples/advanced/infinite_scrolling.html|https://scrollmagic.io/examples/advanced/infinite_scrolling.html|smart-link] , Think of those squares as our tasks. So every time you get to the bottom of the list it fetches the next page of tasks. Like [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] said, this won’t be helpful in this situation. 

We will need to watch for performance issues with this. Also, [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f], say there are 1600 tasks, can we even submit a bulk change to all of those items at once?
column202: 27/Feb/23 10:07 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;Thank you [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] , you’re right. If the solution for now is to chain all pages and load everything, is our only bottle neck loading time? Any estimates of what that would be?
column203: 27/Feb/23 10:11 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] Does this mean that the Page and {{limit}} in the query params don’t really matter given you insight on how the backend is set up?
column204:
27/Feb/23 10:30 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] Currently we don’t have a BE endpoint for bulk updates, the FE sequentially sends requests to update each task.
We are to work on a BE endpoint for this on [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10249?searchSessionId=b1be44e8-4ea3-4737-a3ef-87e0fbc2916c&searchObjectId=29013&searchContainerId=10018&searchContentType=issue|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10249?searchSessionId=b1be44e8-4ea3-4737-a3ef-87e0fbc2916c&searchObjectId=29013&searchContainerId=10018&searchContentType=issue|smart-link].
Performance-wise (on BE side at least) we did the possible to maximize it. I have some cool info on the PR itself [https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4224|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/pull/4224|smart-link] 

[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] I think we have set {{max_page_size = 50}} on BE. I leave it to you to choose, but given we have some huge apps the response payloads can be huge. Principally on {{bulk-milestones-subtasks}} endpoint. You can test with app id = 1 on the RA.
I think chaining those requests would be impact less performance than a single huge one.

column226: Filter Tasks modal should be server side

column1: Filter Tasks modal should be server side
column33:
Currently the Filter Tasks modal is client side. This means that the FE needs to have all the tasks loaded to be able to filter on them. 

This is not ideal as the FE needs to make multiple requests to load all the tasks before it can filter on them. We should have a server side filter endpoint that returns the filtered tasks.
column114:
* BE: Create a new endpoint that returns the filtered tasks/subtasks.
** For subtasks:
*** Should be filterable by: Delivery Date, Job Type, Assignee, Status
** For tasks:
*** Should be filterable by: Delivery Date, Assignee, Status
* FE: Update the FE to use the new endpoint.

column226: Search by ID input should be server side.

column1: Search by ID input should be server side.
column33:
Currently the Search by ID input is client side. This means that the FE needs to have all the tasks loaded to be able to search on them. 

This is not ideal as the FE needs to make multiple requests to load all the tasks before it can search on them. We should have a server side search endpoint that returns the searched tasks.
column114:
* BE: Create a new endpoint that returns the searched tasks by id.
** Shouldn't be exact match, should be a contains match.
* FE: Update the FE to use the new endpoint.

column226: Make batch requests of PRD items.

column1: Make batch requests of PRD items.
column33: Currently FE needs to make multiple requests to {{api/v1/prd_items/?app_id={APP_ID}&group={GROUP_ID}}}, one for each group, to get all the PRD items. We should have a endpoint that could return the queried PRD items by ID in a paginated request.
column114:
* BE: Create a new endpoint that returns the queried PRD items in a paginated request.
** It is worth investigating the average number of PRD items per group (on prod) so we can paginate the request accordingly.
* FE: Update the FE to use the new endpoint.

column1: FE: Remove duplicate requests on code_stats endpoint.
column33:
When the FE first loads the PRD page it makes multiple GET requests to {{/api/v2/code_stats/?app_id={APP_ID}}}. This is not needed and is causing a lot of unnecessary requests.

It’s also requesting {{/api/v2/code_stats/?app_id={APP_ID}}} for every change on PRDItem (Title, Description, Acceptance Criteria, etc). Which we should avoid
column114:
* Remove the duplicate requests on the {{/api/v2/code_stats/?app_id={APP_ID}}} endpoint.
* Do not request {{/api/v2/code_stats/?app_id={APP_ID}}} when PRDItem fields change on FE (Title, Description, Acceptance Criteria, etc).

column1: BE: Improve performance on GET requests on Milestone and Task endpoints as they are too slow.
column33:
When the FE first loads the tasks pages it makes a GET request to {{/api/v2/apps/{APP_ID}/milestones/{MILESTONE_ID}}} that takes 4+ seconds for ~20 milestones. This is too slow and should be improved if possible.

The FE also makes GET requests to {{/api/v2/tasks/?app_id={APP_ID}&ids={TASKS_IDS}}} that takes 1~2 seconds for ~6 tasks. This is too slow and should be improved if possible.
column114: * Improve the performance of the GET requests on the Milestone and Task endpoints.

column1: Added modules from Storyboard appears preview image CB pencil rocket at Studio module screen
column33:
Check that added modules from Storyboard appears preview image CB pencil rocket at Studio module screen
When User Remove any module screen from storyboard it should also get removed from the Studio.

Steps:-

# Go to [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/dashboard/accounts/login?next=%2Fdashboard%2F|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/dashboard/accounts/login?next=%2Fdashboard%2F|smart-link] .
# Enter valid registered email id and password, click on 'LOGIN' button.
# Create new mobile application.
# Click on 'STORYBOARD' button from left menu bar.
# Drag and drop module to the Chat, Onboarding, Articles, Map,login any screen module, etc on to the canvas
# Now Click on save button
# Now Go to the studio
# Observe the CB pencil rocket at module screen onto the canvas

Expected Result:

column1: Connectors - support for defining the request body schema
column33:
*Story*: As a user, I would like to define the body of my POST, PATCH and PUT requests for my connector.

*Motivation*: Today, when defining post requests, user can specify parameters, but not the request body. We must update that.

Add a new section for defining a data call request body, which asks for a Display name, a property Name, a data type, and a Required flag.

No codegen or back-end updates are required.

!image-20230201-155948.png|width=598,height=1238!

----

[*Technical Details:*|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10114]

Connectors edit panel doesn’t support specifying the request body schema for a given endpoint. This affects external connectors only, not our internal connectors (django backend).

The Connectors feature generates and manipulates a subset of an OpenAPI document, and this feature should describe the {{requestBody}} part of an {{Operation Object}} (endpoint description) item:
[https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#fixed-fields-7|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#fixed-fields-7|smart-link] 
[https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#request-body-object|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#request-body-object|smart-link] 

Refer to those examples for further guidance:
[https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#model-with-example|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#model-with-example|smart-link] 

This feature should be available for {{POST}}, {{PUT}} and {{PATCH}} data calls only:

{quote}The request body applicable for this operation. The {{requestBody}} is fully supported in HTTP methods where the HTTP 1.1 specification [[RFC7231|https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#bib-RFC7231]] has explicitly defined semantics for request bodies. In other cases where the HTTP spec is vague (such as [GET|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-4.3.1], [HEAD|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-4.3.2] and [DELETE|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-4.3.5]), {{requestBody}} is permitted but does not have well-defined semantics and _SHOULD_ be avoided if possible.

{quote}

column1: Parsing a component closure
column33:
Parse the component body (BlockStatement node) and look for variable declarations, assignments and call expressions.

Map out each of the nodes parsed with its names and meaning extracted.

Potential routines to implement here:
- find {{useState}} local import name, find references of said identifier within closure, parse them
- incorporate with {{getHooks}} that is cable of parsing i.e. {{useSelector}}
- parse callbacks, recursively find {{dispatch}} calls
- find {{useEffect}} local import name, find references of said identifier within closure, parse them (reuse/extend work made on screen events and actions)
- find module top level imports, include them in the results (special meaning on {{@modules}}, {{@store}}, {{@options}} imports, etc)

Return a map that summarizes all of the data from what we can parse in a component body.

column33:

Should ensure that there’s an assignment of the {{const dispatch = useDispatch()}} hook too.

column1: Connectors - Unify OpenAPI parsing and codegen
column33:
You’ll find below a short list of all the different places (*4 different projects*) where we are inferring data from an OpenAPI document, or generating code based on it. The common pattern here is multiple implementations of the same logic, diverging implementations, deprecated code, and more code analysis than necessary since there’s no easy way to access the same underlying data everywhere.

Names transformations:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/openapi/utils.js#L9-L24|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/openapi/utils.js#L9-L24]
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/utils/openapi.js#L6-L23|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/utils/openapi.js#L6-L23]

Converting/Dereferencing/Bundling OpenAPI documents:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/openapi/api.js#L1-L63|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/openapi/api.js#L1-L63]

Model parsing:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/openapi/parser.js#L180-L200|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/openapi/parser.js#L180-L200]

[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/dashboard/src/components/CbDashboard/Plugins/EditPlugin.vue#L324-L349|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/dashboard/src/components/CbDashboard/Plugins/EditPlugin.vue#L324-L349]

Assumptions on where to find Redux code:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/scaffold/index.ts#L73|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fbc76d447d783befd2543eb9665e06f5d04c7701/codegen/src/scaffold/index.ts#L73]

Deprecated implementations:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/openapi/openapi.js#L1-L192|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/openapi/openapi.js#L1-L192]
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/openapi/state.js#L1-L34|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/openapi/state.js#L1-L34]
column114:
Produce an OpenAPI parsing library, backed by unit tests, that is shared across all of our projects and where it’s parsing output is regarded as the single source of truth.

The library should produce the final transformed data that we need such as the inferred Redux reducer consequent triplets (pending, rejected, fulfilled) names, action creator names, data model names, etc. Here’s a tentative list of the data it should produce given a document:
- Authentication details (securitySchemes)
- Base URL
- Data Models names and fields (including types)
- Redux Action Creator names (map of actions and data models)
- Connector service info (base url, name of the service, etc) for generating a {{feth}} helper function

Refactor all the OpenAPI-dependent features to make use of the library. Reduce the amounts of code analysis performed in places where we can assume that the connectors have generated Redux code backing up the document’s description.

column1: Actions - Extend getReduxActions to include Data Models data
column33:
The new data model selector will show a list of actions for a given Data Model. That data is missing in the current {{getReduxActions}} output.

By parsing {{paths[endpoint].requestBody.content["application/json"].schema.ref}} we can infer the Data Model name for any given action. Create a map of actions and data models that we can use for returning in the action output.

column1: Release payment on Upwork for the approved task
column33:
As Subtask is approved by the customer and moved to Done then Upwork Service App Milestone will be schedule to release and Heroku Scheduler will release it. 
While releasing those milestones, The Ballpark milestone will be updated to  release payment milestone and will create a new Ballpark milestone with remaining subtasks. 
Once we have the payment milestone and that can be activate and approved. 

Lets consider a scenario, There are two milestone that are approved on CB-Dashboard then on Upwork Service App those milestone will be schedule to release status.
We aggregate the amount for those milestone and update Ballpark milestone as payment milestone and create a new Ballpark Milestone.
column114:
Release the payment for those subtask that are done on CB-Dashboard 
Create a new Ballpark Milestone with remaining {{In progress}} Subtask.
column226: Upwork New Payment Plan for freelancers.

column1: Task Page / Bulk Updates / Dynamically Updated Estimated Delivery Dates
column33:
*Description*

In the “In Development” section of the Task page, we should help PMs make less manual updates by dynamically updating estimated delivery dates. 

The issue is that Estimated Delivery Dates are automatically set after *scoping is confirmed* on a project. However, the client rarely pays immediately after scoping. And work doesn’t begin until the client pays. So this *gap between when scoping is confirmed and when the client pays* is what we need to account for with dynamically-updated estimated delivery dates. 

For now, we can dynamically update this date only after the client pays if that’s easiest.

*Example:*

I’m a client, and we estimate that the work for my proposal will take 20 days. It’s February 1st, so the estimated date based on completed scoping is February 20. However, I don’t pay for 5 days. In reality, the project is delayed 5 days, but our dashboard does not account for this-- the PMs have to manually make the update. Ideally, our system will *dynamically update the estimated delivery date* to, in this case, February 20th. 

*Rule:*

This is the rule that we should operate by for dynamic estimated delivery dates: Estimated Delivery Dates = Original estimation confirmed from scoping + days until client pays. Use the example above as a reference. 

This will only affect the “Estimated Delivery Date” column. 



*Conversation:*

Moving from development backlog → In Development

Currently, estimation date is locked in when customer clicks “Begin Build” on Proposal tab. It can be locked in *before* that if the sales team manually locks in the dates. 

Note: “begin build” no longer tied to payment

Date is locked in *when* project moves to in-development

Have date editable in backlog, *before* it moves to in-development

Including text that “dates are dependent on timely payment and subject to change” → is this language in check out? Anywhere? *making customer aware* 

Showing dates in proposal even if they aren’t locked in? Theme: *communicating expectations w/ customer*

If something is “In Development”, then first milestone delivery date would not have the week-long buffer intended to reflect the time it takes to staff the team? (technical point) [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] 

May want to re-examine original formula that went into comprising delivery dates… likely separate ticket, with one eye toward automation

Cron job-- how often are we running to update this information?

Proposed change: Allow estimated delivery date to continue to be editable & float with current date, after begin build, after check out, into development backlog, *until* HR moves milestone into development, *then* it locks in the date (with a nice prompt confirming this permanent estimation)
column114:
Our dashboard will dynamically update estimated delivery dates, based on the following rule:

The estimated delivery date = original estimated delivery date set after scoping is complete *+* number of days until client pays. 

So, if scoping is complete on March 1st, and the estimated delivery date is May 1st, but the client doesn’t pay until March 10th, then the estimated delivery date will dynamically update to May 10th. 

The estimated delivery date in the “In Development” tab of the Task page will dynamically update based on when the client pays and the project moves to “In Development”
column193: 28/Feb/23 7:36 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;Note: *sidelining this ticket, under the assumption that delivery team is changing operations and moving to sprint-based development*

column1: Task page / Bulk Updates / Global role assignment
column33:
*Description*

PMs spend way too long-- literally multiple hours and hundreds of clicks-- manually updating the “In Development” section of the Task page. This manual process of updating tasks/subtasks can instead be done in “bulk” to save time. 

One important aspect of this involves assigning team members to roles. Typically, the same team members will have the same role for every task/subtask on a project. For example, the FE Dev will be the FE Dev on every single task. However, the PM still has to *_manually assign_* the same individual to every single task. We can solve this-- in addition to creating other benefits-- with a “Global Role Assignment”. 

*Implementation: Global role assignment*

The Global Role Assignment-- a feature that will appear at the top of the task page-- will allow PMs to assign team members to job types that will *auto-populate* for every single task correlating to that job type. For example, if a PM assigns Himanshu Sharma to FE Dev using Global role assignment, then Himanshu will *automatically be assigned to every subtask/task for FE Devs* listed in the “In Development” section of the Task page. 

PMs will still have the ability to manually adjust assignments after Global Role Assignment has auto-populated the tasks/subtasks. However, this will save them loads of time regardless. 

Permissions for who has access to Global Role Assignment will remain the same as for those who currently have permissions to assign team members to tasks. 

*Tooltip*

There will be a tooltip placed next to Global Role Assignment, which will help explain this feature. The tooltip will read: “Global role assignments will help you automatically assign one team member to every task/subtask in the project based on their job title. Assignments can still be manually adjusted as needed.”

*State Changes-- “Update” button*

# Before any activity
## Before any activity, the “Update” button will appear greyed-out, non clickable. When you hover-over, the hoverover text will read “Assign Team Members to global role assignment to update”
# After assigning team members, before saving
## After you assign someone to a role using Global Role Assignments, the “Update” button will light up with color and appear clickable, indicating that it is time to save your changes if you wish. 
# After confirming changes by clicking “update”
## The “Update” button will change to “Confirmed”, ideally in green with a check mark
# Editing roles after previous confirmation
## If you then make further adjustments to Global Role Assignment after previously saving your confirmation, then the “Update” button will again appear reading “Update”-- whereas previously it read “Confirmed”, and will again be clickable. The button will dynamically change from “Confirmed” to “Update” the moment an edit is made

*Confirm Update Pop Up*

When a PM clicks to confirm an update to Global Role Assignments, we will show a pop up informing them of what they are about to do. The pop up will read: “Clicking “confirm” will automatically assign the selected team members to every single task/subtask associated with their job type. Previous manual assignments will be overridden upon confirmation”. Below the description, the user will have two options: 1) *Confirm* and 2) *Go Back*

Obviously, if they confirm, then the changes are confirmed and implemented. If they go back, then nothing is saved and the pop up closes. 

*Removing Team Members from Global Role Assignment*

A PM will have the ability to remove Team Members that they have added to Global Role Assignment. This can be done at any time by selecting an “X” next to their name (or whatever UI we’re currently using). The “X” will only appear *after* a team member has been added to a role in Global Role Assignment. 

This is only for the case that a Team Member has been assigned to Global Role Assignment. If a PM then deletes that person from their assignment, using the “x”, a pop up will appear saying: 

“Removing a Team Member from Global Role Assignment will not affect previous assignments made. If you wish to “clear” all assignments for a specific job-type, select “clear all” after the Team Member has been removed”. There will then be two options 1) *Continue* or 2) *Go Back*

+If a Team Member was previously assigned to a role, is then removed,+ +*_then_*+ +the PM will have the option to click “Clear All” to remove every single assignment for that specific job type. If they click “Clear All”, another pop up will emerge:+

“You selected “Clear All”. This will remove every single assignment made for a given job type. If you do not wish to remove every assignment for this job type at once, then make changes manually.” There will then be two options: 1) *Confirm Clear All* and 2) *Go Back*
column97: 31/Jan/23 8:59 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;Really bad Mock Up for Bulk Updates Global Role Assignment.HEIC;https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/21241
column114:
* The Global role assignment interface will appear at the top of the “In Development” section of the task page
* There will be a tooltip explaining what this feature does (see above)
* When a PM assigns a team member to a task using Global Role Assignment, that team member will automatically be assigned to every single task/subtask listed on the “In Development” page as it corresponds to their job type. 
* PMs will be able to remove an individual from Global Role Assignment-- this by itself will *not* change any current assignments. If a PM wishes to “clear” assignments for all job types, then they will do so using the “Clear All” option *after* an individual is removed from a Global Role Assignment
* The “Update” button will dynamically reflect the correct state of this feature according to the rules described above 
* The correct pop ups will appear when making important changes on this interface as described above

column1: Contextual Data Models in Save Data Modal
column33:
Show contextual data models in the “Save Data” modal and allow drag/drop into the inputs.

!image-20230131-153718.png|width=598,height=322!

column1: Contextual Data Models
column33:
A component should allow the user to see what data is available to it from global data or parent component data. This will allow a component within a flatlist within a screen to have access to the data from the screen.  Note: we may need an additional ticket or subtask related to getting the contextual data models and location.

The contextual data models will display the same as “All Data Models” and show a list of models that can be expanded to see the properties for the data model.

If additional data is needed then the user can click the plus button next to the “Contextual Data Models” title and choose an additional dataset from the list of all data models. When this is done, it will add an additional Event and Action to the “Events” section for the active component to get this data “onRender” or “onLoad”.

!image-20230131-144104.png|width=247,height=174!

Note: the design of the hierarchy list tree should utilize the style implemented with the UX ticket [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10079|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10079|smart-link] 

Additional details and notes available here: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Databinding-Continued-273b798cdd2c4fec9785c020d78774a5#ab46c990ccf64ecda8bf3b69e3ff52e0|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Databinding-Continued-273b798cdd2c4fec9785c020d78774a5#ab46c990ccf64ecda8bf3b69e3ff52e0]

column1: Updated Data Models section
column33:
The new Data section will contain subsections for Parameters, Contextual Data Models, and All Data Models.

column1: Create /Update Ballpark Milestone for each Upwork Contract
column33:
We can create a {{Ballpark milestone}}(Virtual Milestone) on Upwork based on the task moved into {{In-Progress}}  and Update it if any further task moved into {{In-Progress}} . 

Let consider a scenario when a dev onboarded into the project and assigned few tasks on CB-Dashboard then PM moved few task status from {{Todo}} to {{In-Progress}} then system creates an Milestone for each task on our {{Upwork Service App}} where we have Heroku Scheduler that runs daily to create the {{Ballpark Milestone}} on {{Upwork}} with those task that moved into {{In-Progress}} and Update it if any further task moved into {{In-Progress}} so this {{Ballpark milestone}} always reflect the estimated amount that dev is going to receive if they complete all those assigned task. 

NOTE:  We call {{Ballpark Milestone}} or Virtual Milestone as this is estimate amount we are going to pay that freelancer. This {{Ballpark Milestone}}  amount will be updated daily with the total amount of task assigned on our {{CB-Dashboard}}.
column114: The {{Ballpark Milestone}} should be created on Upwork and descriptions should contains {{Subtask ID}} of all task that currently {{In-Progress}} status.
column226: Upwork New Payment Plan for freelancers.

column1: Fix test coverage on model builder lambda service
column33:
Tests were always failing on model builder service. Few changes were required, such as pinning the Python version to be the same as used in the model builder (3.8): [https://github.com/crowdbotics/modelbuilder-lambda/pull/58|https://github.com/crowdbotics/modelbuilder-lambda/pull/58|smart-link] 

The tests now run completely, but {{pytests-cov }}is creating the report incorrectly (you can add debugger and you will see that the lines it report not covered are actually properly tested).

After some research, I found that it appears branch coverage has ongoing concurrency issues (such as imports loaded before the test are not counted for coverage): [https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/issues/605#issuecomment-1403777502|https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/issues/605#issuecomment-1403777502|smart-link] 



The expectation of this ticket is for testing pipeline to be reliable. You can either:

# figure out a way to resolve the issue with `{{pytest-cov}} (perhaps a package bump or downgrade could help: [https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/409|https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/409|smart-link] )
# Use something else, like coverage separately and make it work
# Or remove coverage report or branch support and only assume that all tests must pass

column1: module selector as dropdown/popover in menu. Fix Loading Spinners
column33:
Show the module selector panel as a dropdown popover.  Allow modules to be dragged into the canvas.  The popover should stay open when modules are dragged in and close when the user clicks on the menu icon again.  This functionality should also be applied to the additional components and screens dropdown popovers.

Extras:

* Consolidated all Loading Spinners into the central LoadingOverlay reusable component that is adaptable to screen and when placed in a container. Ensured existing Loading Spinners works as before.
* Aligned the icons on the top Toolbar to get rid of some extra awkward padding and whitespace.

!image-20230206-221439.png|width=429,height=634!

[https://www.loom.com/share/0c88468888024087a9e4146928f75657|https://www.loom.com/share/0c88468888024087a9e4146928f75657|smart-link] 

Testing:

* Open the modules popover and see the centered loading spinner. Click and drag modules onto the canvas to create new screens
* Check all the loading spinners are same as before
* Look at the top menu toolbar to see the icons work as before but is better aligned.
* Ensure all dropdowns works as before.

column1: New Collapsible subsection panels
column33:
All subsections will be collapsible independently (EG not an accordion). The sections will be displayed as the mockup shows.

If a panel is hovered the title box will display a light blue background.

Also, add an “action” button option to the right of the collapsible so that you can have quick actions (Like add screen) on the right of the collapsable at any time. 

Memoize this component to make it performant.

Provide ability to pass in other props with rest

Move the information tool tip to the right of the Settings title

Refactor some of the TS if possible

!image-20230130-142901.png|width=217,height=341!

!image-20230210-162526.png|width=289,height=249!



----

*Technical details:* Make sure this toggle panel is a component that can be reused. Colors must all follow our defined variables. A big part of this ticket will be to better unify the “Settings“ panels (Shape, Text, AdditionalComponent, etc) and just enable/disable a section based on availability of the property.

Sections to be replaced with this Collapsible format are: Screen Details, Screen Route Parameters, Add Screen,  Flax Layout System, Alignment, Size & Position, Colors, Pressable, Advanced Settings.

column1: Canvas and Panel layout
column33:
Studio will be displayed as two panels with the canvas in the middle.  This removes the unnecessary padding.  Remove the footer that contains “Studio beta” tab.

The left panel will be for navigation purposes and will contain the same sections as the slide-out panel.

The right panel will contain all “Details” sections.

The left and right panels can be scrolled independently.

!image-20230130-142646.png|width=1408,height=690!
column114:
* Left Panel should show Screen Options, Component Tree, and Datamodels. 
* The right panel will show modules toolbar panel when no screens are selected to encourage users to build modules fast.
* Selecting Shapes, Text, Media, Components, and Prefab will show the pertinent setting screens.
* Restyle the settings into their own collapsible sections. 
* Expanding the sections past the y boundaries of the toolbar panels will transition into a scrolling side panel.
* Realign all the sections of the settings content with a universal class so that we can easy change the spacing in the future. Removed unneeded and awkward styling.
* Align all the individual content of the settings so everything is spaced properly
* Removed and improved on some existing settings like changing absolute value to a switch box and aligning the color settings into a horizontal line, change icons into ! circle …etc
* Created a new settings for Events and Action to contain Pressable and the Screen within Screen view when pressable is enabled
* Moved add screen icon to a better location.
* Removed Beta badge and increased the size of all the working areas of studio.
* Removed showNavTree button as it always show now
* Added some text to prompt selecting a Shape, Text, … etc when the top left settings nav is selected but no object is selected
* Added some box shadow to the panels and top toolbar and other styling upgrades
* Removed some awkward margining in the modules screen due to using Col
* Note that ModulesProperty screen is also upgrade though I can’t currently see when that is enabled. It should still follow original logic

column1: Top Menu bar and Studio menu merge
column33:
h2. UI/UX changes required to update the top menu.  Mockup:

!image-20230206-154703.png|width=1161,height=367!

* Move the app selector to the center of the top panel
* Move the studio menu to the top bar.  This may require utilizing relative positioning and overlaying the menu visually.  The top bar is in Vue.js and the studio menu is in React.js.
* Remove the undo/redo buttons
* Move the save button to be to the right of the studio menu.  When save is required (edits have been made) make the save button turn blue instead of darker grey.  Make the icon have an animation that pulses grey to blue.

!image-20230206-154540.png|width=1709,height=441!

h2. Global app top menu changes. Mockup:

!image-20230206-155332.png|width=1682,height=189!

!image-20230227-213136.png|width=1665,height=461!

* Remove the “Title bar” and show the title in place of the studio menu on all other pages.
* Move the page title to the top bar.
* This will displace the following elements:

column1: Data Call Editor
column33:
The query editor “Add Data Call” has a list of data models which must be selected from.

Once a model is selected it enables a list of queries.

Once a query is selected the query parameters list control is enabled. If we are able to populate the parameters then we will show all the parameters that are required here. If they cannot be populated then the user will have to manually do it.

Clicking the plus button adds an additional parameter and works like the current “Params” options.

When the user is done they click the Save button and the “Data Model” section in the flatlist details panel is updated to show the data model and query.

This is accessed from any “get data” Event from any component from [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10053|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10053|smart-link] 

!Untitled.png|width=250,height=231!

column1: Flatlist - Data Model selector
column33:
Flatlist requires a dataset so we will display a dropdown with a list of available Data Models and an option for “No Databound”.

“Not Databound” works as it does now where the user can set the array size and data. We will not be changing this. 

-The user will select query options, we will infer the necessary parameters where possible, otherwise the user may be required to utilize the query builder.-

-We will highlight the query dropdown in red if we cannot infer the parameter.- Moved to [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10237|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10237|smart-link] 

Clicking the “Edit” icon opens the “Add Data Call” (query editor) modal. Clicking “Delete” icon deletes the data model and query and shows a confirmation modal.

Query editor ticket: [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10067|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10067|smart-link] 

!image-20230130-033627.png|width=346,height=70!



*NEW IMPLEMENTATION:*

Flatlist requires a dataset so we will display a dropdown with a list of available Data Models and an option for “No Data Model”.

“No Data Model” works as it does now where the user can set the array size and data. We will not be changing this. 

The user can set a Data Model if they are available and we will generate the corresponding useSelector for him and will set the Flatlist data property field to match the selected Data Model.

If the user needs databinding capabilities he should update the flatlist’s renderItem prop manually to add the “item” between curly braces as a parameter for the function to execute. Something similar to:

renderItem={{color:#ff5630}({item}){color} => <View style={…. }

After this the user is able to use the item for databinding, so he can drop a text element to the flatlist and bind it to for example {item.username} being usermane a field from the selected Data Model.
Video of the current implementation:


!test2 (5582b155-0868-4b06-b5cd-669c29619a6d).mp4|width=1536,height=864!

column1: Fixing model-builder tasks and prepare prod release
column33:
I identified that model builder hasn’t been released in a while, and this is causing all sorts of issues, including lack of support for open API specification parsing, which is needed for Studio.

Additionally, there has been some misconception that some people merged code to the main branch directly, causing the main branch to be broken.



This task is to:

* Fix the tests
* Sync main with dev (deploy what is in main also in dev)
* With dev deployed and working, prepare a main(prod) release
* Document this process to the main repo
* Create follow up tickets for enhancing the flow (protect main branch in some way, possibly change the deployment flow, whatever works to avoid confusion).

column1: Upwork New Payment Plan for freelancers.
column33:
Currently in our system, When sub-task moved from {{Todo}} to {{In-Progress}} in CB Dashboard. We create a milestone on our Upwork Service App and also create milestone on Upwork. For a single contract the could be same no of milestone on Upwork no. of subtask assigned to freelancer. 
Upwork has limitation to release the milestone in same order as they are created however in reality dev can finish the task in order so releasing the payment for {{Done}} task get blocked until all the previous task moved to {{Done}}  

The issue that we're running into, when trying to pay our outside contractors, is that if they have marked done task #3, but task #1 remains open, we are unable to pay for task #3 via platform.  That is driving an uncontrolled workaround, which is HubSpot tickets asking the HR/Billing teams to manually release payment.  Solving this out of order payment issue will allow the team to push all requests for additional hours into platform, where we have a lot more control and visibility.


To get rid of this  milestone releasing issue on Upwork.
After freelancers onboarding,

* PM assign a task on {{CB-Dashboard}} and move the task status from {{Todo}} to {{In Progress}}. Milestone will be created on Our {{Upwork Service App}} not on {{Upwork Platform}}.  (Upwork Service App which tracks the payments for Upwork freelancers)

* Let say today {{5 tasks}} moved into {{In Progress}} status then on our {{Upwork Service App}}, daily scheduled celery task will create {{Ballpark Milestone}} with the total amount of those {{5 tasks}} on {{Upwork Platform}} and

we call this {{Ballpark Milestone}} as this is estimate amount we are going to pay that freelancer. This {{Ballpark Milestone}} will be updated daily with the total hours of task assigned on our {{CB-Dashboard}}.

* Next day, if {{2 tasks}} moved into {{In Progress}} status, then our {{Upwork Service App}} will update the {{Ballpark Milestone}} with the total amount of these {{2 tasks}} and previous {{5 tasks}} on {{Upwork Platform}}.

* Let say if {{3 tasks}} moved into {{Done}} and approved by client on our {{CB-Dashboard}}. Then on our {{Upwork Service App}}, respective Milestone status will be {{scheduled to release}}. 

{{Upwork Service App}} Celery job We will calculate the total hours of those {{3}} scheduled to release tasks.

* Edit the {{Ballpark Milestone}} descriptions with those scheduled to release task ID and amount = total amount of those three {{3 tasks}} lets call this as {{Task Milestone}}. and then
* Create a new {{Ballpark Milestone}} with the remaining total tasks amount.
* Activate the {{Task milestone}}
* Approve the {{Task milestone}}

This will help to get rid of this milestone reordering issue. I’ve tested out the flow and it working fine.

*Feedback* 
From Anand: 
We could use a safeguard to avoid radical overpayments or allow a human review on our {{Upwork Service App}}, at least during burn inFeed

From Adam: 
When clients move a milestones from "needs approval" to "approved". I would set up a review by the PM. the PM needs to confirm that all subtasks are assigned to the right person and approve.

* Its one final step to ensure we pay the correct dev.


Slack Thread: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674151927303899|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674151927303899|smart-link]

column1: App template pop-up shows up in PRD tab for a project with PRD groups
column33:
An internal user (CSM) visited the PRD tab for this app: [https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/36999/tasks|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/36999/tasks] in production. This user was not added as a team member to the project (Eduardo mentions in [this slack thread|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674772554613169] why the user had a permission error). And when this user clicks on the PRD tab, they see the app template pop-up:

!Screen Shot 2023-01-26 at 6.53.18 PM.png|width=1287,height=724!

When I visit the PRD tab as a superuser, I see that the [PRD|https://app.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/36999/tasks?tab=PRD] has a items, as in screenshot below:

!Screen Shot 2023-01-26 at 6.54.17 PM.png|width=1188,height=648!



We don’t expect any app template pop-up to show up if the PRD has items.

column1: After removing Screens, Studio sends PUT request to the deleted ones too
column33:
1- Create app
2- Add a few Screens
3- Save 
4- Wait for them to be installed ( if needed )
5- Reload Studio → Delete some of them → Save.
6- Wait for them to be removed ( if needed ).
7- Add new Screens → Save : 
An error will arise.

If you check the network Tab, there are some PUT requests being done to the already removed Screens. I believe that this issue could be solved in[ PLAT-10022|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10022]

column1: FE - Use Django IDs for edges
column33:
The id used for edges is not the actual edge id (to access the resource, we need to send a request with edge_id value, but that is not what this field is supposed to be used for.

The endpoint to access edges should probably just use the Django id property (versus edge_id, which is something else)

* If necessary, we can rename edge_id to something else, to avoid confusion. This is the React Flow aka Canvas identifier, not the database identifier).
column114: Edges endpoint id should be Django id instead of edge_id (e.g.{{ /v2/edges/1/ }}instead of {{/v2/edges/dfgfgh4e54534dfgdfh235346/}})

column1: Network Operations Center (NOC)
column33:
The issue is more about governance/supportability →  

What happens to the supportability of the app of what someone builds? 

If that person leaves, who then supports it? 

Back ending that scenario into the the IT processes is the issue.

----

+*Solution*+

NOC (Network Operations Center) which monitors - and can respond to escalations on - customer applications.

----

column33:
Environment: All

column1: Generalize "Pressable" UX and codegen to support a map of events and actions
column33:
Change the UI below: 

!image-20230126-174203.png|width=41.66666666666667%,alt="Pressable in the Left panel"!

And:

* Remove the “Screens Within App“ Panel below data models

!image-20230126-180730.png|width=246,height=141!



* Replace the “Screens Within App“ dropdown below “Pressable” toggle with a more generic UI seen below. The dropdowns will be automatically populated with the values:
** Event: onPress
** Action: navigate (or “navigate to screen”)
!image-20230126-014931.png|width=50%!
(Note: we will have more options, so make sure code is flexible). 
* When clicking in the edit button, a popup will show up with an option for the user to select the desired screen to navigate and the parameters they want to pass.

!image-20230126-180440.png|width=534,height=464!



(The form inputs above must be properly aligned in the modal, the mockup is just an example)



Later on, we will support different event types and respective actions. This would support the “set a button to submit data using this redux action” use case. See:

[https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Databinding-Continued-273b798cdd2c4fec9785c020d78774a5#a4d88f74ee43407d8e2905b22d3bd590|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Databinding-Continued-273b798cdd2c4fec9785c020d78774a5#a4d88f74ee43407d8e2905b22d3bd590]

column193:
29/Jan/23 7:51 PM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;I think the design is fine and we can use a modal for now.  In the near future we’ll have the collapsible panels and that will allow this modal content to be incorporated into the details as an “Events and Actions” section.  I think modals are needed if we need to do workflow-like actions that require saving, connecting, submitting, etc.  

For this example: If we can do all the functionality shown in this modal without the need to have a “save” button it would be fine to put it in the details.  If save is needed after the selections, then it would go better in a modal.

column1: Action - addUseSelector doesn't respect closures
column33:
*From*: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Some-studio-bugs-and-issues-e9b7615b5ae94107b87624a6ceb520a3#811f9adad95744eeba5bccd65ea63c1b|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Some-studio-bugs-and-issues-e9b7615b5ae94107b87624a6ceb520a3#811f9adad95744eeba5bccd65ea63c1b]

_Codegen for {user.email} databinding generates the useSelector in the default export component of the screen._

This is a major problem that applies to other features. We need to be much more careful with *_closures_*.

As identified here: [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9850|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9850|smart-link] 

{quote}Another related issue is that the navigation call disregards the component signature. If navigation is not one of the destructured props then it must be called from the single parameter in the signature (commonly it is named params, but one should read the name instead of assuming it). This means that it should generate params.navigation.navigate… instead of navigation.navigate….{quote}

We need to pass down props to the nested components otherwise calls against {{navigation}} are out of scope. Same thing for the {{user}} which is assigned in the parent component to {{const user = useSelector(...)}}.

There’s 2 major problems that we need to fix:

* Be more precise on targetting either default export or the nested component when doing code transforms.
* *Don’t assume that everything is available in the current closure* and actually look at the current component signature to decide whether it needs to be passed down or not. If it does then a code transform for the element reference should be done too such as going from {{<NestedComponent/>}} to {{<NestedComponent navigation={navigation} user={user}/>}}

It now supports any kind of component and export since it uses the currently targeted JSX element to find out its parent component.

[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/actions/utils.ts#L146|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/c3f0b42de951a87eba4637db8cc7e01d03e4cadf/codegen/src/actions/utils.ts#L146]

Which is pending merge on this PR:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/pull/3496|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/pull/3496|smart-link] 

This should solve the first bullet item in the major problems list above.

column1: Dashboard has approximate 55K task/subtasks without milestone
column33:
In the crowdbotics_task table there are approx 55K tasks/subtasks that do not have a milestone ID. They are essentially orphan tasks/subtasks without a milestone. These are all non-archived.

Slack Thread: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674042281154419|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674042281154419|smart-link] 



One possible cause of this is that deleting a Milestone that have child tasks and subtasks will not update their respective is_archived fields to True. And will just remove its own FK on them, because we are deleting the milestone from the DB.



*Proposed solution*: Add is_archived field on Milestone, when milestone is archived all its tasks and subtasks should be archived as well.

column1: Send FE numbers for app cost and timeline in Finalize with Expert event
column33:
We are doing a hotfix that shows the values for Basic App Cost and Estimated Delivery Timeline as 0.35 times of their real value. This hotfix is an FE change (see [PLAT-10039|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10039]). 

*For the Finalize with Expert event:* can we make sure that we send the FE-based (i.e. display) values for the following to Segment and Hubpsot:

estimated_app_cost_low
estimated_app_cost_high
estimated_timeline_low
estimated_timeline_high

column1: Hotfix for price ranges in PRD
column33:
All changes below are UI / FE changes. 

*Basic App Cost in PRD tab :*

* Display low app cost value as 0.35 times the real value.
* Display high app cost value as 0.35 times the real value.

*Estimated Delivery Timeline in PRD tab:*

* Display low estimated timeline value as 0.35 times the real value.
* Display high estimated timeline value as 0.35 times the real value.

*Price column in the PRD:*

* Hide price for Features (aka PRD groups) and Modules (aka PRD items) in PRD.
column114:
* Display price for both the low and high Basic App Cost should be 0.35 times their real value.
* Display timeline for both the low and Estimated Delivery Timeline should be 0.35 times their real value.
* The price column in the PRD should be hidden - we should not be able to see price for features of modules if the PRD is expanded.

column1: UI Updates to Studio Canvas Connections
column33:
The goal of this ticket is to improve some of the canvas of Studio and make elements  more visually distinct. We have done a similar update before, but there has been a feedback that users struggle to connect screens.

Take inspiration from Storyboard. Example: [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/23757/storyboard|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.crowdbotics.com/dashboard/app/23757/storyboard]

* Update the arrows /edges/connections to use the {{teriaryColor}} in our palette ( value as: [css|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fc9a671118f65a4afabe60f20bcda10ff2903d71/dashboard/src/styles/vars.scss#L4],  js [variable|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/fc9a671118f65a4afabe60f20bcda10ff2903d71/studio/src/direflow/studio/styles/variables.ts#L8])
* Make the arrow thicker (perhaps 4 or 5, but test and see what works best): [https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/0f883feacedb47cb995196ec98bdc0b874ff6109/studio/src/direflow/studio/components/ScreensView/StudioCanvas.tsx#L93-L101|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/0f883feacedb47cb995196ec98bdc0b874ff6109/studio/src/direflow/studio/components/ScreensView/StudioCanvas.tsx#L93-L101]
* Handles/connecting ports must be aligned
* Handles should increase from 15px to 20px
* When dropping an arrow to a handle, the green color needs to be our {{greenColor}} in the palette (use the defined variable instead of direct HEX number) (check gif)
* make the delete button appear on top of the arrow (check gif)

!image-20230124-184528.png|width=1011,height=923!

!Peek 2023-01-24 13-34-20230124-183423.gif|width=640,height=421!



Request made by Anand [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/CA0JAJQEP/p1674009291291619?thread_ts=1673982226.480339&cid=CA0JAJQEP|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/CA0JAJQEP/p1674009291291619?thread_ts=1673982226.480339&cid=CA0JAJQEP|smart-link]  (and some other PMs in the product bugs channel as well).
column114:
* Arrows are thicker
* Arrows have our tertiaryColor ({{ea5f57}})
* Connection ports (handles) are width: 20px  x 20px
* Connection ports are aligned to the border of the screen, not inside of it).
* Validation color is the same as our green color ({{#4caf50}})
* Delete button looks “in front“ of the arrow, not behind it

column226: Add retry logic < Heroku / terraform > Intermittent issue

column1: Investigate the cause of the intermittent issues
column193:
31/Jan/23 9:03 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;Looking at the terraform logic, it happens that the two resources are created in parallel i.e postgres addon and backup_schedule addon. But since the latter finishes faster than postgres addon, it is not able to find the database to create a backup schedulr for.

[https://github.com/crowdbotics/project-deploy/blob/master/terraform/heroku/production/main.tf#L35|https://github.com/crowdbotics/project-deploy/blob/master/terraform/heroku/production/main.tf#L35] 

[~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835] Can confirm this is the case.
column194: 31/Jan/23 9:11 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;Yes, i think this is the case. We had this issue with GCP as well, like infrastructure provisioned in paralle. We fixed that with this dependecy method, to make those steps sequential
column226: Add retry logic < Heroku / terraform > Intermittent issue

column114:
Add a new section/table to the Status tab for Project Team

The Project Team table contains

* A dropdown list of all Tasks based on Milestone;
** Each task will have it’s current status displayed as well as any comments left by members of the project team, and a call to action button in the last column based on the status of that task
** Ex.: if Milestone A, Task 1 status = “Needs Approval”, then the call to action button associated with Task 1 will be “Approve” (if the person is indeed the customer who needs to approve it).

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
if it is too technically onerous to differentiate call to action buttons based on the status of a specific task, then all call to action buttons can be “View” for all tasks, but the milestone call to action button will be “View Timeline”
{panel}

* The Milestone row will depict the number of tasks in each tab on the Tasks page:
** Backlog
** Pending Payment
** In Development
** Needs Approval
** Delivered
* Hovering over a specific Comment will reveal a tooltip allowing you to reply to that comment

column196: 03/Feb/23 2:44 AM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] I mean how we assign job title to each member?
column198: 03/Feb/23 8:09 AM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] So it should be editabled and also passed during invitation?
column199: 03/Feb/23 8:12 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] Yes, it should be editable by PMs, and in the future, passed during the invitation. Right now we don’t have an option to select job title included in invitation to invite Team Member, but may choose to do that soon.
column200: 03/Feb/23 8:12 AM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] So if we do not pass it during invitation, which value it will have for newly invited members?
column201: 03/Feb/23 8:13 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;I think we have this request (job title on invite) documented on [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9967|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9967|smart-link] but we are working on [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9873|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9873|smart-link]  which does not have that.
column202: 03/Feb/23 8:15 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] Currently if you do not provide the job_title on during invitation, the member will try to use the default job title they have assigned (needs to be maintained on the admin for each user) if that is also not available it will be empty (not assigned).
column203: 03/Feb/23 8:16 AM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] So, job_title will have some valid id in any way, right?
column204:
03/Feb/23 8:17 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] Yeah, [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] is right.

I think, for sake of time, the best solution will be to select job title when inviting new team member, and then also allow job title to be edited thereafter-- Eduardo I’ll reach out to you to chat about this. Just have some questions about if storing values for existing CB contractors.
column205:
03/Feb/23 8:17 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] yep valid ids will be listed on: 

GET {{/api/v2/job_titles}}
column206: 03/Feb/23 8:18 AM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] This is a good point, what about existing ones, they will have some valid id too?
column207:
03/Feb/23 8:22 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;I think for existing users, before this update, they should not have a assigned job_title until someone assigns it.

I don’t think the effort to come up with a migration that would find the most appropriate job_title for each project member is justifiable.
column208: 03/Feb/23 8:26 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] agreed

column1: Create K8s manifests for Model-builder.
column33:
Kubernetes manifests are YAML files that describe each component or resource of your deployment and the state you want your cluster to be in once applied. 

For Dependency runner, we can have.

* {{deployment.yaml}}
* {{configmap.yaml}} for environment variables
* {{secrets.yaml}} for any sensitive information
* {{services.yaml}} this will help in making the service discoverable by other services in the cluster
column114: A working version of the Model-builder service that is deployed using K8s. Once invoked, it should return the same results as if it was deployed using {{docker-compose}}

column1: Add all the required supporting services to cb-slack-app docker-compose file
column33:
The current {{docker-compose.override.yaml}} that is found here [https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/blob/master/docker-compose.override.yml|https://github.com/crowdbotics/crowdbotics-slack-app/blob/master/docker-compose.override.yml|smart-link] doesn't have some supporting services included. Also, it doesn't include the services that use the lambda functions.

The required supporting services can be found in this [doc|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/SPIKE-Investigate-and-list-supporting-services-needed-to-run-CB-dash-3102fde563c247fba99aa1d55e3855c3]. The goal of this task is to have all the supporting services included in the {{docker-compose.override.yaml}}. The remaining services include:

* RabbitMQ
* CronService. Can be used to populate staging data <> local dev Postgres - [Ref|https://www.howtogeek.com/devops/how-to-use-cron-with-your-docker-containers/]
* -ElasticSearch- ← look into how much this would impact local dev’s machine given it’s size to run locally.
column114: A functional {{docker-compose.override.yaml}} which should have all these services including the existing ones.

31/Jan/23 10:40 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;adding ElasticSearch to docker image will bog down our dev’s machines.

→ Is there an alternative to running ElasticSearch locally?
column194:
31/Jan/23 10:43 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;Resolved → ElasticSearch has an operator, perhaps we deploy it in Kubernetes instead of locally.

for this task, proceed with RabbitMQ & CronService for now until we can resolve the ElasticSearch issue.

column197:
17/Feb/23 6:40 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;Just an update on this: [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] 

[~accountid:60b6618066df7900704e3a3d], and I have discussed some potential problems with this implementation. There might be a use case where Developers/Engineers might not have access to fill in all of the values within {{schedule.env. As}}. As such, the command {{docker-compose up --build}} might fail or give a negative experience.

# we will be adding conditional statements within the PR to allow for manual fetching of `media files` and `datadump.json` (In case folks do NOT have access to Heroku and/or AWS)
# We will also log a spike to the proper permissions on Heroku/AWS to give folks limited access to assets but not give them production/staging access
column198: 17/Feb/23 7:11 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;This ticket can be moved to pending release since [~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] has reviewed and tested it as well.

column1: SPIKE: Create K8s manifests for CB API
column33:
Kubernetes manifests are YAML files that describe each component or resource of your deployment and the state you want your cluster to be in once applied. 

For Crowdbotics Slack, we can have.

* {{deployment.yaml}}
* {{configmap.yaml}} for environment variables
* {{secrets.yaml}} for any sensitive information
* {{services.yaml}} this will help in making the service discoverable by other services in the cluster

column1: FE - Update multiple screens in a single request
column33:
*Motivation*: When we click *Save* on Studio, we create/delete/update screens and edges one by one to the backend, regardless if they are updated or not. There are a few issues with this approach:

* Massive sequential network requests on larger apps
* Screens that are not updated still have a request sent
column114:
Only updated screens should send an update request

Screens update should happen in a single endpoint.

column1: Add updated_on column on Milestone, TeamMemberRole, ProjectMemberRole and TaskAssignedTo
column33:
_This ticket is related to the marketplace data team._ [Reference thread|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674230958319369]

Can we please add a new column (*updated_on*) timestamp in all these tables in the production database.

# cb_slack_teammemberrole (32,515 rows)
# crowdbotics_milestone (72,056)
# crowdbotics_projectmemberrole (50,263)
# crowdbotics_task_assigned_to (35,774) - On this table maybe it would be better to add a created_on as we don’t really update it.

*Reason:* Currently we need these 4 tables in order to build our dashboards and because of no updated_on ts in these tables we are forced to take a full load on a daily basis and there are approx 200K rows combined which is turning out to be quite costly for us.
column114:
- Add respective updated_on/created_on fields on the following models:

* TeamMemberRole
* Milestone
* ProjectMemberRole
* TaskAssignedTo - We will need to define this as a through model if possible.

- Make sure we are updating them when doing:

* .save(update_fields=[])
* .update()
* And other batch operations

column1: Spike: Implement COGS measurement feature
column33:
COGS (cost of goods sold) refers to how much $$ it costs to sell a product-- in our case, this means how much money it costs to deliver an app. For us, this cost primarily consists of the money we pay to the service team, *_in addition to_* a small hosting cost. 

The goal is to provide a snapshot overview of our COGS for any given app. We already calculate this (we just don’t show it), so it shouldn’t be too hard. This is a *private* metric that will only be available to the internal team. This metric will help us first understand our costs, and then later help us measure our ability to lower them. 

Here is how I propose delivering on this metric:

* We already calculate the cost we pay to the service team
** Hourly rate x total hours
** This is available in the team page and the admin dashboard
* Show the *estimated COGS*
** The agreed upon estimation of how many total hours we will dedicate to a project (multiplied by the charge rate of the assigned service team)… taken from agreed-upon *proposal*
* Show the *actual COGS*
** The actual COGS is the *estimated COGS +* additional hours added *during development* (i.e. hours that were not accounted for in the original proposal estimates)
* To start, we only want to export this information to: (1) our data warehouse & (2) show in admin panel:
** 1) Export to data warehouse
** 2) Two columns in the admin panel for any given app (Estimated + Actual COGS)



We will be adding additional metrics to this “snapshot” feature, but for now want to just get started by showcasing COGS. Reach out with any questions. [Notion page|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Metric-Snapshot-521e5b513ade493db1af8dc98b4a7907] for reference. 



[~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] We need some help understanding how to integrate hosting costs into this calculation. I know you said it’s easy-- maybe you can shed light during refinement. 



*Discussion:*

* Charge rates not time stamped (we should see charge rates when individuals worked on specific projects) → back end
* If resources are unassigned, how can we tell who the assigned resource is? [Team page → audits of removed or churned team members! …new ticket]
* Spike? To ensure that the values are accurate
* [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] [~accountid:61084bde75ad9600691fd79f]
column114:
* On the Team Page for any give project, you should see a third tab titled “Metric Snapshots”
* Under “Metric Snapshots” you should be able to see two values
** 1) Estimated COGS (taken by multiplying total hours x respective charge rates, taken from the mutually agreed-upon PRD)
** Actual COGS (a value that will = the estimated COGS +*until*+ additional service team hours are added. Then, the “Actual COGS” will equal the “Estimated COGS” *plus* the additional hours (x charge rates). 
** *These metrics will only be available to our internal team-- not to service team or clients*
* In the admin panel for any given project, you will be able to see two columns, titled: Estimated COGS and Actual COGS. They will both show the same calculations.



cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column193: 09/Feb/23 8:19 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;Doc I started for this: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/PLAT-10019-Spike-Implement-COGS-measurement-feature-5cca6fb8916148cd90a8f3aea2cf1cf9|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/PLAT-10019-Spike-Implement-COGS-measurement-feature-5cca6fb8916148cd90a8f3aea2cf1cf9]
