column1: Spike: Evaluate our ability to integrate Jira into CB dashboard
column33:
Looking at the Task page of our dashboard, we are working to: integrate QA testing, track bugs, efficiently manage tasks/projects, etc. Essentially, what we need is a tool (like Jira) to help us manage the development of our apps efficiently & elegantly. Which gives us two options:

# *Continue to build out the Task page ourselves*
# *Integrate an existing tool (like Jira)* 

Both options have various pros & cons. While we are evaluating what makes the most sense, we need more info on what’s possible. Here are some (but not all) of the questions we are thinking about:

# Can we integrate Jira into our CB dashboard as we would an embedded tool? What is or is not possible here? I don’t think Atlassian allows this, but one ideal solution would be to “white label” Jira as our own management software-- I say this just to help show how I’m thinking about integration. 
# What are the costs of doing this at scale?
# FE vs. BE: On the FE, we would want teams to visually interact with Jira (in our dashboard) the way we do now as a product team. On the BE, we would want to be able to track/manage relevant data and ensure that our delivery/HR operations can be maintained etc. 



Overall, this doesn’t need to be an extremely deep dive; we are just trying to assess what our capabilities are to integrate a tool like Jira. Please reach out w/ any questions. 

cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]
column114: * Be able to provide insight into integrating Jira into our CB dashboard-- what possibilities are there w/ their API, how much customization would we have, pricing implications, etc. A high-level overview would be very helpful.
column193:
24/Jan/23 7:13 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;I believe the best solution would be to utilize an existing 3rd party code library in the FE and make some (likely minor) changes to our BE to support the new functionality.  The problem with using Jira or another external service is that we have to then translate data between services and we cannot customize our software to our exact needs.  

I think integrating with Jira and other software solutions would be a good thing to offer in the future, but I wouldn’t want to farm out our platform offering to another service wholesale.  Especially when we’ll be offering enterprise capabilities in our own software very soon.

There are many libraries we could easily use to show a kanban.  Here is just one of many examples: [https://codesandbox.io/s/animated-draggable-kanban-board-with-tailwind-and-vue-1ry0p?from-embed=&file=/src/components/TaskCard.vue|https://codesandbox.io/s/animated-draggable-kanban-board-with-tailwind-and-vue-1ry0p?from-embed=&file=/src/components/TaskCard.vue|smart-link]
column194: 24/Jan/23 8:49 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] I have been leaning in the same direction since I created this ticket. Given the overall vision of the company, customizability/control, ownership, and future variables (like enterprise) that will always pop up, it makes sense to me to do this internally. Helpful for me to see your thoughts, that library looks great too..

column1: QA:
column226: Use the same resource rate for pricing in PRD and Proposal tabs

column1: Update Catalog browser resource rate
column33:
*User Stories:*

* I want the Catalog browser resource rate to be the same as the current resource in project cards.
** Update the Catalog browser resource rates to be the following values:
!Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 9.53.45 AM.png|width=536,height=369!



h2. Technical

Rather than obtaining the price from the catalog’s rate card, pull the hourly rates from the rate card attached to the customer’s project.  

For each module, iterate through the tasks to obtain their hours and multiply it by the corresponding resource cost from the project’s rate card.
column114: * Catalog resource rate is the same as project card resource rates for BE, FE, PM, QA, Design and Design Support.
column226: New UI / UX for PRD tab

column1: FE:
column33:
Use the current project rate cards for pricing during PRD population, and any catalog price we display (i.e. make Catalog project aware).

* *FE:* Would need to send the current project_id to all of the catalog endpoints.

column226: Use the same resource rate for pricing in PRD and Proposal tabs

column1: Use the same resource rate for pricing in PRD and Proposal tabs
column33:
h3. User Stories:

* As a user, I want to see the same module price in the Catalog, my PRD tab and Proposal tab.
** I expect that the resource rate for any tasks will be the same in my Catalog, PRD, and Proposal.

h3. Conversation:

* Use the current project rate cards for pricing during PRD population, and any catalog price we display (i.e. make Catalog project aware).
* *BE:* From the received project_id we need to return the catalog prices using the respective JobType instead of the catalog resource.
* *FE:* Would need to send the current project_id to all of the catalog endpoints.
column114:
* A user should see the same module price in the Catalog, PRD tab, and Proposal tab.
** The resource rate for a given module should be the same in Catalog, PRD and Proposal tabs.

21/Apr/23 12:57 PM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] I created a GitHub action that mimiced the {{deploy-develop}} but just ran the build portion of it. The example job is here: 

[https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/actions/runs/4768309913/jobs/8477498255|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/actions/runs/4768309913/jobs/8477498255]



I also created a custom step called “Print linkify-html” and the output is here:

{noformat}Run yarn list --pattern linkify-html
yarn list v1.22.19
warning Resolution field "webpack@4.42.0" is incompatible with requested version "webpack@^5.54.0"
warning Resolution field "webpack@4.42.0" is incompatible with requested version "webpack@^5.54.0"

└─ linkify-html@4.1.0
Done in 1.67s.{noformat}

You can take a look at my branch if you need to [https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/tree/testing-package-json|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/tree/testing-package-json|smart-link] 



The linkify-html version in staging is indeed 4.1.0
column204: 24/Apr/23 7:52 AM;5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] can u tell me if this is getting u unblocked now.
column205: 24/Apr/23 4:58 PM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] Nope. Honestly I am out of ideas what is going on with linkify-html
column206: 26/Apr/23 10:32 AM;63bc389e49a31f95b8733476;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] is going to try reverting the package and see if it was the upgrade that broke it
column207: 27/Apr/23 2:26 PM;63bc389e49a31f95b8733476;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] I’ve merged this into master to see if it will work on staging
column208: 27/Apr/23 2:51 PM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] Feels like it fixed the issue
column209:
27/Apr/23 2:53 PM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;So I dug pretty deep into linkify-html. It goes through two passes, one through the scanner to categorize each character and one through a parser that groups the categories into “text” and “url”. I found that the parser was grouping {{/}} as {{SYM}} vs {{SLASH}}.

Then I was questioning what was going on? why was the scanner categorizing {{/}} as {{SYM}} vs {{SLASH}} 

Debugging further this is the truth table for the scanner

!image-20230427-215131.png|width=1049,height=1253!

Guess what {{SLASH}} is being overwritten somewhere within the javascript code of the library to be the cloud front URL

the symbol for {{SLASH}} is “https://https://d2j9gdkk11xzei.cloudfront.net/11608f099d080d842c20ecb16c96d191018bef2c/"

I don’t know what to say….
column210: 27/Apr/23 3:07 PM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] So it appears that version used on Heroku is corrupted somehow?
column211:
28/Apr/23 7:11 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] No it means that there’s a bug within the library based upon some timing scenario some data is overriding memory that is storing the truth table for the parsing algo.

If you upgrade or downgrade versioning, you’ll change the timing but most likely it will still exist somewhere else.

My suggestion is to not use this lib.
column212: 28/Apr/23 7:49 AM;5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31;[~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] I am a bit confused why this “timing” issue never happened locally and always happens on staging. For 4.1.0.
column213:
28/Apr/23 8:14 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] Timing is different being served from a different location. I also tested using an Online from this website [https://codesandbox.io/|https://codesandbox.io/|smart-link] 

* the packaging is different, on local machine you probably have a node_modules folder, (same like codesandbox), if you take a look at how we serve our cloudfront package, it’s packaged as app.js and chunk-version.js which isn’t the exact same code as what you are running locally
* !image-20230428-151112.png|width=1960,height=607!
There are latency issues in a local server vs getting served through an ingress controller and an s3 bucket and how they are getting download to your browser
* There’s execution differences between the code you run locally and the code that is getting served
* One situation reveals the issue, one doesn’t so there’s clearly differences
column214: 02/May/23 4:38 AM;5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910;[~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] what is your sugestion on next steps here?
column215: 03/May/23 8:00 AM;63bc389e49a31f95b8733476;I say we downgrade for now, until we can find something that works [~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31]

column1: After approving PRD, module price and tasks price are not same
column33:
When user approving a PRD, PRD module and tasks price are not showing same.

!image-20230119-204924.png|width=1514,height=754!

!image-20230119-204939.png|width=1535,height=746!

review app - [https://cbdash-pr-4149.herokuapp.com/dashboard/app/5/tasks?tab=backlog|https://cbdash-pr-4149.herokuapp.com/dashboard/app/5/tasks?tab=backlog]

h3. Conversation

Posting notes from chat with Eduardo and Scott below:

* This happens because currently we use a global catalog resource whereas we should be using the current project rate cards for the pricing during PRD population, and any catalog price we display.
- Basically the solution to this is to make Catalog "project" aware.
* FE: Would need to send the current project_id to all of the catalog endpoints
* BE: From the received project_id we need to return the catalog prices using the respective JobType instead of the catalog resource.
column193: 20/Jan/23 6:13 AM;624b106e8678e900705d471a;We should be using the projects rate card for the hourly rates ( used in calculating the module’s service cost).  Currently, it is using the Catalog’s resource rates.

column1: FTUE Catalog: Filter out beta App Templates
column33:
h2. Card

As a Crowdbotics Customer, I only want to see App Templates that are approved.

h2. Conversation

The Product Solutions team will add App Templates in a draft (beta) version, which are not yet ready for customer use.  These app templates have a ' - beta' suffix.

We should filter out all app templates that contain “beta”.

{noformat}const displayAppTemplates = allAppTemplates.filter((appTemplate) => !appTemplate.title.toLowerCase().includes('- beta'));{noformat}
column114:
* The app template Catalog pop-up only shows app templates that *do not* have the ‘- beta’ suffix (e.g. Meal Planner - beta).
** If I remove the ‘- beta’ suffix from an app template name in Catalog Admin (i.e. when the app template is ready), then I should be able to see that app template in Catalog.

column1: Add status field in Catalog Admin to archetypes, feature, and modules
column33:
h3. User Stories:

* As a Catalog Admin, I want to set the status e a status for app templates (archetype), features, and modules:
** I want to set a status for “draft” so that I can indicate which archetypes, features or modules are draft.
** I want to set a status for “approved” so that I can indicate which archetypes, features or modules are ready to show in production.
** When I change the status to “approved” on a an archetype, all features and their modules have their status set to “approved”.
** When I change the status to “approved” on a feature, all their modules have their status set to “approved”.
* As a Catalog Customer, I only want to see archetypes, features, and modules that have “approved” status in my Catalog.



*BE:*

* *Create new model*
** Add the {{status}} model with the values: {{approved}} | {{draft}}
* *Model Updates*
** Add {{status}} field to the Archetype model
** Add {{status}} field to the Feature model
** Add {{status}} field to the Module model
* *Update existing data*
** Set the {{status}} of all existing archetype, feature, and module. to {{draft}}
* *Respond to status changes*
** When an Archetype’s status is set to {{approved}}, set all constituent features to {{approved }}
*** execute below for each feature
** When a Feature’s status is set to {{approved}}, set all constituent modules to {{approved}}
** DO NOT cascade other status
* *Endpoints*
** add endpoint to update the statuses of all items.
e.g.
*** {{archetype/set-status?status=draft}}
*** {{feature/set-status?status=draft}}
*** {{module/set-status?status=draft}}

h3. FE

* Add status field to Archetypes, Features, and Modules tabs
* Add ‘bulk status update’ admin button

column1: Copy on Create Modal is not readable and doesn't pass accessibility standards

Steps:

column1: Add retry logic < Heroku / terraform > Intermittent issue
column33:
*Vinay Sharma*
Internal server error on API-production deployment
App link:- [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/dashboard/app/58156|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/dashboard/app/58156]
API deployment failed. This might be an intermittent issue.

!image-20230119-161732.png|width=1539,height=888!

----

*Saurav Gharti Magar*  
This is intermittent issue we are seeing for a long time. We should look at this, if we can do something to fix this.

*Muhammad Abdullah Abid*
Too many intermittent issues related to heroku

*Dan DeFelippi*  
This is an error from Heroku. I don’t know if there’s anything we can do. We should submit a support request, maybe they’re not aware of the problem.

*Muhammad Abdullah Abid*
Can we put in some retry logic to try this again if its intermittent?

*Dan DeFelippi*  
It happens in terraform

We don’t have any retry on that right now but it’s something we should consider

*Saurav Gharti Magar*  
Yeah, i wanted to look into this. if we can do anything.

The assumption is, it tries to create backup before postgres is completely provisioned.

Also, this is more frequent than before now.

----

h2. UPDATE (1/27)



*Samuel Kungu*

I was looking at the terraform logic and it happens they are created in parallel, postgres addon and backup_schedule addon. But since the latter finishes faster than postgres addon, it throws this error.

[https://github.com/crowdbotics/project-deploy/blob/master/terraform/heroku/production/main.tf#L35|https://github.com/crowdbotics/project-deploy/blob/master/terraform/heroku/production/main.tf#L35]


If am not wrong, we can tell the scheduler to wait. we can do something like
{{depends_on = heroku_addon.database_production}}



*Saurav Gharti Magar* 
yes. Should wait for `{{config_var_values}}` values of database_production addon. This one line addition should fix this issue.
column114:
# Determine how we can address the Heroku/terraform intermittent issue that is caused when a backup attempts to be created before postgres is provisioned.
## What causes intermittent issues to happen during Heroku deployment?
## Does the increased frequency with which intermittent issues appear in newly created apps correlate to Heroku ending their free tier back in November last year?
# Add the requisite functionality to Heroku/terraform to address the intermittent issue
# NEW → add script to ensure postgres addon successfully runs and completes before backup_schedule addon.

column206:
23/Feb/23 10:07 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;Just an update on this:

We have been trying to perform a “wait” using a null_resource within the terraform script. The bash script was using the {{heroku}} cli commands to query to see if the database information was returned (hence implying that it is available to apply a backup policy).

Unfortunately, the dyno do NOT have the Heroku CLI installed. So this would never have worked. Looking for another way to perform the {{wait}} on DB
column207:
24/Feb/23 7:01 AM;63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5;[~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910] [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448] [~accountid:5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835] [~accountid:60b6618066df7900704e3a3d][~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656]  [~accountid:60b681f3994185007431bb28] 

I’ve come to the conclusion that we should do our best to apply a backup policy to the production database with a {{depends_on}} to the production DB, but if it fails because of a 500, there's nothing that we can do but log a ticket with Heroku.

I’ve been taking a look a the implementation, [source code here|https://github.com/davidji99/terraform-provider-herokux/blob/c43ecaa9b9ca42b12765af933da480b259cacce1/herokux/resource_herokux_postgres_backup_schedule.go#L101], and I’ve manually tested a bunch of scenarios at different times within the day. I’ve even ssh into the worker celery task and monitored the terraform logs. We have to come to the conclusion that the call to {{/client/v11/databases/%s/transfer-schedules}} can fail with {{500}}. Add retry logic might be an option but most likely, this could also fail as the 500 response is most likely due to some internal system problem happening at that time.

Looking for thoughts?



Tested Scenarios:

# Launch a review app, change {{PROJECT_DEPLOY_BRANCH}} to point to the dev branch
# ssh into the worker 3 dyno (that’s the deploy celery worker) {{heroku ps:exec --app <review app name> --dyno worker3.1}}
# installed heroku cli (so we can test with different wait and retry scenarios within the TF files)
# Deployed an app that was created
# within the Dyno monitor terraform logs e.g. {{ps -aux}} find the PID, {{cat /proc/<pid>/fd/1}} 

Tested with: 

* heroku pg:info loops to validate that if info returned with valid results that inferred the postgres DB was up.
* depends_on production db
* tested during different times within the day
* tested with multiple deploys
column208: 24/Feb/23 10:30 AM;5b8ff1f89e23562b1db3f835;[~accountid:63c9ac46cd6a09abe71f04b5] Can we enable this backup thing via API? It we can then we have heroku webhook api call, for build/release success, we can trigger backup schedule then, if API is there.

column1: TASK: Update PRDItem and Task models to reference Module.slug
column33:
h2. Background

Currently, the {{PRDItem}} and {{Task }} models reference the {{Module.id}} value.  This is an auto-incremented value that will differ between environments.

{{Module.slug}} is a unique string identifier that will remain consistent across environments.

h2. Conversation

I suggest that we add a {{module_slug}} field to the {{PRDItem}} and {{Task}} models to contain this value.  
i.e. {{PRDItem.module_slug}} and {{Task.module_slug}}.

We can create a batch script to update these value for existing items.

column1: Team Page: Hide email addresses of service team from Clients
column33:
We want to hide the email addresses of the service team from clients, in order to prevent clients from reaching out to service team directly, thereby fracturing the chain of communication. 

We only want clients to be communicating with PMs, TLs, or CSMs. I confirmed w/ Anand that this is the right approach. 

cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5]
column114:
* On the Team Member page, in *client view*, you should not be able to see the email addresses of the service team. 
* If I am a client looking at the team page, I will not see the email addresses of my service team.
* Remove the email address in the data returned from the api call, not just hiding the tooltip (see Dave’s comment below)
column193: 18/Jan/23 2:03 PM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;This can be done easily. Something to note: we should also remove the email address in the data returned from the api call, not just hiding the tooltip.  We should add that to the acceptance criteria.

column1: Upgrade CloudAMPQ on production
column33:
We’ve been hitting connection limits for CloudAMPQ on prod so it needs to upgraded to the next tier (Sassy Squirrel - 1 node - $50.00). This is moving from shared to dedicated so it can’t be done automatically and needs to be manually migrated.

Review their documentation on how to complete this migration without losing data. If it’s possible to do without downtime or impacting users complete it. If it requires migration inform Dan and we’ll schedule when it can be done.
column114: CloudAMPQ is now on the Sassy Squirrel tier.
column193:
18/Jan/23 2:30 PM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;Looking at the documentation found [here|https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/cloudamqp#migrating-between-a-shared-plan-and-a-dedicated-plan] 
`There is no automatic upgrade between a shared plan and a dedicated. Instead we recommend you create the new plan and point your publishers to the new plan. Let your consumers empty the queues on the old plan and then point them to the new plan and finally delete the old plan`

With this info, it can’t be done without downtime. But then I came across the following suggestion.

{{Scale down the celery beat dynos, let the other nodes consume all remaining tasks, delete the old CloudAMQP addon entirely, create a new one on the bigger dedicated plan, scaled the celery dyno back to 1 node, then restart all nodes.}}`

cc: [~accountid:5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448]
column194: 23/Jan/23 3:26 PM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;I upgraded. Will leave this in Review as I observe what happens
column195: 24/Jan/23 12:23 PM;5b8eb4087c582d2b86e25448;I’ve confirmed this is working and removed the old CloudAMPQ instance.

column1: Subtasks still being created even after parent task is deleted
column33:
*Steps to reproduce* (Easier with Slow 3g throttling): 

[https://watch.screencastify.com/v/2eRLEQSsfUocAe0oJh1Z|https://watch.screencastify.com/v/2eRLEQSsfUocAe0oJh1Z]

This causes a data inconsistency issue on database, where those new tasks will not be marked as {{is_archived}} even when the parent task will.

Related issue: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674061532434079|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1674061532434079|smart-link] 

*Proposed solution:*

Change the way we add tasks to milestones and the way we add subtasks to a task, both of them should be unique single BE calls and not multiple.

Also, create a migration to update the existing issue on old tasks, not forgetting to update {{updated_on}} field

*Note:* This will need both BE/FE
column193: 18/Jan/23 12:14 PM;60d1fc4a5c64b100716adec4;[~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] It should be a story ticket because all subtasks and tasks have multiple calls that are independent of one another, and we now want a single call.
column194: 18/Jan/23 12:33 PM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:60d1fc4a5c64b100716adec4] yep, could be. Whatever gets this fixed soon

column1: Improve Sentry calls on the Vue dashboard
column33:
Currently, Vue is sending sentry messages on every error toast message in Vue. This is unsustainable, a lot of user notifications do not need to be sent to the sentry: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/dc142b8c89b925fc94155f0c89b61363c112d45c/dashboard/src/store/notify.js#L33|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/dc142b8c89b925fc94155f0c89b61363c112d45c/dashboard/src/store/notify.js#L33]

A very obvious use case is 400 errors - the user inputs wrong data and there’s a form validation done, this is not sentry worthy. We need to be smarter about what to send to the sentry. Recently, we have reached our quota because of how much UI noise is sent.

We could perhaps check if the error is a code error (not an HTTP request error) and for HTTP requests, only send 500-like errors, for example.

Open to suggestions.

column1: BE - Use Django IDs for edges
column33:
h2. Description

The id used for edges is not the actual edge id (to access the resource, we need to send a request with edge_id value, but that is not what this field is supposed to be used for.

The endpoint to access edges should probably just use the Django id property (versus edge_id, which is something else)

* If necessary, we can rename edge_id to something else, to avoid confusion. This is the React Flow aka Canvas identifier, not the database identifier).

h2. Acceptance Criteria

Edges endpoint id should be Django id instead of edge_id (e.g.{{ /v2/edges/1/ }}instead of {{/v2/edges/dfgfgh4e54534dfgdfh235346/}})

column1: FE: Replicate refresh functionality in Settings
column33:
Minor UI improvement suggestion for Settings

If I am on the App Store Connect tab or Google Play Console tab and refresh the page, I am taken back to the General tab. That should not be the case.

If I refresh the page, I should be taken to the same Settings tab I had open before refreshing.

We should add some sort of anchor tags to the URL and load the same tab on refresh.e.g. {{/dashboard/app/18/settings#appstoreconnect}}
{{/dashboard/app/18/settings#googleplayconsole}}

Stretch goal: taking it further down to the section that I had open i.e. App Information or Contact Details would be amazing!

Maybe also try to build all future sections in a way that they are routable through the URL. Much easier for navigation and bookmarking.

!image-20230118-185637.png|width=919,height=360!
column114:
While I am in Settings > App Store Connect  &/or  Settings > Google Play Console 

If I refresh the page, I should be taken to the same Settings tab I had open before I clicked “Refresh”.

column1: FE: Enterprise Console
The save button in App store connect getting disabled/enabled after filling Data privacy settings
column33:
Description-

# Open the [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/]
# Login with your credentials
# Create a new app
# Upgrade the plan
# Click on settings tab
# Click on App store connect tab

Actual Result- the save button is disabled until Data privacy settings are filled, and it gets enabled once they are filled. If we again click on save button it gives pop up message to fill all required information of App Store connect.

 Expected Result- The save button should be disabled until all information of App store connect is filled, not just getting enabled by filling Data privacy settings.



Video for Reference- [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-ByhACAaADsm1-XQJpBlFJF9YTvmT7Z0/view|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-ByhACAaADsm1-XQJpBlFJF9YTvmT7Z0/view|smart-link]

column1: Action - Add import on dispatch action [Data Binding]
column33:

Extend the codegen action introduced in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9563|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9563|smart-link] to take 1 more argument - import source.

Then reuse the {{addNamedImport}} visitor to include an import for the action.

column1: Action - Get dispatch calls [Data Binding]
column33:
Expose a codegen action that returns the list of {{dispatch}} calls, and their arguments, that belong to the component {{useEffect}} hooks.

Start by parsing the {{dispatch}} assignment within the component body to get the right identifier name, i.e. {{const dispatch = useDispatch()}} should resolve to the name “dispatch”.
Then proceed by finding the target hooks nodes and then find any {{dispatch}} call with a single{{Identifier}} argument node.
Return those.

column1: Action - Remove action dispatch [Data Binding]
column33:
Expose a codegen action that allows for removing a {{dispatch(actionName)}}call from the component’s {{useEffect}} hook.

It needs to ensure that the node being removed has an argument value that matches the codegen action’s provided argument value.

One can reuse the {{getHooks}} visitor to find a potential target and needs to write a new visitor for removing the correct dispatch node. The visitor that targets the hook should be chained with a visitor that targets the correct dispatch call and finally chained with the removal.

column1: Team Page: Show Pending Team Member when new member is added
column33:
* When a new Team Member is added to a project, list that Team Member’s status as “Pending” (see [rough mock up|] for reference)
* Specify the Job Title & Permissions of the added Team Member *while* their addition is pending (this will help provide added clarity for both client and internal team)-- show what we have while invite is pending
* Include a tool tip, next to the “Pending” status, explaining that “*Username* will list as a confirmed team member when they accept their invite”
* Have option for users to *cancel* the invitation to an invited Team Member. It appears that the current UI for removing a Team Member can be applied to the “Pending Team Member” as well. If so, I recommend keeping it the same for consistency.
* Ultimately, we just want to show confirmation that the invite actually sent, and prevent any doubt/worrying that the system is not tracking this request. We also want to populate a new member’s pending status w/ basic info so that the internal team can more easily manage their project (i.e. indicating that the pending member is an FE Dev, for example)



cc: [~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] 







[Notion page|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#7cbe5b5c88b748a9833cdc85d9df4d70] for reference
column114:
* When a new user is invited to a project, the Team Members page will automatically list that new user on the team page with the status of “pending”
* The “Pending” status will have a small tooltip next to it, stating that: “*Username* will list as a confirmed team member when they accept their invite”
* The internal team (or whomever sent the invite) will have the option to cancel the invite
* When the added team member *accepts* the invite to join the project, their status of “pending” will disappear, and they will then be listed as confirmed members of the project (just like everybody else).

column1: SPIKE for Team Page: Show profile pictures for Team Members
column33:
We would like to show profile pictures/icons for each Team Member. We want to do this to show clients that real people are working on their app, to build a sense of user-friendly community, and ultimately boost CSAT. 

We need to find out what our current capabilities are for extracting profile pictures from our users. Can we take their Upwork pictures? Use [https://en.gravatar.com/|https://en.gravatar.com/|smart-link]to source their pictures? What can we do?

*Discussion:*

# We have Gravatar API but we’re not showing the UI on team page-- let’s show it when possible
## Priority: manual upload to Crowdbotics
## Then: Gravatar, Upwork, etc? 
# Spike for Upwork/Github?
# Internal user can request from Teams page that someone upload an image?
column114:
Somebody be able to speak on our capabilities to source profile pictures for Team Members to include on Team page. 

cc: [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column193: 06/Feb/23 12:37 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] Circling back here on a pending discussion about the approach we want to take on this ticket
column194:
06/Feb/23 6:57 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] The purpose of the ticket is to do some research on options and see what technical options would be best to implement.  Most of our community devs come from upwork and I am pretty sure we can get the image from their API.  We should ingest the image and store it on our servers, however, so we don’t have to constantly query upwork for images.

We allow users to upload their profile picture, so I think the most obvious thing that needs to be done is to build updating profile images into the *process for onboarding crowdbotics community members.*  The CSM for the app/customer should be responsible for asking the members of the team to update their profile image.  cc: [~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] 

Another option is that we could allow the CSM to upload profile pictures on the team members details page.  This would require a little dev work, but is not too difficult as we already have an avatar image upload component on the profile page.
column195: 06/Feb/23 7:07 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;Thanks [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]
column196: 08/Feb/23 10:20 AM;5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910;[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] put findings in notion and link it here
column197:
09/Feb/23 10:28 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[*Notion Document reference*|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/483e7a77375146dc9f58c789c4710940?v=f9bbfec7493842998ec2d7faf177ff57&p=b9154d656f404462aa415771a4fa3086&pm=s]

cc [~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:61929021c15977006af8baef] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column198: 09/Feb/23 10:48 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] When I click on the link you just shared, it’s coming up empty for me. Maybe you accidentally linked the wrong thing? Let me know!
column199:
09/Feb/23 4:37 PM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:63b458b54bc858b303ce6744] Just read through your Notion doc. There are two perspectives for user flows here: 

1) Flow that prompts users to manually upload a profile pic. If we do this, I don’t think we need to worry about Gravatar or other tools b/c the user will be uploading their own pic anyway. Right?

2) A feature where we can *automatically* pull in profile pictures for team members *without* them needing to manually upload a profile picture themselves. i.e. introducing some sort of automation for profile pictures. This was the option I thought we were evaluating possibilities for. 

It sounds like your conclusion from the notion doc was to just have users manually upload their own pictures? I am confused-- please clarify your thoughts on this direction. Thank you!!

cc: [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column200:
10/Feb/23 7:31 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;I think the best solution is to have the services team be responsible for having their team update their profile pics as part of project staffing process.  I don’t think we should solely own profile picture enforcement in the software.  

That said, we can help with the following potentially:  We have a popup which navigates them to the profile page.  The popup would display when a user with the email address ending with “@crowdbotics.com” logs in and does not have a profile image uploaded or one that can be pulled from gravatar or whatever service.
column201: 13/Feb/23 5:25 AM;63b458b54bc858b303ce6744;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] I think since all users can actually login to the system, it would be only fair to have them take on that responsibility by them selves. I think [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] has a point here with the suggested solution of a prompt for any users who have no profile pic as mentioned earlier.

column1: Team Page: Designate which Team Members are internal CB employees
column33:
Designate which employees are currently CB internal employees. [~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5] has a variety of ideas for how to convey this-- we want to start with whatever is most simple and effective. 

The option I recommended was showing this by having a small Crowdbotics logo icon next to the usernames of internal employees, with a tooltip that says “this Team Member is an internal Crowdbotics Employee”.

column1: Team Page: In the “In Progress” column (formerly “Current Activity”), include a link to the tasks that Team Member is assigned to.
column33:
* In the “In Progress” column (formerly “Current Activity”), include a hyperlink to the tasks that any given Team Member is assigned to.
* We already have this information, so we can take the title of those tasks that a Team Member is assigned to, and use that to populate the “In Progress” column. If this text is too long for the column space, we can use ellipses (like in Excel) and show the full text in a hover-over. [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] ask them if you have any confusion. 



[Notion page|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#60ffa34518954efcba7fb72cd247ef68] for reference.
column114:
* On the “Team Members” page, the “In Progress” column will auto-populate with the name of the Tasks that a team member is currently assigned to. Since the name of the Tasks will likely be too long to fit within the column space, the text will be cut off using ellipses, but will show the full name of the Tasks when the mouse hovers over the text. (ask [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] if there is confusion about what I mean). 
* When the user clicks on the hyperlink, *a new page* will open, taking them to the Task page where they can see the Tasks that are currently in-progress for any given team member.
column193: 27/Jan/23 8:35 AM;621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4;If I’m not mistaken we don’t need BE here. but I’ll check and see.
column194: 30/Jan/23 9:51 AM;621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4;[~accountid:63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba] what should be the hyperlink text ?
column195:
30/Jan/23 10:07 AM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4] The hyperlink text should be the name of the tasks that are in-progress. If there are multiple tasks or the text is too long, use ellipses at the cut-off, and show the full text as a hover-over (see description above). 

For example, if my task is: “Generate product requirements mockup”, then the hyperlink might read.. 
”Generate product requirements…” and when a user *_hovers over_* that hyperlink, the hover-over will show the full text. Kind of like [this example|https://superuser.com/questions/1296838/customize-hyperlink-hover-over]. Let me know if you need more clarity and we can chat [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476]
column196: 30/Jan/23 10:43 AM;621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4;[~accountid:61084bde75ad9600691fd79f] we need an endpoint that returns the tasks that are child of milestones that are in progress, and these tasks be able to get them by assignee (user) id. a milestone to be considered in-progress, on of its related tasks need to have status of {{!== done}}

column1: Team Page: Delete "Last Activity" column
column33:
We don’t need both an “In Progress” and “Last Activity” column. For now, we are going to delete the “Last Activity” column; we will probably show this in a new details page for specific users. For now, just hide it. 

[Notion page|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#60ffa34518954efcba7fb72cd247ef68] for reference.

column1: Team Page: Rename the "Current Activity" column to "In Progress"; Delete "Last Activity" column
column33:
* Rename the "Current Activity" column to "In Progress". This is more user-friendly, and also more descriptive (there may be multiple tasks that are in-progress, not just one activity).
* We don’t need both an “In Progress” and “Last Activity” column. For now, we are going to delete or hide the “Last Activity” column; we will probably show this in a new details page for specific users. For now, just hide it.
column114:
* On the “Team Members” page, the “Current Activity” column will instead be named “In Progress”
* On the “Team Members” page, the “Last Activity” column will no longer appear.

column33:
Describe the permissions of a Team Member in a tool tip next to their Permissions classification, _instead of_ using a separate column for this (see [rough mock up|] for example). 

[~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5] 

Use the [edited table|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#60ffa34518954efcba7fb72cd247ef68] of Permissions descriptions to populate the text for different Permissions descriptions.
column114:

* Instead, you will be read the description of a Team Member’s permissions *_in a tooltip next to their Permissions category_*.

column1: Team Page: Text & UI tweaks
column33:
* On the Team Members page, rename the column “Roles” to “Permissions”. This will help with clarity
* Remove the tooltip next the “Role” (set to be renamed to “Permissions”) that currently takes takes user to Knowledge-base automatically when clicked. This is not helpful b/c it does not take the user to a specific page that provides more information.
* Change title of “Github icon” column to “Links”. Not every Team Member does (or should) have a GitHub account, so it doesn’t make sense to have a GitHub category for every team member. Instead, change this column name to “Links”
* “Invite a collaborator” button → 
** Change text "Invite a Collaborator" to "Invite Team Member"
** On this interface, change the text “Role” to “Permissions” for consistency. 
** Place this button in top right for consistency [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]  (same row as search input)
** Also place the “Request Team Member” button in top right for consistency 
** Change text from “Request Team Member” to “Request Team Member” for consistency
column114:
* On the “Team Members” page, the column previously labeled “Roles” will now have the title “Permissions”.

* On the “Team Members” page, the tooltip (information icon) next to “Roles” will no longer exist.
* On the “Team Members” page, the Github icon (serving as the name of the far-right column) will be renamed to “Links”
* “Invite a Team Member” button → 
** The “Invite a Collaborator” button text should now read  “Invite Team Member”
** The “Roles” dropdown text should be changed to “Permissions”
** “Invite a Team Member” button will now appear in top right of page (same row as search input) for consistency 
** “Request Team Member” button will now appear in top right as well (for consistency)
** “Request Team Member” will now read: “Request Team Member”

column1: Team Page: Change text "Invite a Collaborator" to "Invite a Team Member"; adjust button placement
column33:
* Change the text of the “Invite a Collaborator” button to: “Invite a Team Member” for consistency. 

* On this interface, change the text “Role” to “Permissions” for consistency. 
* Place this button in top right for consistency [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]  (same row as search input)



**Note: if a CB user is already registered, then their job title will likely be static and will auto-populate anyway. I will likely edit the CB registration flow, and include a field to capture someone’s job title during that process. Still, this feature should allow PMs/TLs etc. to have clarity for their project while any invite is pending.
column114:
* The “Invite a Collaborator” button text should be changed to “Invite a Team Member”
* The “Roles” dropdown text should be changed to “Permissions”
column193: 24/Jan/23 12:58 PM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;*This ticket was combined into* [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9957|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9957|smart-link]*. Can now be deleted.*

column1: Team Page: Add a "Job Title" column to actually reflect a Team Member's Role
column33:
* Add a “Job Title” column to actually reflect a team member’s role on any given project. The name of this column should be: Job Title
* The list of “Job Title” options (i.e. FE Dev, TL, etc.) can be viewed [here|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#8d1af76329dc450dae82434dc02b486b]. 
* For permissions, only the *owner* and *internal team* (TLs, PMs, and CSMs) should have the ability to control what a Team Member’s job title is. 
* The “Job Title” column should be the first column to the *right* of the username. 



See [Notion Page |https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#8d1af76329dc450dae82434dc02b486b]for reference images.
column114:
When you view the Team Members page, there will be a column called “Job Title” that lists each team member’s job in a given project. 



Owners and internal team members (TLs, PMs, and CSMs) should have permission to select what title Team Members have from a dropdown.

column209:
28/Feb/23 12:21 PM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;[~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] [~accountid:618e6f963ae5230069229010] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:621e5efc14cd24006907a7a4]  I’m notating some changes that need to be made on this column, and will link this ticket to the other UI changes we discussed during refinement today. 

Basically, the *job title* column needs to be to the right of the *username* column, and needs to have more width so that its values can actually be read. I’m going to reach out to you Curtis now to sync on this, just want to make sure we can nail the small details to an acceptable level and then move on.
column210:
28/Feb/23 1:15 PM;63b5ee33159df2c252e91bba;Hey, another follow up. We want to push the *Job Title* column out this week; the other [UI Clean up|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10443] issues can wait. Here’s what we need for this column to be worthy of production:

1) *Job Title* column will appear to the right of username column
2) *Job Title* column will have enough width to be reasonably read. You can shorten the SU, In Progress, Github, and Actions columns to make room. 
3) Ensure that the *Job Title* column has the appropriate options to select from (i.e. PM, QA, Front End Dev, BE, etc.) They are all listed in the original ticket. It’s the same 6 roles we always use. 

That’s about it. [~accountid:5dd031e315a7290c649d2a31] we want to save time and get these fixes in before [~accountid:618e6f963ae5230069229010] starts to test. Please advise on your ability to knock this out! cc: [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:5fc686dd3b4f590068eac910]

column33:

column202:
19/Jan/23 4:15 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;[~accountid:633b37c1409249995eeb9973] I would like to share a edge case here.
Let’s say the user first registers as a self-service user, therefore we create a Free plan app for him on signup. But then later (for some unknown reason) he then checks out through the managed user process, using the same email. 
What should be the behavior in this case?
Currently after doing the managed user process we have a app generated with a Pro plan assigned. So this user would result in two apps, a free one from the self service and a pro one from the managed process.
column203: 19/Jan/23 4:50 AM;62700317e01c14006a50cd6f;For me I would just keep it like this, as this isn’t really something that really happens in prod
column204:
20/Jan/23 11:50 AM;633b37c1409249995eeb9973;Hi [~accountid:62700317e01c14006a50cd6f] - If a free user ends up talking to Sales after going through the FTUE flow, then Sales will already know that this user has an account. And I believe that Sales will just ask the user to upgrade their plan to a subscription, e.g. Pro via the CB dashboard. (I will double confirm with Sales regarding this. )

I know that we are calling anyone with subscription a “managed user” in the user stories - but that is just for simplicity. If a customer’s first point of contact is with Sales (and they don’t have an account at all) - only then will the user be asked to sign up via Stripe subscription. Does that make sense?

column1: What admins and superusers can see in PRD tab, wrt app owner
column33:
* Admins and Superusers should be able to Basic App Cost, Customization cost, Estimated delivery timeline, feature and module price if the App Owner can see these values.
** *If the project does not have subscription:* the project owner (i.e. self-serve user), admins (e.g. Sales, BA) and superusers should be able to see the cost, timeline, feature or module price.
*** _Screenshot:_
*** !Screen Shot 2023-01-17 at 3.38.49 PM.png|width=1301,height=683!
** *If the project has subscription:* the project owner (i.e. managed user), admins (e.g. Sales, BA) and superusers should *not* be able to see the cost, timeline, feature or module price.
*** _Screenshot:_
*** !Screen Shot 2023-01-17 at 5.26.21 PM.png|width=623,height=438!
* Only app owners *who do not have a subscription (i.e. self-serve users*) can see the Finalize with expert button. 
** Admins should *not* be able to see this button. 
** Superusers can see Finalize with expert button (since superusers can see everything.)
column114:
* Admins and Superusers should be able to Basic App Cost, Customization cost, Estimated delivery timeline, feature and module cost if the App Owner can see these values.
** What the app owner sees depends on whether they have subscription (aka managed user) or whether they do not have subscription (aka self-serve users). See Description above.
* Only Only app owners who do not have a subscription (i.e. self-serve users) can see the Finalize with expert button.
** Admins should *not* be able to see this button. 
** Superusers can see Finalize with expert button (since superusers can see everything.)

column1: [Databinding] - Selecting specific records from the data models
column193:
18/Jan/23 10:48 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;This ticket I think needs to address data binding using a parameter value to filter the array of data from data models. basically the creation of selectors and filters

We could add different types of data filters in the future, but here we could make it very basic and have some code assumptions (that a parameter received from navigation would always equal to an identifier of a model schema, for example.
column194:
23/Jan/23 6:55 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;This should be covered by [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9524|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9524|smart-link] .  I talked with [~accountid:6160901964ff0100718801c7] about this last Friday.  The second row of inputs were intended to filter the query.  In the example on the mockup I was showing that “get pets list” would be filtered by “petCustomerId” and we’re supplying the value for “petCustomerId” from the parameter “customerId”.

Admittedly, this is not the best way to do this, but should be good enough for a first run.

Let me know if this works for you [~accountid:5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1] or if you have any input on possible improvements.
column195: 23/Jan/23 10:02 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;That sounds good, we just need to make sure this will be working as intended we are working in sync on this, since I am also working on a ticket that handle screen parameters, but will work differently.

column1: [Databinding] - Finish work on FlatList
column33: We need to finish the work on FlatList
column193:
18/Jan/23 9:39 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;We need a UI to bind a data list to FlatList as part of the data field

Additionally, we need some way to expose the available data object properties as bindable values.

Example of flatlist: [https://snack.expo.dev/@alinetavares/flatlist|https://snack.expo.dev/@alinetavares/flatlist|smart-link] 

We need a way to expose the {{message}}, {{title}} and {{image}} in the example as bindable properties to the flatlist elements. 

Additionally, we also don't have a decent way to render composition, but we could get away with it for now (creating the component ourselves behind the scenes and handling the code updates on our own).

So for this work we need:

# UI mocks and definitions on how the UI would  look like
# Codegen updates to handle different types of data binding (current data binding is really rustic assumes everything  comes from an API).  This could be solved with some validation. Validates against the open api spec, what the user inputs, if exists, make it data binding codegen, if matches a local variable/param, binds to that, if doesnt match with anything, displays error.
# Iterating over this UI we can also have pre-populated suggestions on what to bind: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/GQWPU9JHZ/p1668718664853479|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/GQWPU9JHZ/p1668718664853479|smart-link] 



The codegen to expose the available parameters of a component is already available

cc [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7]
column194: 31/Jan/23 7:39 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;The work for this ticket is encapsulated in [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10066|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10066|smart-link] and [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10067|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10067|smart-link] so I’m closing this ticket.

column1: Save Data Modal
column33:
This modal is displayed when the user clicks the “Edit” button on the Event+Action selector and a “submit” Action is chosen.  See [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10053|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-10053|smart-link] for that work.

The modal initially displays a list of data models. 

Once a data model is selected we show the list of Data Calls available to it (if any).  If there are no data calls (or the user wants a custom call) the user can select “custom” from the Data Call selector which adds a data input below the two selectors which allows for a full or relative API endpoint to be manually added. 

Below the Data model and data call inputs there is a list of “Properties to Send” which have the same controls as the properties input on the data models panel.

When the user saves the edits on the “Save Data” modal it updates the code.

!image-20230131-153045.png|width=328,height=294!

!image-20230131-153106.png|width=320,height=324!

Additional details and notes can be found here: [https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Databinding-Continued-273b798cdd2c4fec9785c020d78774a5#a4d88f74ee43407d8e2905b22d3bd590|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Databinding-Continued-273b798cdd2c4fec9785c020d78774a5#a4d88f74ee43407d8e2905b22d3bd590]

We need a UI that dispatches data/post requests. This can be very broad and complex, but *for the purpose of this ticket, it can only consider the creation of records* - i.e. having an input form that is bound to some model, then the pressable would trigger the creation of a record in the database for the specific model.

Our UI is very bad at tying up this data, we need to consider how can we specify which fields will be part of the submission form. This will most likely be a multi-ticket effort.

column1: Update public schema tenant privileges
BE: django-tenants via PostgreSQL
column33:
Based on the findings from [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9763|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-9763|smart-link], we can begin the Enterprise Account MVP implementation by installing [https://pypi.org/project/django-tenants/|https://pypi.org/project/django-tenants/|smart-link] and configuring Multi-Tenancy on the Schema Level with PostgreSQL.

----

h4. We have a django library [django-tenants|https://pypi.org/project/django-tenants/] to implement multi tenancy with Postgresql Schema.

h2. FINDINGS

# *Postgresql:*
## Postgresql works on schema. By default, we have public schema. The data on public schema are availble on all other schema. Basically, by default user of other schema can access/manipulate record from public schema. We can update this privileges though.
# *django-tenants:*
## Two types of data, tenant specific and public data. data on the public are available for use within all the tenants.
## tenants are identified using the the host_name/domain. So each request get data only from that schema identified by the host_name.
## From the main site, we can create/remove tenants, which can create/remove tenants on the postgres schema level.
## To access data of tenants on our main site, we can add some logic/views for tenants management to get tenant specific data.
# By default celery background task don’t have tenant info, so they aren’t tenant aware. There is this package for that [https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|smart-link]  we can use this, or can write our custom for celery.

h2. CONCLUSION

So, from the implementation point of view, our main site {{app.crowdbotics.com}} will run under the main public tenant. For the enterprise clients, then will signup to our main site, and for the enterprise clients, we can create the specific tenant for them and they can access their own data under {{tenant1.app.crowdbotics.com}} so something like that.

# *Admin Panel:*
## For the tenant admin panel, tenants can get their own set of admin panel to manage data within their tenants. We can add some logic to show specific models in the tenant admin panel. *Or we don’t give them access to admin panel instead we create a dashboard for enterprise tenants to manage data across their tenant app, which is more user friendly.*
## For main admin panel, we can add some logic for view data of other tenants.
# *Permissions:*
## In terms of permission, groups, projects and all, it will be there for each tenant. Basically, those permissions work in the same way it works now.
# *User Management:*
## For the user related operations, it will work same as now. Just the operation will be on the tenant level.
# *Billing:*
## In terms of billing, the current app will be the main app on the tenant model. The billing will work same as now for other users. In terms of enterprise clients, they can be on the enterprise plan we have now. Just for enterprise clients, we will create a tenant schema for them to use, and manage. Based on that their plan, we can activate/deactivate/remove their tenant.

h3. REFERNENCES

# [Spike - Enterprise Support with Multi-Tenancy|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Spike-Enterprise-Support-with-Multi-Tenancy-2c4da347f7744b3d8cf5d6b85c59382c]
# [https://pypi.org/project/django-tenants/|https://pypi.org/project/django-tenants/|smart-link] 
# [https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|https://github.com/maciej-gol/tenant-schemas-celery|smart-link]
column114:
+*Separate all Enterprise Account info into two data types:*+

# tenant specific
# public data.

→ public data is available for use for all tenants, but tenant-specific data is only available to the tenant. Ensure that all data is appropriately categorized into public or tenant-specific data and for all tenant-specific data, ensure it cannot be accessed by any other tenant aside from the main tenant associated with that tenant-specific data. (“+No information leakage+”)



* *Tenants are identified using the the host_name/domain → Ensure each request retrieves data only from that schema identified by the host_name.*
** From the main site, ensure we are able to create/remove tenants, which can create/remove tenants on the postgres schema level.
** Add the requisite logic/views for tenants management to access & retrieve tenant-specific data on our main site.

column1: Other user roles cannot see the cost and timeline in PRD even when the project is self-serve
column33:
The app owner (who is self-serve) can see the cost and timeline in PRD: [app link|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/dashboard/app/57487]. I cannot see the cost and timeline in PRD tab, as a superuser.

*Screenshot of what app owner sees:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-17 at 10.29.29 AM.png|width=1264,height=686!

*Screenshot of what superuser sees:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-17 at 10.32.56 AM.png|width=1133,height=687!

Is this happening because we only let app owners see the cost and timeline in the right=hand tab? If so, then we should show the App cost and Estimated timeline to self-serve users and other users types for that project as well (e.g. Sales, BA, Superuser, Admin).

column1: SPIKE: Investigate and list supporting services needed to run CB dash
column33:
These are supporting external - we don’t maintain internally- services that are used by the CB. For example, postgres, CloudAMQP, etc.

In addition, we should investigate if they have been containerized and if there are official Helm charts for those services that can be used to manage their Kubernetes deployments.
column114: Create a list of services the CB Dashboard relies upon for the purposes of implementing kubernetes locally

25/Jan/23 6:25 AM;60b6618066df7900704e3a3d;[~accountid:60a2b6488cbda700689ac692] In regards to your comments, this Epic is more about setting up a local testing environment with k8s. Once that is done, and we have a POC that it’s working as expected, we can start working on the prod and staging environments.

But for now, we need a POC that works locally. That means having these services setup locally.
column196: 25/Jan/23 7:51 AM;60a2b6488cbda700689ac692;For local development/testing, I feel using docker-compose should be sufficient as long as all required components are dockerized. k8s for local testing would be an overkill.
column197:

If it is not by design, then we need to include all the supporting services in {{crowdbotics-slack-app}} docker-compose override file.

column1: SPIKE: provide feedback on building metric to measure COGS for CB apps
column33:
We need a way to report on COGS and an app’s budget somewhere in the project. This will help us measure impact in the product team. 

Right now, we don’t have a way to measure this in the product. However, the information is all there on the Task page already.

We would need a new tab, private for the company, on Team or Task page (& maybe admin panel too). 

The platform knows:

* How much every services team member is paid by the hour (listed on the team page)
* How much has been paid out so far to each person
* What was budgeted
column114:
Discuss initial feedback/response to implementing a COGS metric within our product. 

* Are we able to measure this with the current data that the platform collects? If not, what additional data do we need?

column1: changed value of module options from module properties of added module in storyboard is not getting saved
column33:
Description:- when user try to change and save the module options values from module properties of added module in storyboard then changed value is not getting saved also user is getting a success toast message as well but when we recheck the saved values then user gets the pervious one only, not changed values.

Artifact:- [https://drive.google.com/file/d/14bemv2EsamjH5dPqVJdxyVnG_Ki6dwWR/view|https://drive.google.com/file/d/14bemv2EsamjH5dPqVJdxyVnG_Ki6dwWR/view|smart-link] 

Test step:
1. go to CB dashboard

2. open existing mobile app

3. go to storyboard & add module from module option then save

4. mouse hover over the added module & click on properties option

5. go for module options values & make some changes then save

6. observe the toast message 

7. again go to properties of the module & observe the changes.

column1: TECH - Task Model
Close contract when a resource is removed from project
column33:
*User Stories:*

* If I remove an Upwork resource from the Team page for a project, then I want that resource’s contract to be closed on Upwork.
* As a PM, if I un-assign a resource (e.g. BE, FE, Design) from a sub-task that is not Done:
** then I want the Upwork milestones to be deleted from the resource’s contract.
column114:
* Contract is closed if Uwpork resource is removed from Team page for a project.
* Upwork milestone is deleted from resource’s contract if the resource is un-assigned for a given sub-task.

column226: New UI / UX for PRD tab

column1: Parent tasks being set to done status on admin even with child tasks not done
column33:
There are some cases of Parent tasks being set as “DONE“ from the admin when some of their subtasks are still not in “DONE“ status. From what I could gather this happens only on admin and not on dashboard.

This causes some “data integrity” issues as pointed out by Adams data team: [https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1673904584844349|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/C03SV59V9PG/p1673904584844349|smart-link] 

*Proposed approaches:*

# When updating status of a parent task to “DONE“ on admin, if that task has any subtasks no in “DONE“ state. Block that action with an appropriate descriptive error
# When updating status of a parent task to “DONE“ on admin, also update all of the subtasks state to “DONE“

Note:

* It would be good if we could also find a way to fix the existing tasks with this issue.



Some examples on prod:

Parent Task: 212064 (status: DONE)

Childs: 219450,219454,219455 (status: TODO)



Parent Task : 345309 (status: DONE)

Childs: 345310,345311, 345312,345313 (status: TESTING)

column1: Create multiple subtasks with a single backend call
column33:
On the database, we have some task entries where the parent task is archived but not its children (subtasks).

This happens when the parent task gets deleted before all of its subtasks are created. So we tag the existing subtasks as archived but there are still some subtasks being made in the background.

The current implementation works like this: whenever we click “Add subtask“ on an empty Task, FE needs to create the default subtasks (Front-End Dev, Back-End Dev, etc), and to do this, the FE makes multiple BE requests (2 for each subtask):

!image-20230209-115526.png|width=290,height=275!

This is not a good practice at all and can cause inconsistencies like the one described in this very ticket.

h2. Proposed solution

Have an endpoint where FE can create all those subtasks in a single request, also, deprecate the use of an add-task endpoint, which should be already included when creating the task.

h2. Verified on DB:

On some database entries, we have a parent task that has been archived but its subtasks are not.

!image-20230113-145402.png|width=1015,height=213!

The expected behavior is: when a parent task is archived all its subtasks should be archived as well

Some other examples of this:

!image-20230113-145715.png|width=1013,height=210!

!image-20230113-145739.png|width=1059,height=217!
column114:
BE:

* Have an endpoint where we can create multiple subtasks with a single request
** Just as a safeguard, limit how many subtasks we can create on the same request at max.
* Deprecate the use of the {{add-task}} endpoint, this info should be included in the creation of a task
* Have a migration (or run in the shell) to update the existing subtasks where their parent is archived but not the subtask itself.

FE:

* Update FE to use the new endpoints

column1: Clicking elements in the component tree does code changes
column33:
If we go deep in the tree selecting elements and you reach the Text within the last Pressable that the {{onPress}} callback changes.

It looks like this before: {{onPress={params.onPress}}} And after selecting those elements in the tree it is transformed to: {{onPress={navigation.navigate("undefined", {})}}

*_Selecting elements in the navigation tree should never do a code transformation_*, some logic in the Pressable toggle must be calling a codegen action.



Rweproducing:

# Add a blank screen and copy this code to your screen: [https://snack.expo.dev/@alinetavares/pressable-in-screen|https://snack.expo.dev/@alinetavares/pressable-in-screen|smart-link] 
# Notice it has an existing pressabler
# Check the code, look for some existing Pressable. The code is like this {{<Pressable onPress={props.onPress} underlayColor='#DDDDDD'>}}`
# Go to Studio, access the component tree
# Click on the pressable
# Go to the code, notice it changed to {{<Pressable onPress={() => navigation.navigation.navigate("undefined", {})} underlayColor='#DDDDDD'>}}

*Expected result*: code should not change just by selecting elements in component tree.

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VtE_vX9qYhaMAl2fUM6F1LVq4nOL1WNp/view?usp=sharing|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VtE_vX9qYhaMAl2fUM6F1LVq4nOL1WNp/view?usp=sharing|smart-link] 

----

The issue seems to be coming from the recently implemented parameters feature

column1: Even when doing it for the first time, the error "Pricing or Payments already finalized" appears.
column33:
Steps to reproduce

# Navigate to the URL and sign in.
# Create an app.
# Go to Tasks > Proposal
# Include a milestone and a task>subtask.
# Select the "Approve Pricing" option.

Actual result: getting an error message with a success message

Video for reference: [https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/_3lSUJNAf4QXBFFsqdje5oYSsJK7Lgt9dcT4g4d_QuI?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=fals|https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/_3lSUJNAf4QXBFFsqdje5oYSsJK7Lgt9dcT4g4d_QuI?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=fals|smart-link]

Note: This can be easily reproduced with slow 3G on the network console. 

* It seems to be happening because the added subtask is still loading and we clicked on the Approve Pricing button.

column1: Template items are not getting added from the catalog without refreshing the page.
column33:
Template items are not getting added to the catalogue without refreshing the page.

* When the user selects the template and clicks the Done button, a loader should appear.
* It is also possible to add multiple templates.

Steps -

# Open url: [https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/|https://crowdbotics-slack-dev.herokuapp.com/] and login
# Create an app.
# Go to Tasks > PRD.
# Select the template item and click on the Done button.

Expected Result: The selected template should be added, and the loader should appear if it takes time to load.

Actual Result: The templates are not getting added you need to refresh the page.

Video for reference - [https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/W8LUDNR7oQ4Uf3nCcVJm4KqoPwgnKGWAOFQhWopAIRM?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=false&_=1673550049340|https://snehmishra.hippovideo.io/video/play/W8LUDNR7oQ4Uf3nCcVJm4KqoPwgnKGWAOFQhWopAIRM?org_tok=Ux3Aaf9T4njaPrCLS2RFwg&utm_source=hv-campaigns&hreferer=private&hvre=false&_=1673550049340|smart-link]

column226: Show that an invite is pending on the Team Page when a new team member is added to a project

column1: [Team Page] Tie the "Resource Type" to the invite of a new Team member
column33:
When a new user is invited to a project, include, *in the “invite a team member” interface*, a form to mark the resource type of the new team member being added. 

I.e., I invite “Dave” and list that he is going to be a FE engineer, then, the Team page will show that “John, a FE engineer” is pending, giving an added sense of completion/attention to detail. 

We should also update the automated email templates to include the “Resource type” for consistency. i.e. “Hello, this is just a notice that you’ve invited dave@crowdbotics.com, FE Developer to join your Crowdbotics project…” [*Let me know if I should create a new ticket for this]*

column1: Show that an invite is pending on the Team Page when a new team member is added to a project
column33:
* When a new Team Member is added to a project, list that Team Member’s status as “Pending” (see [rough mock up|] for reference)
* Specify the Permissions of the added Team Member *while* their addition is pending (this will help provide added clarity for both client and internal team)-- show what we have while invite is pending
* Include a tool tip, next to the “Pending” status, explaining that “*Username* will list as a confirmed team member when they accept their invite”
* Have option for users to *cancel* the invitation to an invited Team Member. It appears that the current UI for removing a Team Member can be applied to the “Pending Team Member” as well. If so, I recommend keeping it the same for consistency.
* Ultimately, we just want to show confirmation that the invite actually sent, and prevent any doubt/worrying that the system is not tracking this request. We also want to populate a new member’s pending status w/ basic info so that the internal team can more easily manage their project (i.e. indicating that the pending member is an FE Dev, for example)



cc: [~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5] [~accountid:63bc389e49a31f95b8733476] [~accountid:60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7] 







[Notion page|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Team-Page-Rework-5d76ae88bea745769cf8acf121bae254#7cbe5b5c88b748a9833cdc85d9df4d70] for reference

!Task Page.png|width=1187,height=625!
column114:
* When a new user is invited to a project, the Team Members page will automatically list that new user on the team page with the status of “pending”
* The “Pending” status will have a small tooltip next to it, stating that: “*Username* will list as a confirmed team member when they accept their invite”
* The internal team (or whomever sent the invite) will have the option to cancel the invite (*PM*, CSM)
* When the added team member *accepts* the invite to join the project, their status of “pending” will disappear, and they will then be listed as confirmed members of the project (just like everybody else).

column1: Cleanup data.success anti-pattern in codegen actions
column193:
12/Jan/23 8:36 AM;5e5541d54befbd0c96c9fbb1;Good ticket!

The main issue I noticed is that when the visitor doesn't get executed, (for example, it is a visitor for imports but the file doesn't have any imports), then  it doesn't have a clean exist since the {{traverse() }}function starts setting it to false but nothing reverts it back to success: [https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/2d30d4020e4f80e2227f6d1bea015d5b3bcd262e/codegen/src/chain-visitor/internal.ts#L186-L199|https://github.com/crowdbotics/vue-dash-5104/blob/2d30d4020e4f80e2227f6d1bea015d5b3bcd262e/codegen/src/chain-visitor/internal.ts#L186-L199]

Another issue is when the visitors are called but the actions that would give it a clean exist are inside an if - for example, return a result if it falls inside a condition. But the fact that the condition was not met, doesn’t mean the visitor failed. A common case is for parsing visitors: they parse a file and return some state data, but the fact that no state data wasn’t returned, doesn’t necessarily mean it failed.

column1: To-Do/tasks/Scratchpad widget
Client side and Server side validation requirements do not match
column33:
Environment: All
User: All

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Navigate to the account registration page
# Input a password which is less than 6 characters
# Submit form
# You will receive error that your password needs to be greater than 6 characters
# Update your password to be greater than 6 characters but less than 10
# Submit Form

*Expected Outcome:*
- Ability to submit form
*Actual Outcome:*
- Error message stating you need a password greater than 10 characters

TBD: I’m guessing the client side validation warning needs to be updated to match server side?

column1: Show cost and delivery date in the right-hand panel
column33:
h3. *Customer*

* As a customer, I want to see the following in the Your Build Plan section of my Proposal tab *after pricing is finalized by Sales*:
** Total cost
** Software cost
** Customization cost
** Estimated Delivery Date

h3. Internal users

* As an internal user (e.g. Sales, BA, Superuser), I should be able to see all of the following from the moment when the PRD is approved:
** Total cost
** Software cost
** Customization cost
** Estimated Delivery Date

h3. For all users

* The Payments section in my right-hand panel should be below the Your Build Plan section in the Proposal tab.
** Make payments sticky ??
* Show tooltips for Software Cost and Customization Cost. 
** *Text for Software Cost tooltip:* Cost of items with ready-made code.
** *Text for Customization Cost tooltip:* Cost of items that require custom development.



 *Placeholder mock-up for Your Build Plan section in Proposal tab*

!Final Test.png|width=1507,height=767!
column114:
* All users see the correct values for total cost, software cost and customization cost.
** Total cost should equal the sum of software and customization costs.
* All users see the correct delivery dates, based on the formula used in the PRD backlog.
* Customers see all costs only after pricing is finalized in the Proposal tab.
** Customers can see estimated delivery dates on the right-hand side after pricing is finalized.
* Relevant internal users can see all costs and estimated delivery date right after the PRD is approved.
* The Payments section in my right-hand panel should be below the Your Build Plan section in the Proposal tab.

column1: FE: App Activity table redesign
column33:
The current stylized format for displaying App Activity needs a refresh to make it easier to understand and use by a user.

As such, we would like to redesign the display table for App Activity to condense information, put  date_time in a new column, add Status icon based on event_type & add View details in a new column that will open a dialog window to reveal the complete information pertaining to a specific App Activity event.

We would also like to add a filter based on platform_type:

# API
# Android
# iOS
# Web

!image-20230111-182022.png|width=1190,height=380!

----

h3. App Activity

!image-20230111-185646.png|width=1908,height=733!
column114:
# Separate Date from Description information into a new column
# Summarize event_description to fit within the bounds of the table design
# Add Status to event_type
## {color:#006644}*green*{color} checkmark:
!image-20230111-185907.png|width=16,height=16!
→ successful/completed/confirmed
## {color:#0747a6}*blue*{color} exclamation point:
!image-20230111-190004.png|width=16,height=16!
→ started/initiated/in progress
## {color:#bf2600}*red*{color} x: 
!image-20230111-190153.png|width=16,height=16!
 → failed/error/unsuccessful
# Add a final column for View details to expand the event summary where applicable
## Add a filter symbol above the last column in the table header to filter based on platform type for Activity tab

column195:
20/Jan/23 9:43 AM;60aecdf01ee723006c2096b7;Suggestion for design: 

* Keep the tab style as-is: the same as the rest of the app.  
* Instead of having a “View details” show an icon with a “View Details” tooltip.  We should have the entire row show a highlight on hover and the details can show when clicking any part of the row.  This could eliminate the need for the “View Details” text or icon possibly.
* I suggest we have the columns go left to right this way: Status, Title, Date.  The most important info should be on the left, the Date doesn’t matter as much as the status or the title I would think. 
* Use the same icons as the “Build Status” cards.

[~accountid:625d95a16cb53d006a680656]
