column1: Show cost and timeline estimates  to all users in PRD tab before they have finalized pricing
column33:
*User Stories:* 

* If I am a user (self-serve or managed user) who does not have any finalized pricing in my Proposal tab:
** I should see the Basic App Cost, Customization Cost, and Estimated Delivery Timeline in my PRD tab, based on the PRD items.

*Self-serve user:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-11 at 2.52.11 PM.png|width=583,height=420!



*Managed user:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-11 at 2.53.06 PM.png|width=613,height=431!
column114:
* All users who do not have any pricing finalized in the Proposal tab should be able to see the following in their PRD tab, based on their PRD items:
** Basic App Cost
** Customization Cost (only if they have items in their PRD that do not have a price.)
** Estimated Delivery Timeline 
* Self-serve users can see the “Finalize with expert” button
** Managed users should not see the “Finalize with expert” button
column226: Reconciling PRD and Proposal tab cost and timelines

column1: Action - updateNavigation - Pressable codegen wraps `Pressable` on `Pressable` elements.
column33:
# When toggling “Pressable” in the Studio panel codegen wraps a {{Pressable}} component around the target node. This is problematic because screens that already have such elements get wrapped around new {{Pressable}} elements that are not styled and don’t include the other props. 

*Detect the target node type and only wrap Pressable when its other type of element. Otherwise extend the `onPress` of the existing element.*

2. Another related issue is that the navigation call disregards the component signature. If navigation is not one of the destructured props then it must be called from the single parameter in the signature (commonly it is named {{params}}, but one should read the name instead of assuming it). This means that it should generate {{params.navigation.navigate...}} instead of {{navigation.navigate...}}. 

3. Also noticed one output that nested navigation twice navigation.navigation.navigate. We need to make sure the operations are idempotent. *Add unit tests for this.*

4. Finally, when adding Pressable to nested components one must provide {{navigation}} as a prop on said component references so that it is made available as a prop in the target component/element.

*Codegen action:*

column1: Local python packages installation fail on deployment
column33:
When *deploying* django modules that look like this in the {{Pipfile}}:

{quote}{{cb-camera = {editable = true, path = "./modules/camera"}}}{quote}

The following error is raised in the logs:

{quote}raise ValueError(“Invalid path {0!r}”.format(value))
ValueError: Invalid path ‘./modules/camera’
The command ‘/bin/sh -c PIPENV_VENV_IN_PROJECT=1 pipenv install --deploy’ returned a non-zero code: 1{quote}

A local {{pipenv install}} has no issues so this might be an environment specific problem.

Create an APP

* Add Django module on Studio
* Deploy the app ( after the Module is installed )
* The deployment should succeed
* You should find the new Module's admin table on the Django Admin Panel of the App.Create an APP

column1: Setup Kubernetes for local testing.
column33:
Currently, we have most of our microservices containerized. With all the benefits of containerization, there are some challenges like how to integrate these microservices, auto-scaling, setting up dev env, etc

One of the challenges we’ve identified is integrating the lambda services with the main app - CB Dash. Since they need to run on the same network for communication to happen, this complicates the setup, and a lot of manual intervention is needed.

When Kubernetes comes into play, devs will only need to install Kubernetes CLI and everything else will be handled by Kubernetes.

This will standardize the testing environment, and setup method and decrease significantly the environment setup for new devs and existing devs, which leads to a more happy and productive engineering team.

This epic will have a collection of small achievable tasks and bugs to fix along the way until we have a stable local Kubernetes setup for CB dash.
The picture below summarises the major benefits of Kubernetes.

!Screenshot 2023-01-10 at 19.05.15.png|width=788,height=387!

More explanation [here|https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/containers-kubernetes/benefits-of-using-kubernetes]

column1: Modify FE to use the new endpoint that delete module files on repo
column33:
When deleting a screen type {{screen}} , instead of executing the uninstall endpoint, the new endpoint {{remove-screen}} should be executed.

As the deleted modules won’t be returned from the BE anymore (previously they were marked as deleted) we need to review the loadApp logic in order to have this into consideration.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
column114:
# When deleting a module all its files should be deleted from the Repo.
# Save App and Load App should work as before.

column1: SPIKE: Pulumi for Enterprises
column33:
In order to offer Enterprise Accounts as a cloud service offering (CB Enterprise Cloud) as well as self-hosted instance (CB Enterprise Server), we must build/spec an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) process.

As such, it is worthwhile for us to investigate our current Terraform implementation and whether it can sufficiently serve our goal of offering Enterprise Accounts via cloud through enterprise.crowdbotics.com &/or via self-hosted instance through their own servers.

column1: Restrict area for image cropping tool
column33:
As a follow-up to [https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-8316|https://crowdbotics.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-8316|smart-link], we must restrict the cropable area for each metadata field that requires an image to be uploaded in accordance with the specific submission guidelines set forth by App Store Connect & Google Play Console, respectively.

The submission guidelines for each metadata field requiring an image upload → [Enhanced Image Validation: App Store Connect vs. Google Play Store|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Enhanced-Image-Validation-App-Store-Connect-vs-Google-Play-Store-08823cb58ed941228e95a9e4d9b93928]

h3. Reference

!image-20230110-155942.png|width=248,height=203!

→ For example, using the reference above, the dimensions of the rectangular box for the App Icon field would be 1024x1024 for App Store Connect & 512x512 for Google Play Console

!Screenshot 2023-01-10 at 11.02.34 AM.png|width=622,height=225!
column114:
# Enhance the image crop tool used for uploading App Icon, Featured Graphic (Google Play Console only) & Screenshots (Mobile & Tablet) for both App Store Connect & Google Play Console tabs in accordance with each app store’s specific submission guidelines for each image upload metadata field, respectively.
## The croppable area should be set to the maximum pixel dimension allowed for each image upload metadata field as outlined in [Enhanced Image Validation: App Store Connect vs. Google Play Store|https://www.notion.so/crowdbotics/Enhanced-Image-Validation-App-Store-Connect-vs-Google-Play-Store-08823cb58ed941228e95a9e4d9b93928]

!image-20230110-184004.png|width=692,height=309!

column1: Send crash reports to customers
move FE outside django & serve as standalone application
column33:
In order to speed up the Dashboard, would it be possible to move the FE outside Django & serve the FE as a standalone application?

Would decoupling our FE from the BE effectively allow us to white-label the Dashboard for Enterprise Accounts?
column193:
10/Jan/23 10:46 AM;625d95a16cb53d006a680656;Aline mentioned this a while back

potentially serving FE as a static page → gives the impression to the user that things are faster.

Per Dan, it is already separate with the exception of a few pages. 

Actually serve the site separately → if Django is going through heavy load time, FE would not be impacted (API would still be affected)

Won’t be able to use Django templates, audit logs, but would get multiple BEs.

column1: Failing git authentication on layout-editor lambda
column33:
The Layout Editor lambda requires github authentication for doing git push onto the user’s repos.

Authentication started failing with the following error:
[https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-1#logsV2:log-groups/log-group/$252Faws$252Flambda$252Fstaging-layout-editor/log-events/2023$252F01$252F09$252F$255B$2524LATEST$255Da5a01b03650f4d7d922f836650e527f5|https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-1#logsV2:log-groups/log-group/$252Faws$252Flambda$252Fstaging-layout-editor/log-events/2023$252F01$252F09$252F$255B$2524LATEST$255Da5a01b03650f4d7d922f836650e527f5]

{quote}Failed git authentication on: [https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/tst-daniel-databind-49740.git|https://github.com/crowdbotics-dev/tst-daniel-databind-49740.git|smart-link]{quote}

{{GITHUB_TOKEN}} value starts with {{ghp}}:
[https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/lambda/home?region=us-east-1#/functions/staging-layout-editor?tab=configure|https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/lambda/home?region=us-east-1#/functions/staging-layout-editor?tab=configure]

It is used here:
[https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/index.js#L66|https://github.com/crowdbotics/layout-editor/blob/078f54b7a5b33e5beecdf782c835e55d813c0c1c/src/index.js#L66]

This may be related with the similar issue we had in {{dependency-runner}}:
[https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/GQWPU9JHZ/p1673028548756739|https://crowdbotics.slack.com/archives/GQWPU9JHZ/p1673028548756739|smart-link]

The above links are for staging, but we should check production too.

column1: Action - useSelector should be removed from code without databinding

Add screen 
Drop any Element on it and Make pressable 
Click on Params and Add data model {Login.email} and Save it.

Observe the Const Login
Now Remove the Element from the screen and save it
Go to the View Code and Observe 
The Const Should Also Be Get deleted from the code

column1: Moving a parent task to another milestone doesn't update its subtasks updated_on field
column33:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create 2 new Milestones
# Create a Task on the first and Subtasks
# Write down the last {{updated_on}} dates on the Subtasks (via API call is better {{api/v2/tasks/{ID}}})
# Move this Task to another Milestone
# Note that the {{updated_on}} dates have not changed, even though "milestone" has.

As we are changing the “Milestone“ foreign key of the subtasks we should have the {{updated_on}} field updated as well.

This impacts Marketplace Data Team as well since their pipelines only fetch rows when {{updated_on}} changes

column1: Design: Proposal tab price breakdown and highlighting modules with software
column33:
*Background:*

* We offer read-made-code (called modules) to customers who want to build an app with Crowdbotics. 
* We are charging a licensing price for the software (which is the licensing price for all modules added to their PRD). 
* Some PRD groups (i.e. individual milestones in the PRD backlog) have items that include modules.
** NOTE: The PRD tab already includes some stats on modules of code and time saved. So, we we should keep the style of displaying that information consistent.
*** [Link to PRD tab design|https://www.figma.com/file/wk28uzl3CdGSwRzztO7qoL/FTUE-V1?node-id=334%3A3743&t=1b4nEbU4Gvi5lgqU-4]

*Goal for this project:*

* We want to show the Software cost and Services cost items separately in the Proposal tab so that customers: (1) are aware that they are getting software out of the box, and (2) know how much the software (i.e. ready-made code) costs.
* We want to highlight which PRD groups and PRD items (i.e. expanded list inside) have modules (for e.g. with an icon)
* We want to communicate the value of getting the software briefly. 
** For example we can say something like “You’re getting 36 modules with ready-made code that will be available to you upon checkout. These modules save X weeks of development time and help build your app faster.”



*Here’s a very rough mock-up to show the type of info we want to add to the Proposal tab:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-12 at 8.52.04 AM.png|width=801,height=437!

 

*Comments:*

[~accountid:6176c92e20972200710c41b5] - The Proposal tab is already really cluttered. We need to redesign it in the future. For now, we need a design that conveys the info in a UX friendly manner without taking up too much space. Feel free to suggest alternative layouts!
column193:
18/Jan/23 4:21 AM;6176c92e20972200710c41b5;Hello Team. 

Here is a possible design for this ticket, that accomplishes all the requirements. 

I have to change the layout to show better al the information in a vertical UI.

As always, please let me know any feedback or changes that you think can help.

Thanks!



!Test 1.png|width=1507,height=767!
column226: Reconciling PRD and Proposal tab cost and timelines

column1: Hide cost and timeline from users who have completed checkout
column33:
*User stories:*

* If I am a user who has completed Checkout, then I should *not* see the following in my PRD tab:
** Software cost
** Timeline
** Your Build Plan Header
*** The description under “Your Build Plan” header
** I should only see the Better with Crowdbotics section in the right-hand panel of my PRD tab.

*Screenshot:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-11 at 3.30.30 PM.png|width=522,height=333!
column114:
If I am a user who has completed Checkout, then I should *not* see the following in my PRD tab:

* Software cost
* Timeline
* Your Build Plan Header
** description underneath - The estimates below can change if you add or remove features. For final pricing and timelines, get in touch with our experts.
* I should only see the Better with Crowdbotics section in the right-hand panel of my PRD tab.
column226: Reconciling PRD and Proposal tab cost and timelines

column1: Update feature price in PRD group after pricing is finalized in Proposal tab
column33:
*User stories:*

* I want the price column in my PRD tab to be updated after the pricing is finalized in my Proposal tab and the PRD version matches the one in the Proposal tab:
** I should see the price for a PRD group or PRD item that had “Needs estimation”
** I should see an updated price for any PRD groups or items where pricing has been updated in the Proposal tab.

*Screenshot:*

!Price.png|width=956,height=804!



*Conversation:*

* Do we have the foreign key between the PRD item and Proposal task? If so, then we can make the update.
column114:
If pricing is finalized in the Proposal tab and the PRD version matches the version in the Proposal tab, then:

* I should see a price for any PRD items or groups that previously had “Needs estimation” in the PRD tab.
* I should see an updated price for any PRD groups or items where pricing has been updated in the Proposal tab. 
* As before, pricing should only be visible and updated for self-serve users (i.e. free users who do not have a subscription).

column1: Reconciling PRD and Proposal tab cost and timelines
Add customization cost when PRD group or item needs estimation
column33:
* If I am as *self-serve user* and my PRD has custom features or custom PRD items that do not have a price available (or their price is 0), then I want to see a line item that says the following:
** Customization cost*: Contact us

*Screenshot:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-07 at 5.27.06 PM.png|width=695,height=495!
column114:
* The customization cost line item is is only visible *when I am a self-serve user and*:
**  The price for a PRD group “Needs estimation” (i.e. price is 0 or not available)
** An item inside a PRD group or module “Needs estimation” (i.e. price is not available).
* Don’t show the “Customization Cost*: Contact us” line item if all the PRD groups and modules have a price (i.e. price > 0).
* *Don’t show the “Customization Cost*: Contact us”  if I am a managed user.*

column1: Update CircleCI keys/vars
column33:
[https://circleci.com/blog/january-4-2023-security-alert/|https://circleci.com/blog/january-4-2023-security-alert/|smart-link]

----

*Shashank Sinha*  

Should we rotate keys for GCP deployments for customer apps that's being triggered via circle?

*Saurav Gharti Magar*  
We have several keys which we add on circle, we should rotate those as well.

*Dan DeFelippi*  
Yes. Seems like we’ll have to make a script to mass update them.

*Shashank Sinha*  

{quote}_Additionally, if your project uses Project API tokens, we have invalidated those and you will need to replace them. You can find_ [_more information on how to do that in our documentation here_|https://circleci.com/docs/managing-api-tokens/#rotating-a-project-api-token]{quote}

It seems some of them are already gone.

*Saurav Gharti Magar*  
yes seems like it. Should recreate API tokens for the circle.

*Saurav Gharti Magar*  

+Vars we want to update:+
FASTLANE_SESSION
FASTLANE_USER
FASTLANE_PASSWORD
FASTLANE_APPLE_APPLICATION_SPECIFIC_PASSWORD
MATCH_PASSWORD

GITHUB_WRITE_TOKEN

WEBHOOK_API_KEY

APPETIZE_API_TOKEN
ANDROID_KEYSTORE
GOOGLE_PLAY_CONSOLE_API_KEY
MYAPP_UPLOAD_KEY_ALIAS
MYAPP_UPLOAD_KEY_PASSWORD
MYAPP_UPLOAD_STORE_PASSWORD
MYAPP_UPLOAD_STORE_FILE

GCLOUD_SERVICE_KEY
and GITHUB SSH KEY (edited) 

*Shashank Sinha*  
Can we extract the list of GCP apps which is already integrated with CB dash?

*Saurav Gharti Magar*  
Yes, we can query the database to get that

column1: Add range for app cost and estimated timeline
column33:
*User stories:*

* As a user, I want to see a range for the “Basic App Cost” in my PRD tab, right hand panel:
** The lower range value is the sum of the cost of all modules in PRD tab.
** The upper range value is 50% inflated cost of the lower range value (e.g. Upper range is 60,00 if the lower range is 40,000)
*** Upper range value = Lower range value + (lower range value * 0.5).
* I want to see a range for the “Estimated Delivery Timeline” in my PRD tab:
** The lower range should be in weeks, as usual
*** Upper range timeline = Lower range timeline + (lower range timeline * 0.5).

*Screenshot:*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-07 at 5.20.18 PM.png|width=692,height=495!
column114:
* Basic app cost should be a range, where:
** The lower range value is the sum of the cost of all modules (aka PRD items) in the PRD.
** Upper range value = Lower range value + (lower range value * 0.5).
*** There should be an asterisk after “Basic app cost*”
* Estimated timeline should be a range:
** The lower range should be in weeks, as usual
*** Upper range timeline = Lower range timeline + (lower range timeline * 0.5).

column226: New UI / UX for PRD tab

column1: Update cost and timeline in PRD when proposal estimates are finalized but client did not checkout
column33:
*User stories:*

* If pricing in my Proposal tab was finalized *and* I did not Checkout, then I want the cost and timeline in my PRD tab to be updated to the following:
** Total cost should show the total cost of the app.
** “Estimated Delivery Timeline” should show delivery timeline in weeks, based on delivery estimates from the Proposal tab.
** If a Sales rep clicks “Undo Pricing”, then:
***  show the Basic app cost, customization cost, and estimated timeline based on the PRD item until the pricing is finalized again.

*Screenshot after price and timeline are finalized by BAs*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-11 at 11.50.30 AM.png|width=606,height=428!
column114:
* If the “Finalize Pricing” button in the Proposal tab is clicked:
** Replace “Basic App Cost”, “Customization Cost” and “Estimated Delivery Timeline” with “Software cost”, “Services Cost” and updated “Estimated Delivery Timeline” from the Proposal tab.
** Software cost = sum of the licensing price of all code modules
** Services cost = Total cost in Proposal tab - Software cost
** “Estimated Delivery Timeline” should show delivery timeline in weeks, based on delivery estimates from the Proposal tab.
* Only show Software cost, Services cost, Estimated Delivery Timeline for clients who have a finalized pricing in their Proposal tab but have not completed checkout.
column226: Reconciling PRD and Proposal tab cost and timelines

column1: Add first name and last name fields during sign up
column33:
*User Stories:*

* As a user who is signing up to the Crowdbotics platform, I want to see fields for entering my First Name and Last Name.
** First Name and Last Name should be required fields.

h3. Context

* We need to collect a user’s first name and last name to make it easier for Sales and marketing to reach out the new customer and personalize their reach out emails and calls. This is an urgent update for FTUE.
* Do we collect the user’s first name and last name if they sign up via Google or Github?



*Screenshot*

!Screen Shot 2023-01-06 at 9.54.23 AM.png|width=692,height=468!
column114:
* User is prompted to enter their first name and last name separately once they sign up to Crowdbotics platform.
** First name and last name are required fields.
** Store user’s first name and last name if they opt for Google signup or Github signup (not sure if we can do this for Github?)
